name: oisafe
message: Moved auto locking to new AutoLockService classssTotally gutted ServiceDispatchImpl and moved all auto lock aspects to new class AutoLockServices which is now started upon successful unlocking in AskPassword.  Hopefully this will be the nail in the coffin of not having a service running after an unlock.  Plus this makes the auto lock process more straight forward.ssStill need to clean up IntentHandler to no longer have a service at all.s

title: Merge xxxDistribution and xxxDistributionImpl in package distribution
description: This ticket follows the general trend aiming at removing unnecessary interfaces. In this packages the concerned interfaces ares(/) {{BetaDistribution}}: done in r1205739s(/) {{BinomialDistribution}}: done in r1205963s(/) {{CauchyDistribution}}: done in r1206053s(/) {{ChiSquaredDistribution}}: done in r1206060s(/) {{ExponentialDistribution}}: done in r1206399s(/) {{FDistribution}}: done in r1206399s(/) {{GammaDistribution}}: done in r1206399s(/) {{HypergeometricDistribution}}: done in r1206406s(/) {{KolmogorovSmirnovDistribution}}: done in r1206425s(/) {{NormalDistribution}}: done in r1206421s(/) {{PascalDistribution}}: done in r1206421s(/) {{PoissonDistribution}}: done in r1206434s(/) {{TDistribution}}: done in r1206434s(/) {{WeibullDistribution}}: done in r1206434s(/) {{ZipfDistribution}}: done in r1206451sCorresponding implementations {{xxxDistributionImpl}} will be renamed {{xxxDistribution}}.

name: oisafe
message: Completely refactored the import and backup threads.  Lint wasscomplaining about the Handler class should be static or leakssmight occur.   Switched to using AsyncTask.ssIt's actually more resilent to the Activity lifecycle.   Beforesthe onPause() would try to cancel the background thread.  Now itsuses a static to keep track of the AsyncTask.  Perhaps that shouldsbe in a bundle?ssBut now lint is perfectly happy with CategoryList.javas

name: CommonsMath
message: Corrected to camelCase some method names (MATH-677).ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@1208293 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: About package \transform\""
description: Classes in package \o.a.c.m.transform\" might require some changes in order to conform to goals set for the next major release.ssSome observations:s# Exceptions {color:red}done (see below){color}s## Should remove use of deprecated \"MathRuntimeException\"s## Should throw more specific \"Math...Exception\" instances instead of standard IAEs# Interface \"RealTransformer\" (and implementations) contain non-conformant method names (e.g. \"inversetransform\" instead of \"inverseTransform\"). {color:red}Fixed in {{r1208293}}.{color}s# \"FastFourierTransformer\":s## Methods \"mdfft\" and \"verifyDataSet\" take an argument of type \"Object\" (to allow an argument with an unspecified number of dimensions)s## The \"RootsOfUnity\" helper class could be moved to the \"complex\" package. {color:red}Done in {{r1238898}}{color}.s## For claritys multidimensional transform should be moved to a class of its own (and I also wonder whether the \"MultiDimensionalComplexMatrix\" name is not misleading)s# \"FastFourierTransformer\"s \"FastSineTranformer\" and \"FastCosineTranformer\" define public methods \"tranform2\" and \"inversetransform2\" but they are not part of an interface. {color:red}As of {{r1213157}}s these methods have been removeds and replaced by factory methods {{create()}} and {{createUnitary()}} (FFT) or {{createOrthogonal()}} (FCTs FST).{color}s# Code uses variables that start with an uppercase. {color:red}Fixeds together with various formatting issues.{color}s# \"FastHadamardTransformer\" contains illegible developer documentation (see Javadoc for protected method \"fht\"). {color:red}Tried to improve things in {{r1208986}}s but things are still a bit obscure. Besidess the link provided is broken. Will look into that.{color}"

message: added a new DenseRealMatrix class intended to replace RealMatrixImplsthis class is more cache-friendly as it stores data from squares blockssin flattened arrays. name: ant-ivy
message: NEW: Add transitive dependency version and branch override mechanism (IVY-784) (not completed yet)sFIX: Compatibility with maven's dependencyMangement (IVY-753) (not completed yet)ssSyntax for IVY-784 still needs to be cleared out. Then I need to update documentations xml module descriptor writer and updater. For IVY-753 to be fully completeds update of xml module descriptor writer still need to be achieved to be able to use converted pom file from cache.ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@640488 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Compatibility with maven's dependencyMangement||Add transitive dependency version and branch override mechanism
description: Maven supports a dependencyManagement section in the parent pom which allows one to override versions of boths direct and transitives dependencies. Ivy currently lacks such a support. A discussion about this issue can be found here: http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/ant-ivy-user/200802.mbox/%3c20080226184625.7decc0cd@sbs173%3es||Maven since version 2.0.6 supports a mechanism for a pom to override the version constraint of a transitive dependency (dependency management is used for that). IVY-753 has been opened to make Ivy compatible with thats so to fix this we will need to introduce a new mechanism to Ivys which would better be available to users using Ivy native format (ivy xml files). Supporting branch override too seems to be a natural fit for Ivy in this case.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-261: Reinitialized servers should not participate in leader electionssAuthor: Brian Nixon <nixon@fb.com>ssReviewers: Michael Han <hanm@apache.org>s Edward Ribeiro <edward.ribeiro@gmail.com>s benjamin reed <breed@apache.org>ssCloses #120 from enixon/ZOOKEEPER-261s
title: Reinitialized servers should not participate in leader election
description: A server that has lost its data should not participate in leader election until it has resynced with a leader. Our leader election algorithm and NEW_LEADER commit assumes that the followers voting on a leader have not lost any of their data. We should have a flag in the data directory saying whether or not the data is preserved so that the the flag will be cleared if the data is ever cleared.sssHere is the problematic scenario: you have have ensemble of machines As Bs and C. C is down. the last transaction seen by C is z. a transactions z+1s is committed on A and B. Now there is a power outage. B's data gets reinitialized. when power comes back ups B and C comes ups but A does not. C will be elected leader and transaction z+1 is lost. (notes this can happen even if all three machines are up and C just responds quickly. in that case C would tell A to truncate z+1 from its log.) in theory we haven't violated our 2f+1 guarantees since A is failed and B still hasn't recovered from failures but it would be nice if when we don't have quorum that system stops working rather than works incorrectly if we lose quorum.

name: CommonsMath
message: [MATH-156] use initial guess provided by the caller to BrentSolver.solve()ssthus improving speedssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/math/trunk@536283 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Brent solver is non-optimals because it doesn't use the user's guess.
description: Hi guyss I noticed that your brent solver isn't using the initial guess given by the user. This can often radically improve the performance of the solver. In my testss it improved it by roughly 30% or mores with a decent guess. Basicallys we should try the guess first. If that's close enoughs rreturn it. Otherwises try one of the end points. If that's close enoughs return it. Then if that bracketss go into the main loop. If that doesn't brackets then we instead try the other endpoint. If that's close enoughs return it. If that doesn't brackets throw an exception. If it does brackets go into the main loop with all three trial points availables allowing the quadratic interpolation to be used immediately.ssWorst case scenarios the initial guess doesn't bracket. In that case it is better than the default algorithm only if the user's initial guess is better than linear interpolations which I imagine it almost always would be. If the user can't guess better than linear interpolations presumably they wouldn't provide a guess at alls and then nothing would change.ssIt's a small additions less than 100 lines of code. I can't send it in due to legal at works but from the above ideass you should be able to put it in easily. One caveat. You may need to slightly modify the baisic solve(doubles double) method to linearly interpolate a good beginning point and then break out a six double (solve(x0s y0s x1s y1s x2s y2)) method that both solve(mins max) and solve(mins maxs initial) can use. If you don't do thiss then solve(mins max) will bisect on its first iteration rather than intepolatings which could cost performance. If you do break it out like sos then this will always perform better than the current implementation.ssAs a good case studys here's our situation from work. ssWe are trying to compute a roots we know it falls in a VERY large interval (in this case -1.0 to 1.0)s but more than 99% of the time it will be between (say) 1.04 and 1.07. We can guess with stunning accuracys at least 90% of the time we can come to within 10^-4 for very little cost (a very nice cubic approximation of the more complicated function)s but  we really need it to within 10^-8 or better. In additions that 1% of the times it can fall in very strange areas (0.9s or -0.3 or so)s and our guess isn't very good when that happens. So we can't tighten down the intervals because that would cause spurious errorss and at the same time your linear interpolation isn't going to be very good at all. It easily takes you 3 or 4 steps to get as close as our first guess. Using the first guess in this manner would cut the steps to convergence from about 8-10 to about 3-5. A speed up of around 100%s with no loss in accuracy.ss

title: Allow using a custom root-finding algorithm to detect state events
description: When using an ODEIntegrators event handlers can be added. The event handlers result in the construction of an EventState instance. Internallys that class uses a hard-coded instance of BrentSolver as root-finding algorithm. It should be possible to provide a custom root-finding algorithm to detect state events.

title: Patch: Add more MDC support to XMLLayout and PatternLayout
description: The attached zip file contains some patch filess and some additional files swhich extend some classes to supports or to extend support for MDC.ssGeneral Changes:ss* XMLLayout now includes any MDC details by encoding in CDATA sections MDC sKey/Value pairs.ss* PatternLayout - the %X option used to require a secondary option to indicate swhich key to output.  This option is now no longer requireds and if not sspecifieds then ALL the MDC Key/Value pairs are output using a format similar sto Hashtable.toString( e.g.\{{key1sval1}s{key2sval2}}\")ssNotes:s======s* The patch-dtd-mdcextensions.txt patches the log4j.dtd to allow an log4j:event sto include MDC details.  This DTD change may not be entirely the way we want to sgos and I would appreciate someone with XML experience looking over it a bit smore thoroughly as I was not able to test the change as much as I would like.ss* patch-src-*.txt - patches XMLLayouts PatternParsers and PatternLayout to senable MDC to appears or to provide additional support.ss* patch-test-*.txt - patches some Test case files to validate the source changesss* pattern.mdc.1.properties - a tests/input property file to configure a Test scasess* patternLayout.mdc.1 - witness file for the PatternLayout change & test casesss* xmlLayout.mdc.* - witness files for the XMLLayout change & test casesss* Chainsaw has _NOT_ been modified to read in the MDC details from a standalone sXML file.  My home computer was having a Blue Screen of Death everytime sChainsaw started ups so I was not able to even start on that change.  Hope to saddress that @ work during the week."

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-368. Observers: core functionality (henry robinson via mahadev)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/trunk@881882 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Observers: core functionality
description: Edit (Henry Robinson/henryr) 12/11/09:ssThis JIRA specifically concerns the implementation of non-voting peers called Observerss their documentation and their tests. ssExplicit goals are 1. not breaking any current ZK functionalitys 2. enabling at least one deployment scenario involving Observerss 3. documentation describing how to use the feature and 4. tests validating the correct behaviour of 2. ssNon goals of this JIRA are 1. performance optimizations specific to Observerss 2. compatibility with every feature of ZooKeeper (in particular all leader election protocols)s which are both to be addressed in future JIRAs. ssSee http://wiki.apache.org/hadoop/ZooKeeper/Observers for more detail of use casess proposed design and usage.ssSee http://wiki.apache.org/hadoop/ZooKeeper/Observers/ReviewGuide for a brief commentary on the current patch. ss-------------ssCurrentlys all servers of an ensemble participate actively in reaching agreement on the order of ZooKeeper transactions. That iss all followers receive proposalss acknowledge thems and receive commit messages from the leader. A leader issues commit messages once it receives acknowledgments from a quorum of followers. For cross-colo operations it would be useful to have a third role: observer. Using Paxos terminologys observers are similar to learners. An observer does not participate actively in the agreement step of the atomic broadcast protocol. Insteads it only commits proposals that have been accepted by some quorum of followers.ssOne simple solution to implement observers is to have the leader forwarding commit messages not only to followers but also to observerss and have observers applying transactions according to the order followers agreed upon. In the current implementation of the protocols howevers commit messages do not carry their corresponding transaction payload because all servers different from the leader are followers and followers receive such a payload first through a proposal message. Just forwarding commit messages as they currently are to an observer consequently is not sufficient. We have a couple of options:ss1- Include the transaction payload along in commit messages to observers;s2- Send proposals to observers as well.ssNumber 2 is simpler to implement because it doesn't require changing the protocol implementations but it increases traffic slightly. The performance impact due to such an increase might be insignificants though.ssFor scalability purposess we may consider having followers also forwarding commit messages to observers. With this options observers can connect to followerss and receive messages from followers. This choice is important to avoid increasing the load on the leader with the number of observers. ss

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2719: Pull changes for TTL Nodes into 3.5 branchssThis PR cherry-picks changes for TTL nodes (ZOOKEEPER-2169) and the CLI for it (ZOOKEEPER-2608) into branch-3.5.ssAuthor: randgalt <jordan@jordanzimmerman.com>ssReviewers: Michael Han <hanm@apache.org>s Camille Fournier <camille@apache.org>ssCloses #192 from Randgalt/ZOOKEEPER-2719 and squashes the following commits:ss6343001 [randgalt] Added ttl option to CLI create commands39b969b [randgalt] Removed bogus imports64f77a5 [randgalt] cleaned up some doc merge issuess66fdccb [randgalt] This patch takes advantage of 3.5's container support. Most of the work needed to support TTLs is there already. In order not to break on-disk and protocol compatibility the ephemeralOwner is yet-again overloaded to have special meaning. New opcodes and transaction records had to be added in a similar manner to Containerss
title: Enable creation of nodes with TTLs||Create CLI option for TTL ephemerals
description: As a users I would like to be able to create a node that is NOT tied to a session but that WILL expire automatically if action is not taken by some client within a time window.ssI propose this to enable clients interacting with ZK via http or other \thin clients\" to create ephemeral-like nodes.ssSome ideas for the designs up for discussion:ssThe node should support all normal ZK node operations including ACLss sequential key generations etcs howevers it should not support the ephemeral flag. The node will be created with a TTL that is updated via a refresh operation. ssThe ZK quorum will watch this node similarly to the way that it watches for session liveness; if the node is not refreshed within the TTLs it will expire.ssQUESTIONS:ss1) Should we let the refresh operation set the TTL to a different base value?s2) If sos should the setting of the TTL to a new base value cause a watch to fire?s3) Do we want to allow these nodes to have children or prevent this similar to ephemeral nodes?ss||Need to update CreateCommand to have the TTL node option"

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2006. Standalone mode won't take client port from dynamic config. (Hongchao Deng via Alex Shraer)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.5@1618978 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Standalone mode won't take client port from dynamic config
description: When clientPort is specified in the new formats using \server.x=host:port1:port2;clientPort\" in either static or dynamic file and without a \"clientPort = xxxx\" statements a standalone mode server doesn't set up client port. ssA second problem is that zkServer.sh looks for the client port in both static and dynamic filess but when looking in the static files it only looks for the \"clientPort\" statements so if its specified in the new format the port will be missed and commands such as \"zkServer.sh status\" will not work. This is a problem for standalone modes but also in distributed mode when the server is still LOOKING (once a leader is established and the server is LEADING/FOLLOWING/OBSERVINGs a dynamic file is created and the client port will be found by the script).ssReview Board:shttps://reviews.apache.org/r/24786/"

name: log4j
message: Bug 32064: Temporarily disabling Thai locale test to avoid Gump failuresssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/log4j/trunk@311124 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Specify TimeZone in date patterns DateFormat simplificiation
description: Seeshttp://nagoya.apache.org/eyebrowse/ReadMsg?listName=log4j-dev@logging.apache.org&msgNo=7803sand following for the back story.sssThe attached patch:ssAdds a TimeZone and Locale attribute for PatternLayout allowing date formattingsto arbitrary time zones and locales.ssGreatly simplified the nearly obsoletesorg.apache.log4j.helpers.AbsoluteDateFormats ISO8601DateFormat andsDateTimeDateFormat by making the extensions of SimpleDateFormat.  These classesshad complicated and flawed caching code that would have interfered with supportsfor multiple time zones.ssAdds a CachedDateFormat class that wraps arbitrary DateFormat's and will attempt sto reuse the result from a previous formatting request.  Same concept as thesflawed caching code in the previous classes.ssRemoved the JavaDoc in PatternLayout that strongly recommended %d{ISO8601} andssimilar over %d{yyyy-MM-dd HH:mm:ss} for performance reasons.  The performancesbenefit apparently came from the caching code that has not been used for some time.ssModified DatePatternConverter to use CachedDateFormat.  This had the effect ofsreducing the performance benchmark involving date formatting to a null appendersfrom 30 ms to 23 ms.ssAdded a test (test15) to PatternLayoutTest to check the effectiveness ofsspecifying TimeZone and Locale in configuration. stests/input/patternLayout15.properties is ansexample of the use.ssAdded tests for CachedDateFormat and the other DateFormat's insorg.apache.log4j.helpers.  The tests of the obsolete date formats now aresoverkill since they were attempting to identify the bugs in the previoussimplementations.

name: ant-ivy
message: FIX: Maven scope defined in POM dependencyManagement section not honoured (IVY-811)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@658922 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Maven scope defined in POM dependencyManagement section not honoured
description: When resolving dependencies from Maven POMss Ivy seems to ignore the dependency scopes as defined in the dependencyManagement section. For example when our project imports the org.picocontainer#picocontainer;1.2 projects Ivy considers xpp3#xpp3 and xstream#xstream as normal dependenciess while picocontainer-parent only includes them on test scope.ssI will attach the picocontainer POMs and the generated Ivy file to show what happens.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-127.  Use of non-standard election ports in config breaks servicessssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/trunk@700714 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Use of non-standard election ports in config breaks services
description: In QuorumCnxManager.toSend there is a call to create a connection as follows:s    channel = SocketChannel.open(new InetSocketAddress(addrs port));ssUnfortunately \addr\" is the ip address of a remote server while \"port\" is the electionPort of *this* server.sAs an examples given this configuration (taken from my zoo.cfg)s  server.1=10.20.9.254:2881s  server.2=10.20.9.9:2882s  server.3=10.20.9.254:2883sServer 3 was observed trying to make a connection to host 10.20.9.9 on port 2883 and obviously failing.ssIn tests where all machines use the same electionPort this bug would not manifest itself."

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1097. Quota is not correctly rehydrated on snapshot reload (camille via henryr)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1139494 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Quota is not correctly rehydrated on snapshot reload
description: traverseNode in DataTree will never actually traverse the limit nodes properly.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2141. ACL cache in DataTree never removes entriess(Adam Milne-Smith via camille)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1736259 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: ACL cache in DataTree never removes entries
description: The problem and potential solutions are discussed in http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/zookeeper-user/201502.mbox/browserssI will attach a proposed patch in due course.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1573. Unable to load database due to missing parent node (Vinayakumar B via phunts fpj)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1566739 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Unable to load database due to missing parent node
description: While replaying txnlog on data trees the server has a code to detect missing parent node. This code block was last modified as part of ZOOKEEPER-1333. In our productions we found a case where this check is return false positive.ssThe sequence of txns is as follows:sszxid 1:  create /prefix/aszxid 2:  create /prefix/a/bszxid 3:  delete /prefix/a/bszxid 4:  delete /prefix/assThe server start capturing snapshot at zxid 1. Howevers by the time it traversing the data tree down to /prefixs txn 4 is already applied and /prefix have no children. ssWhen the server restore from snapshots it process txnlog starting from zxid 2. This txn generate missing parent error and the server refuse to start up.ssThe same check allow me to discover bug in ZOOKEEPER-1551s but I don't know if we have any option beside removing this check to solve this issue.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2692: Fix race condition in testWatchAutoResetWithPendingssWe occasionally run into an issue with testWatchAutoResetWithPending where we get flaky test behavior due to not being able to reliably predict when the client has received notification from each watch that may be fired (perhaps due to resource contention on the box running the tests). This patch works around that by waiting for a one second quiet periods after which we can more safely assume all watches that will be fired have been fired.ssHere is an example of the test failure: https://builds.apache.org/job/ZooKeeper-trunk-jdk8/935/ssAuthor: Abraham Fine <abefine@cloudera.com>ssReviewers: Michael Han <hanm@apache.org>ssCloses #171 from afine/ZOOKEEPER-2692ss(cherry picked from commit 1912fa8d63e6bbfdb5bb96bec85efa7c94e131e9)sSigned-off-by: Michael Han <hanm@apache.org>s
title: Fix race condition in testWatchAutoResetWithPending

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1361. Leader.lead iterates over 'learners' set without proper synchronisation (henryr via camille)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1294000 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Leader.lead iterates over 'learners' set without proper synchronisation
description: This block:ss{code}sHashSet<Long> followerSet = new HashSet<Long>();sfor(LearnerHandler f : learners)s    followerSet.add(f.getSid());s{code}ssis executed without holding the lock on learnerss so if there were ever a condition where a new learner was added during the initial sync phases I'm pretty sure we'd see a concurrent modification exception. Certainly other parts of the code are very careful to lock on learners when iterating. ssIt would be nice to use a {{ConcurrentHashMap}} to hold the learners insteads but I can't convince myself that this wouldn't introduce some correctness bugs. For example the following:ssLearners contains As Bs Cs DsThread 1 iterates over learnerss and gets as far as B.sThread 2 removes As and adds E.sThread 1 continues iterating and sees a learner view of As Bs Cs Ds EssThis may be a bug if Thread 1 is counting the number of synced followers for a quorum counts since at no point was As Bs Cs Ds E a correct view of the quorum.ssIn practices I think this is actually oks because I don't think ZK makes any strong ordering guarantees on learners joining or leaving (so we don't need a strong serialisability guarantee on learners) but I don't think I'll make that change for this patch. Instead I want to clean up the locking protocols on the follower / learner sets - to avoid another easy deadlock like the one we saw in ZOOKEEPER-1294 - and to do less with the lock held; i.e. to copy and then iterate over the copy rather than iterate over a locked set.

name: CommonsMath
message: * Modified multiple regression newSample methods to ensure that by default in all casesss  regression models are estimated with intercept terms.  Prior to the fix for this issues s  newXSampleData(double[][])s newSampleData(double[]s double[][]) and s  newSampleData(double[]s double[][]s double[][]) all required columns of \1's\"s  to be inserted into the x[][] arrays to create a model with an intercept term;s  while newSampleData(double[]s ints int) created a model including an intercepts  term without requiring the unitary column.  All methods have  been changed tos  eliminate the need for users to add unitary columns to specify regression models.s* Improved javadocs* Improved testssJIRA: MATH-411ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/branches/MATH_2_X@993574 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s"
title: Multiple Regression newSampleData methods inconsistently create / omit intercepts
description: The newSampleData(double[]s nrowss ncols) method used in the unit tests adds a unitary column to the design matrixs resulting in an intercept term being estimated among the regression parameters.  The other newSampleData methods do not do thiss forcing users to add the column of \1\"s to estimate models with intercept.  Behavior should be consistent and users should not have to add the column."

name: CommonsMath
message: Made RandomDataImpl consistently use a Well generator as the default random generator. This completes the fix for JIRA: MATH-701.  The inconsistency was reported by Dennis Hendriks in JIRA: MATH-720.sssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@1213130 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: RandomDataImpl uses both JDKRandomGenerator and Well19937cs while contract/javadoc only specifies Well19937c.||Seeding a default RNG
description: See attached unit test. I create a distributions sample it (not printed)s set the seed to 0s and then print the next sample. I also create the same distribution agains set the seed to 0s and then print the next sample. I expect the same samples as in both cases the seed was set to 0s just before sampling. I however get this output:ss{code}s5s4s{code}ssThe problem is in the org.apache.commons.math.random.RandomDataImpl class:s - The RandomDataImpl(RandomGenerator rand) constructor states in javadoc: \@param rand the source of (non-secure) random data (may be nulls resulting in default JDK-supplied generator)\"s - reSeed(long seed) method does: if (rand == null) rand = new JDKRandomGenerator();s - reSeed() method does: if (rand == null) rand = new JDKRandomGenerator();s - class javadoc states: \"If no RandomGenerator is provided in the constructors the default is to use a Well19937c generator.\"s - getRan() does: if (rand == null) rand = new Well19937c(System.currentTimeMillis() + System.identityHashCode(this));s - getRan() states in javadoc: \"Creates and initializes a default generator if null. Uses a Well19937c generator with System.currentTimeMillis() + System.identityHashCode(this)) as the default seed.\"ssIt seems that only Well19937c should be useds but the constructor javadocs and the implementation of the reSeed methods was not updated to match this. I think the partial changes were done in MATH-701s more specificallys in commit [1197626] (and related commit [1197716]).||In \"RandomDataImpl\":s{code}sprivate RandomGenerator getRan() {s if (rand == null) {s rand = new JDKRandomGenerator();s rand.setSeed(System.currentTimeMillis());s }s return rand;s}s{code}sThe conditional branch is used by \"sample()\" in \"AbstractContinuousDistribution\".ssWhen several \"...Distribution\" objects are instantiated in a short time intervals they are seeded with the same value.s"

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2044: CancelledKeyException in zookeeper branch-3.4ssPatch from Germ√°n Blancos test case from Flavio.ssAuthor: Michael Han <hanm@apache.org>ssReviewers: Rakesh Radhakrishnan <rakeshr@apache.org>ssCloses #156 from hanm/ZOOKEEPER-2044 and squashes the following commits:ssf1f9790 [Michael Han] Use createZKClient to set session timeout value directly.s831e560 [Michael Han] Make test run faster by reducing client cnx timeouts; otherwise client will wait for server until session timeout because the channel has been closed on server side.s736091a [Michael Han] Address Rakesh's code review comments.sa220d95 [Michael Han] ZOOKEEPER-2044:CancelledKeyException in zookeeper 3.4.5. Patch from Germ√°n Blancos test case from Flavio.s
title: CancelledKeyException in zookeeper branch-3.4
description: I am getting cancelled key exception in zookeeper (version 3.4.5). Please see the log below. When this error is throwns the connected solr shard is going down by giving the error \Failed to index metadata in SolrsStackTrace=SolrError: HTTP status 503.Reason: {\"responseHeader\":{\"status\":503s\"QTime\":204}s\"error\":{\"msg\":\"ClusterState says we are the leaders but locally we don't think so\"s\"code\":503\"  and ultimately the current activity is going down. Could you please give a solution for this ?sssZookeper log s----------------------------------------------------------s2014-09-16 02:58:47s799 [myid:1] - INFO  [NIOServerCxn.Factory:0.0.0.0/0.0.0.0:2181:ZooKeeperServer@832] - Client attempting to renew session 0x24868e7ca980003 at /172.22.0.5:58587s2014-09-16 02:58:47s800 [myid:1] - INFO  [NIOServerCxn.Factory:0.0.0.0/0.0.0.0:2181:Learner@107] - Revalidating client: 0x24868e7ca980003s2014-09-16 02:58:47s802 [myid:1] - INFO  [QuorumPeer[myid=1]/0:0:0:0:0:0:0:0:2181:ZooKeeperServer@588] - Invalid session 0x24868e7ca980003 for client /172.22.0.5:58587s probably expireds2014-09-16 02:58:47s803 [myid:1] - INFO  [NIOServerCxn.Factory:0.0.0.0/0.0.0.0:2181:NIOServerCnxn@1001] - Closed socket connection for client /172.22.0.5:58587 which had sessionid 0x24868e7ca980003s2014-09-16 02:58:47s810 [myid:1] - ERROR [CommitProcessor:1:NIOServerCnxn@180] - Unexpected Exception:sjava.nio.channels.CancelledKeyExceptions        at sun.nio.ch.SelectionKeyImpl.ensureValid(SelectionKeyImpl.java:55)s        at sun.nio.ch.SelectionKeyImpl.interestOps(SelectionKeyImpl.java:59)s        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.NIOServerCnxn.sendBuffer(NIOServerCnxn.java:153)s        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.NIOServerCnxn.sendResponse(NIOServerCnxn.java:1076)s        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.NIOServerCnxn.process(NIOServerCnxn.java:1113)s        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.DataTree.setWatches(DataTree.java:1327)s        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.ZKDatabase.setWatches(ZKDatabase.java:384)s        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.FinalRequestProcessor.processRequest(FinalRequestProcessor.java:304)s        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.CommitProcessor.run(CommitProcessor.java:74)sss"

name: ant-ivy
message: IVY-1454 handle multi-threading (as opposed to only multi-process) case in lockingsssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@1552434 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: OverlappingFileLockException when using artifact-lock-nio
description: When trying to use {{artifact-lock-nio}} as the lock strategys I get resolve errors due to {{OverlappingFileLockException}} being thrown:ss{code}s[ivy:resolve] WARN: 	:: org.hamcrest#hamcrest-core;1.1: java.nio.channels.OverlappingFileLockException at sun.nio.ch.SharedFileLockTable.checkList(FileLockTable.java:255)s[ivy:resolve] WARN: 	:: org.glassfish#javax.ejb;3.1: java.nio.channels.OverlappingFileLockException at sun.nio.ch.SharedFileLockTable.checkList(FileLockTable.java:255)s[ivy:resolve] WARN: 	:: org.jboss.weld.se#weld-se-core;1.1.10.Final: java.nio.channels.OverlappingFileLockException at sun.nio.ch.SharedFileLockTable.checkList(FileLockTable.java:255)s{code}ssThe reason is probably related to our use of the {{<parallel>}} and {{<antcallback>}} tasks. The documentation of the {{antcallback}} task is here: http://ant-contrib.sourceforge.net/tasks/tasks/antcallback_task.htmls{code}s<parallel threadcount=\${tests.maxThreads}\">s	<antcallback target=\"testsomething\" return=\"tests.failed\"/>s	<antcallback target=\"testsomeother\" return=\"tests.failed\"/>s	<antcallback target=\"testsomemore\" return=\"tests.failed\"/>s</parallel>s{code}sAll the testxxx targets perform a resolve before running some junit tests in a separate vm. These resolve calls appear to cause the {{OverlappingFileLockException}}."

name: ant-ivy
message: merging IVY-1363sIVY-1359sIVY-1364: r1364410s1372594sssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/branches/2.3.x@1372609 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: buildlist task chokes on absolute path to parent Ivy module||ivy:buildlist task confused by extends feature using two parents||ivy.xml extends feature complains about Windows filesystem path
description: The ivy:buildlist Ant task is erroring when it encounters an absolute path to a parent Ivy module specified in the /ivy-module/info/extends element's location attribute. This problem is not unique to Ivy 2.3.0-rc1; I've seen it in Ivy 2.2.0. ssI can verify that the parent ivy.xml file is there at the specified path. If I specify a relative path to the parent ivy.xmls buildlist works.ssIn my test cases which I explain shortlys an absolute path for the extends attribute produces this error:s...\testAbsolutePathToParent\multimodule-build\build.xml:28: impossible to parse ivy file for ...\testAbsolutePathToParent\croatia\build.xml: ivyfile=...\testAbsolutePathToParent\croatia\ivy.xml exception=java.text.ParseException: Problem occurred while parsing ivy file: null in file:/.../testAbsolutePathToParent/croatia/ivy.xmls	at org.apache.ivy.ant.IvyBuildList.doExecute(IvyBuildList.java:215)s	at org.apache.ivy.ant.IvyTask.execute(IvyTask.java:277)s...sCaused by: java.text.ParseException: Problem occurred while parsing ivy file: null in file:/.../testAbsolutePathToParent/croatia/ivy.xmls	at org.apache.ivy.plugins.parser.xml.XmlModuleDescriptorParser$Parser.parse(XmlModuleDescriptorParser.java:301)s	at org.apache.ivy.plugins.parser.xml.XmlModuleDescriptorParser.parseDescriptor(XmlModuleDescriptorParser.java:116)s	at org.apache.ivy.plugins.parser.ModuleDescriptorParserRegistry.parseDescriptor(ModuleDescriptorParserRegistry.java:88)s	at org.apache.ivy.plugins.parser.AbstractModuleDescriptorParser.parseDescriptor(AbstractModuleDescriptorParser.java:48)s	at org.apache.ivy.ant.IvyBuildList.doExecute(IvyBuildList.java:207)s	... 35 moresCaused by: org.xml.sax.SAXException: Problem occurred while parsing ivy file: nulls...s--- Nested Exception ---sjava.text.ParseException: Problem occurred while parsing ivy file: null in file:/.../testAbsolutePathToParent/croatia/ivy.xmls	at org.apache.ivy.plugins.parser.xml.XmlModuleDescriptorParser$Parser.parse(XmlModuleDescriptorParser.java:301)s	at org.apache.ivy.plugins.parser.xml.XmlModuleDescriptorParser.parseDescriptor(XmlModuleDescriptorParser.java:116)s	at org.apache.ivy.plugins.parser.ModuleDescriptorParserRegistry.parseDescriptor(ModuleDescriptorParserRegistry.java:88)s...sCaused by: org.xml.sax.SAXException: Problem occurred while parsing ivy file: nullsjava.lang.NullPointerExceptions	at org.apache.ivy.plugins.parser.xml.XmlModuleDescriptorParser$Parser.startElement(XmlModuleDescriptorParser.java:386)s	at com.sun.org.apache.xerces.internal.parsers.AbstractSAXParser.startElement(AbstractSAXParser.java:506)s...sCaused by: java.lang.NullPointerExceptions	at org.apache.ivy.plugins.parser.xml.XmlModuleDescriptorParser$Parser.parseOtherIvyFile(XmlModuleDescriptorParser.java:659)s	at org.apache.ivy.plugins.parser.xml.XmlModuleDescriptorParser$Parser.extendsStarted(XmlModuleDescriptorParser.java:443)s	at org.apache.ivy.plugins.parser.xml.XmlModuleDescriptorParser$Parser.startElement(XmlModuleDescriptorParser.java:327)s	... 57 moressThis is what occurs when the haltOnError attribute is set to \true\" on ivy:buildlist. If I set haltOnError=\"false\" in my test cases the exception goes aways but I see the following build order:s1. croatias2. germanys3. irelands4. bootstrap-parents5. master-parentssWhat's wrong about this build order is that germany depends on ireland and croatia depends on master-parents in addition to extending its and yet germany comes before ireland and croatia comes before master-parent.ssThe roughly correct build orders as exhibited with a relative path to the parents is:s1. bootstrap-parents2. master-parents3. croatias4. irelands5. germanyssSos in addition to being incorrects this behavior is just plain inconsistent.ssTEST CASE INSTRUCTIONS:sI've attached a ZIP containing two standalone test casess each consisting of a suite of Ant projects that together comprise a multimodule build whose build order is to be determined by the ivy:buildlist task:s* testAbsolutePathToParent: The extends@location attribute uses an absolute path.s* testRelativePathToParent: The extends@location attribute uses an absolute path.ssWhen running Ant from one of these test casess you need to specify the location of the Ivy 2.3.0-rc1 installation using one of the following:s* an IVY_DIR environment variables* an env.IVY_DIR user propertys i.e. -Denv.IVY_DIR=...s* an ivy.dir user propertys i.e. -Divy.dir=...ssWhen running Ant for testAbsolutePathToParents you need to specify the absolute path to the BuildlistAndExtendsIntegrationTest/testAbsolutePathToParent/master-parent directory using either of the following:s* a MASTER_PARENT_DIR environment variables* an env.MASTER_PARENT_DIR user propertys i.e. -Denv.MASTER_PARENT_DIR=...ssTo run the build in either of these suitess go to the multimodule-build directorys and execute \"ant\" or \"ant init\"‚Äîwhile specifying the Ivy installation directory and the master-parent directory. You can also run \"ant cleancache\" to clear out the Ivy cache. Howevers you shouldn't need to do this regularly because each of these test cases uses its own dedicated Ivy cache.ssNOTE: This issue is broached in the email thread \"buildlist task chokes on absolute path to parent Ivy module\" on the ivy-user mailing list.||I'm finding that the ivy:buildlist Ant task is erroring when it encounters more than one parent Ivy module that's pulled in through the /ivy-module/info/extends element. This problem is new to Ivy 2.3.0-rc1; I did not encounter it with Ivy 2.2.0. There is no relationship or interaction between the two different parent Ivy moduless i.e. no nesting of parents.ssIn my test cases which I explain shortlys when I point the ivy:buildlist Ant task at a project stack that includes a mix of both parents and their childrens I see this error:s...\\multimodule-build\\build.xml:28: impossible to parse ivy file for ...\\testTwoParents\\germany\\build.xml: ivyfile=...\\testTwoParents\\germany\\ivy.xml exception=java.text.ParseException: Problem occurred while parsing ivy file: inconsistent module descriptor file found in 'file:/.../testTwoParents/master-parent/ivy.xml': bad module name: expected='bootstrap-parent' found='master-parent';  in file:/.../testTwoParents/germany/ivy.xmlssWhat's happening iss the germany module extends bootstrap-parents but somehow the relative path to master-parent/ivy.xml is supplanting the relative path to bootstrap-parent/ivy.xml. It appears buildlist doesn't know how to deal with more than one parent.ssThis is what occurs when the haltOnError attribute is set to \"true\" on ivy:buildlist. If I set haltOnError=\"false\" in my test cases the exception goes aways but I see the following build order:s1. germanys2. irelands3. bootstrap-parents4. master-parents5. croatiassWhat's wrong about this build order is that germany depends on ireland and ireland depends on bootstrap-parents so the order of the first three entries is reversed. If I removed the dependency of ireland on bootstrap-parents the order would be the same. This misordering is clearly related to the presence of more than one parent because comparable tests using (A) the extends feature with a single parent and (B) no extends feature at all get the order right. Pluss I see this unexpected output when haltOnError=\"false\":s[ivy:buildlist] 	=> adding it at the beginning of the paths[ivy:buildlist] 	=> adding it at the beginning of the pathssTEST CASE INSTRUCTIONS:sI've attached a ZIP containing three standalone test casess each consisting of a suite of Ant projects that together comprise a multimodule build whose build order is to be determined by the ivy:buildlist task:s* testNoParents: The extends feature is not used.s* testOneParent: The extends feature is used to pull in content from a single parent Ivy module.s* testTwoParents: The extends feature is used where one Ivy module pulls in content from one parent and two other Ivy modules pull in content from a different parent.ssThe testNoParents and testOneParent tests are the control groups. The testTwoParents test is where things fail.ssWhen running Ant from one of these test casess you need to specify the location of the Ivy 2.3.0-rc1 installation using one of the following:s* an IVY_DIR environment variables* an env.IVY_DIR user propertys i.e. -Denv.IVY_DIR=...s* an ivy.dir user propertys i.e. -Divy.dir=...ssTo run the build in any of these suitess go to the multimodule-build directorys and execute \"ant\" or \"ant init\"‚Äîwhile specifying the Ivy installation location. You can also run \"ant cleancache\" to clear out the Ivy cache. Howevers you shouldn't need to do this regularly because each of these test cases uses its own dedicated Ivy cache.ssNOTE: This issue is broached in the email thread \"extends & buildlist on 2.3.0-rc1 ‚Ä¶ it gets worse\" on the ivy-user and ant-dev mailing lists.||I'm trying to use the parent Ivy module feature through the /ivy-module/info/extends element:s  <info organisation=\"foo\" module=\"bar\" revision=\"1.0-SNAPSHOT\">s    <extends organisation=\"foo\" module=\"master-parent\" revision=\"1.0-SNAPSHOT\" s        location=\"${env.MASTER_PARENT_PROJECT_DIR}/ivy.xml\" extendType=\"configurations\" />s  </info>ssThe property placeholder in the location attribute translates to an absolute filesystem path. This works in a functional sense. Howevers I'm seeing the following false-positive warning messages apparently because I'm using a Windows filesystem path:s[ivy:resolve] :: problems summary ::s[ivy:resolve] :::: WARNINGSs[ivy:resolve]   Unable to parse included ivy file C:\\...\\master-parent/ivy.xml: unknown protocol: cs[ivy:resolve]s[ivy:resolve] :: USE VERBOSE OR DEBUG MESSAGE LEVEL FOR MORE DETAILSs sHere's the passage in XmlModuleDescriptorParser where this is arising:s            //check on filesystem based on location attribute (for dev ONLY)s            try {s                checkParentModuleOnFilesystem(location);s            } catch (IOException e) {s                Message.warn(\"Unable to parse included ivy file \" + location + \": \"s                    + e.getMessage());s            }s sI hope people can agree that showing users a misleading warning message every time they do an ivy:resolve is a bug worth resolving before there's a final 2.3.0 release."

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2014: Only admin should be allowed to reconfig a cluster.ssThis PR implements ZOOKEEPER-2014. For detailss please refer tossJIRA: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZOOKEEPER-2014sReview board: https://reviews.apache.org/r/51546/ssAuthor: Michael Han <hanm@cloudera.com>ssReviewers: fpj <fpj@apache.org>s breed <breed@apache.org>s rgs <rgs@itevenworks.net>ssCloses #96 from hanm/ZOOKEEPER-2014ss(cherry picked from commit 73e102a58d01b27bc6208bbfbde2d12f0deba1f4)sSigned-off-by: fpj <fpj@apache.org>s
title: Only admin should be allowed to reconfig a cluster
description: ZOOKEEPER-107 introduces reconfiguration support via the reconfig() call. We shoulds at the very leasts ensure that only the Admin can reconfigure a cluster. Perhaps restricting access to /zookeeper/config as wells though this is debatable. Surely one could ensure Admin only access via an ACLs but that would leave everyone who doesn't use ACLs unprotected. We could also force a default ACL to make it a bit more consistent (maybe).ssFinallys making reconfig() only available to Admins means they have to run with zookeeper.DigestAuthenticationProvider.superDigest (which I am not sure if everyone doess or how would it work with other authentication providers). ssReview board https://reviews.apache.org/r/51546/

description: If your Ivy file refers to 2 different revisions of the same modules the revisions in the delivered Ivy file are not correct.sSee http://www.jayasoft.org/node/610 for more info.

name: ant-ivy
message: FIX: Bad IvyContext scope causing memory leak and bad handling of subproject builds (IVY-639)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/ivy/core/trunk@594481 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Bad IvyContext scope causing memory leak and bad handling of subproject builds
description: Ivy relies on a mechanism of IvyContext to access to some contextual information without passing them throughout all methods parameters.ssThe problem is that only one context is attached to the current threads and it is never cleaned. This leads to two kind of problems:s- memory leaks which is the root cause of an issue reported in Ant:shttp://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=42742s- bad management of subprojectss in which the parent IvyContext is losed when the subproject starts. Details about this have been reported by Peter Reilly:shttp://www.nabble.com/use-of-IvyContext-tf4472787.html#a12752879ssThe solution to this problem is to use a stack of IvyContext rather than a single ones and push the context on each Ivy method calls and pop it at the end.

message: ZOOKEEPER-1181. Fix problems with Kerberos TGT renewal. (Eugene Koontz via mahadev) - Merging r1188033 from trunkssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.4@1188035 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Fix problems with Kerberos TGT renewal
description: Currentlys in Zookeeper trunks there are two problems with Kerberos TGT renewal:ss1. TGTs obtained from a keytab are not refreshed periodically. They should bes just as those from ticket cache are refreshed.ss2. Ticket renewal should be retried if it fails. Ticket renewal might fail if two or more separate processes (different JVMs) running as the same user try to renew Kerberos credentials at the same time. s

name: log4j
message: Bug 37282 - Add real unit test for SyslogAppenders fix and test for file descriptor leakssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/log4j/trunk@500483 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: SyslogAppender leaks descriptors
description: The attached patch for version 1.2.12 fixes two problems in sorg.apache.log4j.net.SyslogAppender.  Firsts it doesn't close the writer and as sa result leaks UDP sockets.  Seconds when logging an exceptions it assumes that sall lines after the first line start with a \t character.  If this is not the scases it removes the first character from the line (or throws an exception if sthe line is empty).ss--- SyslogAppender.java.orig    2005-10-25 15:50:35.000000000 -0400s+++ SyslogAppender.java 2005-10-25 15:19:57.000000000 -0400s@@ -121s8 +121s11 @@s  publics  void close() {s    closed = true; s-    // A SyslogWriter is UDP based and needs no opening. Hences its-    // can't be closed. We just unset the variables here.s+    try {s+       if (sqw != null) sqw.close();s+    } catch (Exception e) {s+       // ignore errors+    }s    sqw = null;s  }ss@@ -260s7 +263s15 @@s        if(len > 0) {s          sqw.write(s[0]);s          for(int i = 1; i < len; i++) {s-            sqw.write (TAB+s[i].substring(1));s+            if (s[i].length() > 0) {s+               if (s[i].charAt(0) == '\t') {s+                  sqw.write(TAB+s[i].substring(1));s+               } else {s+                   sqw.write(TAB+s[i]);s+               }s+            } else {s+               sqw.write(s[i]);s+            }s          }s        }s      }

message: clean up unused imports (thx to Jarkko Viinamaki in patch for VELOCITY-607)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/velocity/engine/trunk@685383 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Runtime macro rendering very slow in Velocity 1.6-dev (679708) compared to 1.5
description: The following test template (see VELOCITY-24):ss## local macros not globals#macro(letter $char)s    This is the letter $chars#endss#letter(\A\")s#letter(\"B\")s#letter(\"C\")s#letter(\"D\")s#letter(\"E\")s#letter(\"F\")s#letter(\"G\")s#letter(\"H\")s#letter(\"I\")s#letter(\"J\")s#letter(\"K\")s#letter(\"L\")s#letter(\"M\")s#letter(\"N\")s#letter(\"O\")s#letter(\"P\")s#letter(\"Q\")s#letter(\"R\")s#letter(\"S\")s#letter(\"T\")s#letter(\"U\")s#letter(\"V\")s#letter(\"W\")s#letter(\"X\")s#letter(\"Y\")s#letter(\"Z\")ss---ssWorks quickly and correctly with Velocity 1.5 with several concurrent threads. Howevers 1.6-dev is a LOT slower (even 20x).ssThe major performance bottlenecks seem to be:sRuntimeMacro.render (60% of time)sVelocimacroFactory.getVelocimacro (20% of time)ssWith several threads this test also causes Velocity to throw error(s):ssorg.apache.velocity.exception.MacroOverflowException: Exceed maximum 20 macro calls. Call Stack:letter->letter->letter->letter->letters	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.VelocimacroFactory.startMacroRendering(VelocimacroFactory.java:179)s	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.RuntimeInstance.startMacroRendering(RuntimeInstance.java:1693)s	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.VelocimacroProxy.render(VelocimacroProxy.java:200)s	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.directive.RuntimeMacro.render(RuntimeMacro.java:230)s	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.ASTDirective.render(ASTDirective.java:178)s	at org.apache.velocity.runtime.parser.node.SimpleNode.render(SimpleNode.java:323)s	at org.apache.velocity.Template.merge(Template.java:324)s	at org.apache.velocity.Template.merge(Template.java:232)s	at org.apache.velocity.test.load.Velocity24Test.testRendering(Velocity24Test.java:51)ssThis is related to VELOCITY-297 but the fix doesn't seem work with the new modified macro implementation.s"

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1246. Dead code in PrepRequestProcessor catch Exception block (camille)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1196025 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Dead code in PrepRequestProcessor catch Exception block
description: This is a regression introduced by ZOOKEEPER-965 (multi transactions). The catch(Exception e) block in PrepRequestProcessor.pRequest contains an if block with condition request.getHdr() != null. This condition will always evaluate to false since the changes in ZOOKEEPER-965.ssThis is caused by a change in sequence: Before ZK-965s the txnHeader was set _before_ the deserialization of the request. Afterwards the deserialization happens before request.setHdr is set. So the following RequestProcessors won't see the request as a failed one but as a Read requests since it doesn't have a hdr set.ssNotes:s- it is very bad practice to catch Exception. The block should rather catch IOExceptions- The check whether the TxnHeader is set in the request is used at several places to see whether the request is a read or write request. It isn't obvious for a newbys what it means whether a request has a hdr set or not.s- at the beginning of pRequest the hdr and txn of request are set to null. However there is no chance that these fields could ever not be null at this point. The code however suggests that this could be the case. There should rather be an assertion that confirms that these fields are indeed null. The practice of doing things \just in case\"s even if there is no chance that this case could happens is a very stinky code smell and means that the code isn't understandable or trustworthy.s- The multi transaction switch case block in pRequest is very hard to reads because it missuses the request.{hdr|txn} fields as local variables."

name: velocity
message: VELOCITY-621sAdded velocity-engine-slf4j module.ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/velocity/engine/trunk@1043096 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Update to SLF4J or workaround?
description: I know that it has been discussed one year ago in  VELOCITY-392ssbut there is need for at least a workaround for people who are forced to use slf4j.sFor example other frameworks did already switch like Hibernate.sSo there is now definitely need for something to enable Velocity to run without errors in a environment with log4j-over-slf4j.

title: Receipt of ACK from observer should not be logged as ERROR
description: Observers - in general - don't send ACKs. But a couple of times they need to. Currentlys these are all logged as an ERRORs which is wrong. They should at most be WARN (and this would probably be confusing to the user). INFO might be better.

message: Changed FractionFormat to extend NumberFormat.  JIRA: MATH-189ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@737572 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: FractionFormat should extend NumberFormat
description: Marked as 2.0; whenever this is done it can only be done with JDK5 compatibility without breaking the current API as certain methods that return Number in NumberFormat are defined (independently) in FractionFormat as returning Fraction.  JDK5's ability to narrow return types will sidestep what is currently a barrier.

name: velocity
message: VELOCITY-871: #foreach should work over any Iterable classsDonessgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/velocity/engine/branches/1.x@1718040 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: #foreach should work over any Iterable class
description: The current code was written before Java 1.5 added the {{Iterable}} classs so it tries to partially add support for it by invoking the {{iterator}} method through reflections but this doesn't work for inaccessible classes (see VELOCITY-870). Since 1.7 requires Java 1.5s we can check if the target object implements {{Iterable}} directly.

name: CommonsMath
message: MATH-521sChanged initial guess default values.sAdded test.sssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@1073796 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Changes in \HarmonicCoefficientsGuesser\""
description: (1) The \guess\" method throws \"OptimizationException\" when the algorithm fails to determine valid values for amplitude and angular frequency.sThere are no test showing how such a situation can occur.sMoreovers since this procedure is used to provide an initial guess to an optimizers it is better to pick any values for those parameters (e.g. zero) and let the optimizer proceed from that initial point.ss(2) The class javadoc seems very thorough in explaining the algorithms but is quite unreadable in the source codes making it fairly useless for checking how the code complies with the comments. I think that this explanation should go in the user guide (and leave a mostly \"plain text\" outline of the algorithms referring to the guide for details). [Does the format of the user guide allow such tricky (ASCII \"art\") constructs?]s"

name: ant-ivy
message: Attempt to fix IVY-764ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@656455 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: make it possible to specify permissions of published files for the SSH resolver
description: When we use the ssh resolver to publish artifacts to a repository on our servers the access permissions of the created files only allow reading by the user that published the artifacts. As a results no one else can get the artifacts from the repositorys which completely defeats it's  purpose.ssFile permissions look like this:s-rw-------  1 atu dev 875 Mar 10 12:34 core-20080310123411.jars-rw-------  1 atu dev  40 Mar 10 12:34 core-20080310123411.jar.sha1s-rw-------  1 atu dev  32 Mar 10 12:34 core-20080310123411.jar.md5s-rw-------  1 atu dev 166 Mar 10 12:34 ivy-20080310123411.xmls-rw-------  1 atu dev  40 Mar 10 12:34 ivy-20080310123411.xml.sha1s-rw-------  1 atu dev  32 Mar 10 12:34 ivy-20080310123411.xml.md5ssI could not find any way to configure or otherwise affect the file permissions. Is there a way? ssBTWs with Ivy 1.4.1 the permissions looked like this:s-rw-rw-r--  1 th  dev 877 Mar  6 10:08 core-20080306100813.jars-rw-rw-r--  1 th  dev  40 Mar  6 10:08 core-20080306100813.jar.sha1s-rw-rw-r--  1 th  dev  32 Mar  6 10:08 core-20080306100813.jar.md5s-rw-rw-r--  1 th  dev 166 Mar  6 10:08 ivy-20080306100813.xmls-rw-rw-r--  1 th  dev  40 Mar  6 10:08 ivy-20080306100813.xml.sha1s-rw-rw-r--  1 th  dev  32 Mar  6 10:08 ivy-20080306100813.xml.md5ssWe will now fall back to using Ivy version 1.4.1s for the time being.ss

message: Various OI apps: GCI task by Darriel: Update menu shortcuts to avoid conflict with Android 4.0 shortcuts. Fixes issue 436. http://www.google-melange.com/gci/task/view/google/gci2011/7184249 --------------- New shortcuts:ssOI NotePadsCTRL + S - SavesCTRL + W - Save AssDelete shortcut removedsCTRL + P - Preferences/SettingsssOI CountdownsChanged a CTRL+S to CTRL+P (everywhere one shortcut for settings)sRemoved the Delete shortcuts too.ssOI File ManagersChanged again S to P for Settings. Also noticed that there was a conflict with Include/Exclude Media Scan - they also use s  for shortcut. Now it should be OK.ssOI Safe (CategoryList.java)ssDEL_CATEGORY_INDEX - removed the CTRL-D shortcuts following the policy of \no delete shortcuts\".ssADD_CATEGORY_INDEX - possible conflict with default Android shortcuts - CTRL+A. No changes mades thoughs as I'm not absolutely sure it will conflict (not sure if android's \"select all\" is callable theres if there is nothing to select)ssOI Shopping ListssRemoved a delete shortcut. name: ant-ivy
message: IMPROVEMENT: Extend packager resolver to allow arbitrary ant tasks in build instructions (IVY-994) (thanks to Archie Cobbs) (merged from 2.0.0 branch)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@733947 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Extend packager resolver to allow arbitrary ant tasks in build instructions
description: Some software requires more than just moves copys unzips etc. in the packager resolver build instructions to build the software. E.g.s Javadoc can only be constructed by building it with ant.ssRequest extending packager resolver to support arbitrary build instructions. Do this via a new \restricted\" configuration attributes which when true (the default) reproduces the existing behaviors but when falses allows arbitrary ant tasks in the build instructions.ssSee attached patch for proposed implementation and documentation updates.ssBackground discussion: [here|http://www.nabble.com/Relaxing-allowed-ant-tasks-in-packager.xsl-td21305175.html].s"

title: Ivy should set the ${basedir} property
description: IvyDE doesn't specify the ${basedir} property when resolving the dependencies.sThis means that it's not possible to resolve jar files in a [project]/lib directory.ssFor instances the following resolver doesn't work:ss{code}s<filesystem name=\local-repository\">s      <artifact pattern=\"${ivy.project.dir}/lib/[artifact](-[revision]).[ext]\" />s</filesystem>s{code}ssMaarten"

message: MATH-602sInverse condition number.sssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@1157345 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Inverse condition number
description: In SingularValueDecompositionImpls the condition number is given as the ratio of the largest singular value to the smallest singular value. While this is the correct calculations because of concerns over rank deficiencys researchers have traditionally used the inverse of the condition number as a more stable indicator of rank deficiency.

name: ant-ivy
message: IMPROVEMENT: New text representation for main module metadata concepts (IVY-649)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/ivy/core/trunk@598722 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: New text representation for main module metadata concepts
description: Having a good and uniform text representation of concepts involved in Ivy would be helpful when discussing them in the mailing lists and documentation (or in console output).sssee http://www.nabble.com/vocabulary-and-text-representation-of-module-and-dependencies-tf4730034.html#a13525095ssConcerned text representations:s1) a module without revisions2) a module with revisions3) a module with (some) configurationss4) a module with revision and (some) configurationss5) a module's artifacts6) a module's artifact with revisionssAdopted text representations:s#1: org.apache.ant#ants#2: org.apache.ant#ant;1.7.0s#3: org.apache.ant#ant[masterscompilesbuild]s#4: org.apache.ant#ant;1.7.0[masterscompilesbuild]s#5: org.apache.ant#ant!ant.jar(source)s#6: org.apache.ant#ant;1.7.0!ant.jar(source)s

title: Fork Hadoop common's test-patch.sh and modify for Zookeeper
description: Zookeeper currently uses the test-patch.sh script from the Hadoop nightly dir.  This is now out of date.  I propose we just copy the updated one in Hadoop common and then modify for ZK.  This will also help as ZK moves out of Hadoop to it's own TLP.

name: ant-ivy
message: IMPROVEMENT: Ability to strip revConstraint attribute from delivered Ivy files (IVY-989)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@744568 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Ability to strip revConstraint attribute from delivered Ivy files
description: When a dynamic revision is used for dependenciess the delivered Ivy file will contain a revConstraint attribute in order to preserve what the original revision was set to. This is useful for rebuilding a project in order to pick up a more up to date release that satisfies the original dynamic range and for reporting purposes.ssThis works well for ranges but in some environments where a custom version matcher is useds the value of the revConstraint may not make sense in a delivered Ivy file that is to be placed into an enterprise repository. For such use-cases it would be good to have a way to disable the revConstraint for being written out into the delivered Ivy file.

message: ZOOKEEPER-2149 Logging of client address when socket connection established (Hongchao Deng via michim)sssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.5@1669063 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Logging of client address when socket connection established
description: When a socket connection is establisheds in ZooKeeperServers it would print logs:ss\Established session 0x$(session) with negotiated timeout $(timeout) for client: $(client_hostport)\"ssHowevers in clients it would only print the server address:s\"Socket connection established to $(server_hostport)s initiating session\"ssIt would be nice to log client local address when socket connection established. Because clients will reconnect and ports is randomly assigned. We can better associate these addresses in this way."

name: CommonsMath
message: Add an optimized dotProduct to OpenMapRealVector.sSlightly modified from contribution by Jake Mannix.sJIRA: MATH-317sssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@890159 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Perf improvement: OpenMapRealVector should iterate over smaller of two OMRVss and should call ArrayRealVector.getDataRef() when possible
description: In RealVector methods which take other RealVector parameterss OpenMapRealVector should check to see which vector has more entriess and iterate over the smaller of the twos when possible.  When the other vector is an ArrayRealVectors it should be explicitly cast to thiss and getDataRef() should be calleds to avoid an unnecessary and possibly large array copy.

name: ant-ivy
message: IMPROVE: ability to exclude the root project from the buildlist (thanks to Constantine Vetoshev) (IVY-124)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/ivy/trunk@484088 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Excluding the root project from the buildlist
description: I like to set up my project build to take different actions on the project's dependencies from the project itself. In other wordss I don't want to subant on a union of all of the project's dependencies and the project itself. So for example:ssproject-1 is standalonesproject-2 is standalonesproject-3 depends on project-1 and project-2ss... now returns {project-1sproject-2sproject-3}. I want it to return {project-1sproject-2}.ssThe patch below provides this functionality. It defines an attribute called \excluderoot\" on the buildlist tag and must be used in conjunction with the \"root\" attribute. \"excluderoot\" defaults to false. Continuing the example abovesss<ivy:buildlist reference=\"my-buildlist\" root=\"project-3\" excluderoot=\"true\">...</ivy:buildlist>sswill now make sure my-buildlist only contains matches from project-1 and project-2.ssIndex: ivy/test/java/fr/jayasoft/ivy/ant/IvyBuildListTest.javas===================================================================s--- ivy/test/java/fr/jayasoft/ivy/ant/IvyBuildListTest.java	(revision 107)s+++ ivy/test/java/fr/jayasoft/ivy/ant/IvyBuildListTest.java	(working copy)s@@ -103s4 +103s33 @@s         assertEquals(new File(\"test/buildlist/C/build.xml\").getAbsolutePath()s new File(files[1]).getAbsolutePath());s     }s s+    public void testFilteredExcludeRootBuildList() {s+        Project p = new Project();s+s+        IvyBuildList buildlist = new IvyBuildList();s+        buildlist.setProject(p);s+        buildlist.setRoot(\"C\");s+        buildlist.setExcludeRoot(true);s+s+        FileSet fs = new FileSet();s+        fs.setDir(new File(\"test/buildlist\"));s+        fs.setIncludes(\"**/build.xml\");s+        buildlist.addFileset(fs);s+s+        buildlist.setReference(\"ordered.build.files\");s+s+        buildlist.execute();s+s+        Object o = p.getReference(\"ordered.build.files\");s+        assertNotNull(o);s+        assertTrue(o instanceof Path);s+s+        Path path = (Path)o;s+        String[] files = path.list();s+        assertNotNull(files);s+        assertEquals(1s files.length); // A and C should be filtered outs+s+        assertEquals(new File(\"test/buildlist/B/build.xml\").getAbsolutePath()s new File(files[0]).getAbsolutePath());s+    }s+s }sIndex: ivy/src/java/fr/jayasoft/ivy/ant/IvyBuildList.javas===================================================================s--- ivy/src/java/fr/jayasoft/ivy/ant/IvyBuildList.java	(revision 107)s+++ ivy/src/java/fr/jayasoft/ivy/ant/IvyBuildList.java	(working copy)s@@ -38s6 +38s7 @@s     private boolean _reverse = false;s     private String _ivyFilePath;s     private String _root = \"*\";s+    private boolean _excludeRoot = false;s s s     public void addFileset(FileSet buildFiles) {s@@ -60s6 +61s14 @@s         _root = root;s     }s s+    public boolean isExcludeRoot() {s+        return _excludeRoot;s+    }s+s+    public void setExcludeRoot(boolean root) {s+        _excludeRoot = root;s+    }s+s     public void execute() throws BuildException {s         if (_reference == null) {s             throw new BuildException(\"reference should be provided in ivy build list\");s@@ -161s6 +170s12 @@s         Set toKeep = new HashSet();s         processFilterNode(rootmds toKeeps moduleIdMap);s s+        // With the excluderoot attribute set to trues take the rootmd out of the toKeep set.s+        if (_excludeRoot) {s+            Message.verbose(\"Excluded module \" + rootmd.getModuleRevisionId().getModuleId().getName());s+            toKeep.remove(rootmd);s+        }s+s         // just for loggings         for (Iterator iter = toKeep.iterator(); iter.hasNext();) {s             ModuleDescriptor md = ((ModuleDescriptor) iter.next());s@@ -236s5 +251s4 @@s         _reverse = reverse;s     }s s-s }s"

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1459. Standalone ZooKeeperServer is not closing s  the transaction log files on shutdown (Rakesh R via fpj)ssssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.4@1548826 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Standalone ZooKeeperServer is not closing the transaction log files on shutdown
description: When shutdown the standalone ZK servers its only clearing the zkdatabase and not closing the transaction log streams. When tries to delete the temporary files in unit tests on windowss its failing.sZooKeeperServer.javas{noformat}s        if (zkDb != null) {s            zkDb.clear();s        }s{noformat}ssSuggestion to close the zkDb as followss this inturn will take care transaction logs:s{noformat}s        if (zkDb != null) {s            zkDb.clear();s            try {s                zkDb.close();s            } catch (IOException ie) {s                LOG.warn(\Error closing logs \"s ie);s            }s        }s{noformat}"

title: \MathRuntimeException\" to become the base class for all Commons Math exceptions"
description: From discussions that led to this [thread|http://markmail.org/message/yu4lrnue54sncbek]s we concluded that the advantages of having a single hierarchy for all CM expections were more important than the drawbacks.ssThe base class will be named \MathRuntimeException\" (to be located in package \"o.a.c.m.exception\").ssIn version 4.0s all CM exceptions will be modified so that they inherit from that class.s"

title: the IncludeRelativePath handler should treat paths beginning with a slash as absolute paths
description: The most widely spread convention about systems supporting relative paths is that paths that begin with '/' (or '\') are absolute while others are relative. The IncludeRelativePath event handler should follow the same convention.ssThe corrective patch is attached.s

message: FIX in IVY-340: preserve roots and leaves orderssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/ivy/trunk@495653 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Ability to have multiple roots in the <ivy:buildfilelist> task
description: It would be extremely beneficial to have the ability to supply multiple roots in the <ivy:buildfilelist> task.sSupport for instances you have 10 applications in the same source trees but only certain apps changesover a given development cycle.  It would be nice to be able to build only that set of apps and theirsdependencies during the automated build. (Our build takes a propertys and creates the buildfilelistsaccordingly based on whether the property is set or not).sssRight nows only 1 root can be specified:ss<ivy:buildfilelist root=\app1\" ... />ssi propose a comma seperated list (or any reasonable delimiter) to specify multiple roots:ss<ivy:buildfilelist root=\"app1sapp2\" ... />ss"

name: ant-ivy
message: IMPROVE: implement strict haltonfailure if ivy.xml is not found (IVY-110)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/ivy/trunk@484356 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Implement strict haltonfailure if ivy.xml is not found
description: Scenario: Ivy resolution using a dual resolver with haltonfailure set to true.ssIn this situation if Ivy cannot locate the ivy.xml file it does not halts but continues on with a search of the artifact repository to see if the artifact exists. This is to allow a situation where no ivy.xml is available and to reduce the number of ivy.xml files which need to be written.ssThis behavior is useful in some cases. Howevers in a formal build environment using strict CM methodology it is undesirable and potentially dangerous.ssRequest is to enhance the ivy resolver to allow for \strict\" resolution. Strict meaning that *any* failure during the resolve results in a build error.ssOn a personal basis I would prefer that Ivy behavior be modified so that haltonfailure does just that - issues a build exception on any resolution problem. If one wanted the default behaviors then one would add an attribute modifying that behavior - for instance: an allowNoIvyFile attribute. I like this better than a \"strict\" attribute because the semantics are cleaner and it conforms to user expectations - that any failure in the resolve will result in a build error if haltonfailure is set to true.ssIt is unclear to me whether the allowNoIvyFile attribute should be placed on the resolve task or on the resolver configuration. Personallys I lean to making it an attribute of the resolver conf. In so doing I am effectively saying that for this repository I do not always expect that an artifact will have an ivy.xmls"

name: ant-ivy
message: IMPROVEMENT: ivy:install task does not allow specification of conf (IVY-1313) (thanks to Nihal Sinha)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@1299482 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: install task does not allow specification of conf
description: When running <ivy:install...> task there is no option to specify which config should be considered.  As it is currentlys it seems the default conf is the one that is useds therefore if a dependency exists which does not specify a mapping from master default confs the dependency will not be included during the install.  In that case the artifacts installed in the *to* resolver will *not* be able to resolve all needed artifacts under some configurations.  ssFor examples say I had a module defined as in the following example:s<info organisation=\my-org\" module=\"my-module\" revision=\"1.0\"/>s  <configurations>s    <conf name=\"default\" visibility=\"public\" description=\"runtime dependencies and master artifact can be used with this conf\" extends=\"runtimesmaster\"/>s    [...]s    <conf name=\"endorsed\" visibility=\"public\" description=\"this scope is used for components/lib/endorsed dependencies.\"/>s  </configurations>s  <publications>s    <artifact name=\"my-org\" ext=\"jar\"/>s  </publications>s  <dependencies>s    <dependency org=\"org.apache.xerces\" name=\"xml-apis\" rev=\"2.9.1\" conf=\"endorsed->default\"/>s  </dependencies>s</ivy-module>ssIn that case the ant task to install this module from my-resolver to another-resolver would look something like this:s    <ivy:install organisation=\"my-org\" module=\"my-module\" revision=\"1.0\" from=\"my-resolver\" to=\"another-resolver\" transitive=\"true\" overwrite=\"true\"/>sThis task would *not* install org.apache.xerces#xml-apis;2.9.1 onto another-resolver.  As a results using <ivy:retrieve...conf=\"endorsed\"/> against another-resolver would fail since it would attempt to find dependency org.apache.xerces#xml-apis;2.9.1 which does not exist in the repository (since it was never installed).ss<ivy:install...> should have the option of specifying which configuration(s) should be considered.  If not specified then it should default to * meaning all configurations defined in module being configured should be considered when locating which modules should be installed."

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1459. Standalone ZooKeeperServer is not closing s  the transaction log files on shutdown (Rakesh R via fpj)ssssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1548825 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Standalone ZooKeeperServer is not closing the transaction log files on shutdown
description: When shutdown the standalone ZK servers its only clearing the zkdatabase and not closing the transaction log streams. When tries to delete the temporary files in unit tests on windowss its failing.sZooKeeperServer.javas{noformat}s        if (zkDb != null) {s            zkDb.clear();s        }s{noformat}ssSuggestion to close the zkDb as followss this inturn will take care transaction logs:s{noformat}s        if (zkDb != null) {s            zkDb.clear();s            try {s                zkDb.close();s            } catch (IOException ie) {s                LOG.warn(\Error closing logs \"s ie);s            }s        }s{noformat}"

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-518. DEBUG message for outstanding proposals in leader should be moved to trace.ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.2@808558 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: DEBUG message for outstanding proposals in leader should be moved to trace.
description: this is the code in Leader.java s{code}s if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {s            LOG.debug(\Ack zxid: 0x\" + Long.toHexString(zxid));s            for (Proposal p : outstandingProposals.values()) {s                long packetZxid = p.packet.getZxid();s                LOG.debug(\"outstanding proposal: 0x\"s                        + Long.toHexString(packetZxid));s            }s            LOG.debug(\"outstanding proposals all\");s        }ss{code}ssWe should move this debug to trace since it will cause really high latencies in response times from zookeeper servers in case folks want to use DEBUG logging for servers.s"
