name: ant-ivy
message: IMPROVEMENT: Adding option 'cp's which makes it possible for main to be loaded from file (IVY-543) (thanks to Tjeerd Verhagen)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/ivy/core/trunk@589116 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Adding option 'cp's which makes it possible for main to be loaded from file
description: Without this option it is hard to start an application which sits in just a jar file or classes directory.ssWith the new option 'cp' the application classpath can be added. This makes it possible to load all kind of versioned packages through Ivy and start An Application (the application actually doesn't need to know anything about Ivy!!!). Without this option it's quite hard to just start an applications which is not in a jar and described as a Ivy atrtifact (and stored in a Ivy repository). Especially for development this can be very handy (IMO).s

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1666. Avoid Reverse DNS lookup if the hostname in s  connection string is literal IP address. (George Cao via camille)sssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.4@1541359 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Avoid Reverse DNS lookup if the hostname in connection string is literal IP address.
description: In our ENVs if the InetSocketAddress.getHostName() is called and the host name in the connection string are literal IP addresss then the call will trigger a reverse DNS lookup which is very slow.sAnd in this situations the host name can simply set as the IP without causing any problem.

name: CommonsMath
message: Fixed a convergence discrepancy with respect to theory in Gragg-Bulirsch-Stoer integrator.sJIRA: MATH-324sssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@893281 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Error in the the convergence control for GraggBulirschStoerIntegrator (GBS)
description: By reading the source code and making a compareason with the theory described by Hairer in his book (Solving Ordinary Differential Equations 1 : Nonstiff Problems) I have found an error in the convergence control.ssEFFECTS  :sThe mistake is unvisible from a user's point of view but makes the integration slower than it should be. Some steps are rejected whereas they could have offer convergence. The theory discribed by Hairer isn't correctly used. ssLOCATION : ssThe problem comes from the line 693 of GraggBulirschStoerIntegrator.java : ss\final double ratio = ((double) sequence [k] * sequence[k+1]) / (sequence[0] * sequence[0]);\"ssThis line should be replaced by :ssfinal double ratio = ((double) sequence [k+1] * sequence[k+2]) / (sequence[0] * sequence[0]);ssor (which is the same) : final double ratio = ((double) sequence [targetIter] * sequence[targetIter + 1]) / (sequence[0] * sequence[0]);sssEXPLANATION :ssThe corresponding chapter in Hairer's book is page 233 : Order and Step Size Control (for GBS method) :ssFollowing the theorys we compute k-1 modified midpoint integration to obtain the k-1lines of the extrapolation tableau where k is the predicted index in which there should be convergence. (In the java code source the variable is 'targetIter')ssIf there is convergence (errk-1 < 1) we accept the step and continue the integration.sIf not we use the asymptotic evolution of error to evaluate if there is convergence at least in line k+1 (so two integration later)ssThis stage is wrongly done in the java code source by the line 693.ssFollowing the theory the estimation of convergence in line k+1 (when you are in line k-1) is s                errk-1 > (nk+1 * nk  /  (n1 * n1) )¬≤ sSo you shall use the number of substeps (nk and nk+1) that haven't been used yet. you shall use the number of substep of the next two integration.ssIn the java code source :s        * the predicted index for convergence is targetIters        * the current integration number is ks        * nks number of substep for the integration is sequence[ ]ssWhen we are in line 693 :s     Here k = targetIter - 1 (case -1 of the switch)s     To evaluate the convergence at least in targetIter + 1 is is done :ss       \"final double ratio = ((double) sequence [k] * sequence[k+1]) / (sequence[0] * sequence[0]);\"ssIt seems like a nonsense to use sequence[k] to evaluate convergence in next lines whereas sequence[k] has already been used in the last call to tryStep(...sks..)sswe should do : s        final double  ratio = ((double) sequence [targetIter] * sequence[targetIter + 1]) / ( sequence[0] *  sequence[0]);ssOr (because targetIter = k+1)   final double ratio = ((double) sequence [k+1] *sequence[k+2]) /(sequence[0] * sequence[0]);ssie to use the number os substeps for the next integrationss as described in the Hairer's book.ssssCOMMENT :ss1) in the java code for case = 0   we have k = targetIter and the estimation of the convergence at least in targetIter + 1 is done by  s                final double ratio = ((double) sequence[k+1]) / sequence[0];sSince k = targetIter the instruction is correct.ss2) The compareason with the fortran code delivered by Hairer (easily found on his website page)  confirms the error in the java code.sssSorry for the length of this messages looking forward to hearing from you soonssVincent Morand"

name: CommonsMath
message: added composition features for real functionssJIRA: MATH-313ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@890002 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Functions could be more object-oriented without losing any power.
description: UnivariateRealFunctions for examples is a map from R to R.  The set of such functions has tons and tons of structure: in addition to being an algebras equipped with +s-s*s and scaling by constantss it maps the same space into itselfs so it is composables both pre and post.ssI'd propose we add:ss{code}s  UnivariateRealFunction plus(UnivariateRealFunction other);s  UnivariateRealFunction minus(UnivariateRealFunction other);s  UnivariateRealFunction times(UnivariateRealFunction other);s  UnivariateRealFunction times(double scale);s  UnivariateRealFunction preCompose(UnivariateRealFunction other);s  UnivariateRealFunction postCompose(UnivariateRealFunction other);s{code}ssto the interfaces and then implement them in an AbstractUnivariateRealFunction base class.  No implementer would need to notices other than switching to extend this class rather than implement UnivariateRealFunction.ssMany people don't need or use thiss but... it makes for some powerfully easy code:ss{code}UnivariateRealFunction gaussian = Exp.preCompose(Negate.preCompose(Pow2));{code}sswhich is even nicer when done anonymously passing into a map/collect method (a la MATH-312).s

name: oisafe
message: OI Safe: Apply patch by Rachee Singh: Delete password from clipboard when logging out.ss1. When the text (username/password) is copied to the clipboards it is also copied to a static string variable in Safe.java. s2. When the safe is lockeds the clipboard is compared to this static variables and if it is the same as the last stored passwords the clipboard is cleared. sSafe.java isn't terminated until the application terminatess so the static variable we need is retained. ssFixes issue 297.ssgit-svn-id: https://openintents.googlecode.com/svn/trunk@3240 72b678ce-9140-0410-bee8-679b907dd61as

title: Cut down the running time of ZKDatabase corruption.
description: THe zkdatabasecorruption test takes around 180 seconds right now. It just bring down a quorum cluster up and down and corrupts some snapshots. We need to investigate why it takes that long and make it shorter so that our test run times are smaller.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1323. c client doesn't compile on freebsd (michi mutsuzaki via phunt)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1214537 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: c client doesn't compile on freebsd
description: EAI_NODATA and EAI_ADDRFAMILY have been deprecated in FreeBSD. I'm getting this error:sssrc/zookeeper.c: In function `getaddrinfo_errno':ssrc/zookeeper.c:446: error: `EAI_NODATA' undeclared (first use in this function)ssrc/zookeeper.c:446: error: (Each undeclared identifier is reported only oncessrc/zookeeper.c:446: error: for each function it appears in.)ssrc/zookeeper.c: In function `getaddrs':ssrc/zookeeper.c:581: error: `EAI_ADDRFAMILY' undeclared (first use in this function)ssI'll submit a patch.ss--Michi

name: ant-ivy
message: IVY-365: Set javac includeantruntime to false and declare explicitely JUnit and Ant dependenciessIVY-162: ivy.xml doesn't contain all the dependenciesssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/ivy/trunk@494222 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: ivy.xml doesn't contain all the dependencies||Set javac includeantruntime to false and declare explicitely JUnit and Ant dependencies
description: The ivy.xml file doesn't contain all the required dependencies. It is missing 'junit.jar' and 'ant.jar'.ssThis patch fixes this:sIndex: C:/projects/ivy/ivy/ivy.xmls===================================================================s--- C:/projects/ivy/ivy/ivy.xml	(revision 215)s+++ C:/projects/ivy/ivy/ivy.xml	(working copy)s@@ -4s8 +4s10 @@s 	       status=\integration\"s 	/>s 	<dependencies>s+		<dependency org=\"apache\" name=\"ant\" rev=\"1.6.5\" conf=\"default\" />s 		<dependency org=\"apache\" name=\"commons-httpclient\" rev=\"3.0\" conf=\"default\"/>s 		<dependency org=\"apache\" name=\"commons-cli\" rev=\"1.0\" conf=\"default\"/>s+		<dependency org=\"apache\" name=\"junit\" rev=\"3.8.1\" conf=\"default\" />s 		<dependency org=\"apache\" name=\"oro\" rev=\"2.0.8\" conf=\"default\"/>s 	</dependencies>s </ivy-module>s||build file:ssThe practice of running javac with includeantruntime set to the default value (which is set to true for unfortunate legacy reasons) is not appropriate.sIt would be better to explicitely declare ant and junit in the dependencies for compile and test and pick them the same way as other dependencies.ss"

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2172: Cluster crashes when reconfig a new node as a participant (Arshad Mohammad via phunt)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1759907 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Cluster crashes when reconfig a new node as a participant
description: The operations are quite simple: start three zk servers one by ones then reconfig the cluster to add the new one as a participant. When I add the  third ones the zk cluster may enter a weird state and cannot recover.s s      I found ‚Äú2015-04-20 12:53:48s236 [myid:1] - INFO  [ProcessThread(sid:1 cport:-1)::PrepRequestProcessor@547] - Incremental reconfig‚Äù in node-1 log. So the first node received the reconfig cmd at 12:53:48. Latters it logged ‚Äú2015-04-20  12:53:52s230 [myid:1] - ERROR [LearnerHandler-/10.0.0.2:55890:LearnerHandler@580] - Unexpected exception causing shutdown while sock still open‚Äù and ‚Äú2015-04-20 12:53:52s231 [myid:1] - WARN  [LearnerHandler-/10.0.0.2:55890:LearnerHandler@595] - ******* GOODBYE  /10.0.0.2:55890 ********‚Äù. From then ons the first node and second node rejected all client connections and the third node didn‚Äôt join the cluster as a participant. The whole cluster was done.s s     When the problem happeneds all three nodes just used the same dynamic config file zoo.cfg.dynamic.10000005d which only contained the first two nodes. But there was another unused dynamic config file in node-1 directory zoo.cfg.dynamic.next  which already contained three nodes.s s     When I extended the waiting time between starting the third node and reconfiguring the clusters the problem didn‚Äôt show again. So it should be a race condition problem.

name: ant-ivy
message: FIX: haltonmissing on publish task does not prevent the other files to be publisheds even with an atomic publisher (IVY-656)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@671578 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: haltonmissing on publish task does not prevent the other files to be publisheds even with an atomic publisher
description: When using an atomic publisher like the file system resolvers and using haltonmissing to fail the build when there are some missing artifactss one could expect that the module is not published at all on the repository. This is not the case currentlys the module is still published normally with some missing artifactss leaving the repository in an inconsistent state.

title: ivy file in repo contains wrong module and artifact name
description: The module and artifact in ivy.xml in the repo always contains the values of the first published module in ant:sSteps I do:s<ivy:resolve file=\/foo.xml\" />s<ivy:publish artifactspattern=\"//lib/[artifact].[ext]\" resolver=\"shared\" pubrevision=\"@{release}\" status=\"integration\" />s<ivy:resolve file=\"/bar.xml\" />s<ivy:publish artifactspattern=\"//lib/[artifact].[ext]\" resolver=\"shared\" pubrevision=\"@{release}\" status=\"integration\" />ssNow the ivy.xml from bar.xml contains the module and artifact-values from foo.xml"

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1124. Multiop submitted to non-leader always fails due to timeoutsssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1146961 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Multiop submitted to non-leader always fails due to timeout
description: The new Multiop support added under zookeeper-965 fails every single time if the multiop is submitted to a non-leader in quorum mode. In standalone mode it always works properly and this bug only presents itself in quorum mode (with 2 or more nodes). After 12 hours of debugging (*sigh*) it turns out to be a really simple fix. There are a couple of missing case statements inside FollowerRequestProcessor.java and ObserverRequestProcessor.java to ensure that multiop is forwarded to the leader for commit. I've attached a patch that fixes this problem.ssIt's probably worth nothing that zookeeper-965 has already been committed to trunk. But this is a fatal flaw that will prevent multiop support from working properly and as such needs to get committed to 3.4.0 as well. Is there a way to tie these two cases together in some way?

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-844. handle auth failure in java clientssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/trunk@1005101 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: handle auth failure in java client
description: ClientCnxn.java currently has the following code:s  if (replyHdr.getXid() == -4) {s                // -2 is the xid for AuthPackets                // TODO: process AuthPacket heres                if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {s                    LOG.debug(\Got auth sessionid:0x\"s                            + Long.toHexString(sessionId));s                }s                return;s            }ssAuth failures appear to cause the server to disconnect but the client never gets a proper state change or notification that auth has faileds which makes handling this scenario very difficult as it causes the client to go into a loop of sending bad auths getting disconnecteds trying to reconnects sending bad auth agains over and over. s"

name: ant-ivy
message: LatestRevisionStrategy.sort() doesn't sort as specified (IVY-435)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/ivy/core/trunk@519726 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: LatestRevisionStrategy.sort() doesn't sort as specified
description: According to the LatestStrategy.sort() javadocs the sort method should sort the artifacts from latest to oldest.sHowevers the LatestRevisionStrategy.sort() method does the opposite!ssThe following junit test shows this (add to LatestRevisionStrategyTest.java):ss{code}s    public void testSort() {s        ArtifactInfo[] revs = toMockAI(new String[] {s                \0.2a\"s s                \"0.2_b\"s s                \"0.2rc1\"s s                \"0.2-final\"s s                \"1.0-dev1\"s s                \"1.0-dev2\"s s                \"1.0-alpha1\"s s                \"1.0-alpha2\"s s                \"1.0-beta1\"s s                \"1.0-beta2\"s s                \"1.0-gamma\"ss                \"1.0-rc1\"ss                \"1.0-rc2\"ss                \"1.0\"s s                \"1.0.1\"s s                \"2.0\" s                });s        s        List shuffled = new ArrayList(Arrays.asList(revs)); s        ArtifactInfo[] shuffledRevs = (ArtifactInfo[]) shuffled.toArray(new ArtifactInfo[revs.length]);s        s        LatestRevisionStrategy latestRevisionStrategy = new LatestRevisionStrategy();s        List sorted = latestRevisionStrategy.sort(shuffledRevs);s    	assertEquals(Arrays.asList(revs)s sorted);s    }s{code}ssThe question is: should we change the javadoc or the LatestRevisionStrategy.sort method?"

name: ant-ivy
message: IVY-1438:s - fix the parsing of header values with spacesssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@1520874 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: ParseException when \Bundle-Description\" is present in OSGI MANIFEST.MF"
description: When a \Bundle-Description\" is present in a parsed \"MANIFEST.MF\" file then a ParseException is thrown.ss*EXAMPLE* (from Eclipse 4.2.2 \"plugin\" Directory):sjavax.servlet_3.0.0.v201112011016.jar!/META-INF/MANIFEST.MFss*DESCRIPTION* (from above manifest):sBundle-Description: glassfish javax.servlet.3.1.0.b33ss*EXCEPTION*:sCaused by: java.text.ParseException: Expecting the end of a value or of an parameter names	at org.apache.ivy.osgi.core.ManifestHeaderValue$ManifestHeaderParser.error(ManifestHeaderValue.java:179)s	at org.apache.ivy.osgi.core.ManifestHeaderValue$ManifestHeaderParser.error(ManifestHeaderValue.java:175)s	at org.apache.ivy.osgi.core.ManifestHeaderValue$ManifestHeaderParser.parseValueOrParameter(ManifestHeaderValue.java:218)s	at org.apache.ivy.osgi.core.ManifestHeaderValue$ManifestHeaderParser.parseElement(ManifestHeaderValue.java:185)s	at org.apache.ivy.osgi.core.ManifestHeaderValue$ManifestHeaderParser.parse(ManifestHeaderValue.java:155)s	at org.apache.ivy.osgi.core.ManifestHeaderValue.<init>(ManifestHeaderValue.java:51)s	at org.apache.ivy.osgi.core.ManifestParser.parseManifest(ManifestParser.java:107)ss*REPRODUCE*:ssTry to create a ManifestHeaderValue like this: s{code:java} snew ManifestHeaderValue(\"glassfish javax.servlet.3.1.0.b33\")s{code} s"

name: ant-ivy
message: FIX: Can't deal with [VERSION] version pattern from Maven (IVY-1177) (thanks to Richard Vowles)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@926346 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Can't deal with [VERSION] version pattern from Maven
description: If you want a specific version of a resource in Mavens [VERSION] is a valid request - e.g. [1.5.8]ssI am using grape (from Groovy) and ssgrape -d install org.slf4j slf4j-api [1.5.8] sswill not work. These dependencies are all over the place in our maven repo (and presumably others). I fixed it by adding to ModuleRevisionId.java ss    protected static String normalizeRevision(String asked) {s        if ( asked.startsWith( \[\" ) && asked.endsWith( \"]\" ) && asked.indexOf('s') == -1 ) {s            return asked.substring(1s asked.length() - 1 );s        } elses            return asked;s    }ssand using it in the constructor:ssthis.revision = revision == null ? Ivy.getWorkingRevision() : normalizeRevision(revision);"

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1214. QuorumPeer should unregister only its previsously registered MBeans instead of use MBeanRegistry.unregisterAll() method. (C√©sar √Ålvarez N√∫√±ez via michim)sssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1595561 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: QuorumPeer should unregister only its previsously registered MBeans instead of use MBeanRegistry.unregisterAll() method.
description: When a QuorumPeer thread diess it is unregistering *all* ZKMBeanInfo MBeans previously registered on its java process; including those that has not been registered by itself.ssIt does not cause any side effect in production environment where each server is running on a separate java process; but fails when using \org.apache.zookeeper.test.QuorumUtil\" to programmatically start up a zookeeper server ensemble and use its provided methods to force Disconnecteds SyncConnected or SessionExpired events; in order to perform some basic/functional testing.ssScenario:s* QuorumUtil qU = new QuorumUtil(1); // It creates a 3 servers ensemble.s* qU.startAll(); // Startup all servers: 1 Leader + 2 Followerss* qU.shutdown\\(i\\); // i is a number from 1 to 3. It shutdown one server.ssThe last method causes that a QuorumPeer will dies invoking the MBeanRegistry.unregisterAll() method.sAs a results *all* ZKMBeanInfo MBeans are unregistered; including those belonging to the other QuorumPeer instances.ssWhen trying to restart previous server (qU.restart\\(i\\)) an AssertionError is thrown at MBeanRegistry.register(ZKMBeanInfo beans ZKMBeanInfo parent) methods causing the QuorumPeer thread dead.ssTo solve it:s* MBeanRegistry.unregisterAll() method has been removed.s* QuorumPeer only unregister its ZKMBeanInfo MBeans."

name: velocity
message: VELOCITY-151.  Use latest commons-collection jar to ensure properties file is read with ISO8859_1.  (See Commons Collection bug http://issues.apache.org/bugzilla/show_bug.cgi?id=17616 )ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/velocity/core/trunk@289969 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: RuntimeInstance.setDefaultProperties() codepage problem
description: There is a bug in the RuntimeInstance setDefaultProperties method that preventssVelocity 1.3.1 from running on an IBM mainframe.ssThe code is currently written:s s          InputStream inputStream = classLoaders                 .getResourceAsStream( DEFAULT_RUNTIME_PROPERTIES );s s             configuration.load( inputStream );s sWhich loads the default runtime properties into an ExtendedPropertiessobject.sThis fails on an OS/390 which has a default codepage of Cp1047 (ebcdic)sssince:s s 1) the properties resource is packaged in the Jar in codepage ISO8859_1.s 2) The ExtendedProperties class attempts to load it using the defaults codepage (Cp1047).s 3) Because of the codepage mismatchs the resulting ExtendedPropertiess object is empty and you get the error:s \It appears that no class was specified as the ResourceManager.  Pleases ensure that all configuration information is correct.\"s s Note that java.util.Properties.load(InputStream) ALWAYS loads usings \"8859_1\"s since properties files are assumed to be in ASCII.s s s A workaround to this bug is to load the default properties manuallys adds your changes and pass them all to the  VelocityEngine.init(Properties)s method.s s The fix is to change the line to:ss       configuration.load( inputStreams \"8859_1\" );s s Which is consistent with java.util.Properties.load().  Alsos any other usess of the ExtendedProperties.load() should be changed as well.   In factss ExtendedProperties.load() should probably default to \"8859_1\"s IMO."

name: ant-ivy
message: FIX: ivy is now able to use simple ivy files in cache (doesn't need resolver infos use default one if no resolver is given) (IVY-86)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/ivy/trunk@484044 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Ivy Files are not found in the cache
description: For some reasons even though dependency files themselves can be resovled to the caches itsdoes not seem as if the Ivy configuration files can be loaded from the cache.ssIn my ivyconf.xml:ss<resolvers>s      <chain name=\remote\">s          <filesystem name=\"internal\">s              <ivy pattern=\"/\" />s              <artifact pattern=\"/\" />s          </filesystem>          s          <ivyrep name=\"ibiblio\" />s      </chain>s      s      <filesystem name=\"local\">s          <ivy pattern=\"/home/jira/.ivy-cache/\" />s          <artifact pattern=\"/home/jira/.ivy-cache/\" />          s      </filesystem>ss      <filesystem name=\"internal.publish\">s          <ivy pattern=\"/\" />s          <artifact pattern=\"/\" />s      </filesystem>ss  </resolvers>sssAnd when a developer buildss we do ans    <ivy:publish resolver=\"local\" />ssOnly when we do a full automated build do we want to publish to the internal.publishsrepository (which the same as internals but i seperate them because the \"internal\"swill be exposed by https and internal.publish will be filesystem.ssHowevers when I have two moduless A and Bs with ivy files:ssAs-------s<ivy-module version=\"1.0\">s    <info organisation=\"test\" module=\"A\" revision=\"1.0\" />s    <publications>s        <artifact name=\"A\" type=\"jar\" />s    </publications>s</ivy-module>ssBs-------s<ivy-module version=\"1.0\">s    <info organisation=\"test\" module=\"B\" revision=\"1.0\" />s    <publications>s        <artifact name=\"B\" type=\"jar\" />s    </publications>s    <dependencies>s        <dependency org=\"test\" module=\"A\" rev=\"1.0\">s            <artifact name=\"A\" type=\"jar\" />s        </dependency>s    </dependencies>s</ivy-module>sssI keep getting a failure to resolve A when i try to build B (after publishing A to cache).sBasically the reason is that the Ivy.xml is not in the actual repository yets and for somesreason it won't try to find it in the cache.  In my opinions it should try to find it in the cachesif it's theres and I view this is a bug (similar to what maven would do with a pom file)ss"

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2642: ZooKeeper reconfig API backward compatibility fix.ssNew PR that applies ZOOKEEPER-2642 to `branch-3.5`ssAuthor: randgalt <jordan@jordanzimmerman.com>ssReviewers: Michael Han <hanm@apache.org>ssCloses #151 from Randgalt/ZOOKEEPER-2642-3.5s
title: ZooKeeper reconfig API backward compatibility fix
description: ZOOKEEPER-2014 moved the reconfig() methods into a new classs ZooKeeperAdmin. It appears this was done to document that these are methods have access restrictions. Howevers this change breaks Apache Curator (and possibly other clients). Curator APIs will have to be changed and/or special methods need to be added. A breaking change of this kind should only be done when the benefit is overwhelming. In this cases the same information can be conveyed with documentation and possibly a deprecation notice.ssRevert the creation of the ZooKeeperAdmin class and move the reconfig() methods back to the ZooKeeper class with additional documentation.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2680: Correct DataNode.getChildren() inconsistent behaviourssAuthor: Mohammad Arshad <arshad@apache.org>ssReviewers: Edward Ribeiro <edward.ribeiro@gmail.com>s Abraham Fine <afine@apache.org>s Michael Han <hanm@apache.org>s Rakesh Radhakrishnan <rakeshr@apache.org>ssCloses #162 from arshadmohammad/ZOOKEEPER-2680-br-3.4s
title: Correct DataNode.getChildren() inconsistent behaviour.
description: DataNode.getChildren() API returns null and empty set if there are no children in it depending on when the API is called. DataNode.getChildren() API behavior should be changed and it should always return empty set if the node does not have any childss*DataNode.getChildren() API Current Behavior:*s# returns null initiallysWhen DataNode is created and no children are added yets DataNode.getChildren() returns nulls# returns empty set after all the children are deleted:screated a Nodesadd a childsdelete the childsDataNode.getChildren() returns empty set.ssAfter fix DataNode.getChildren() should return empty set in all the above cases.

name: velocity
message: fix Template default encoding initialization problem (fixes VELOCITY-809)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/velocity/engine/trunk@1752790 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: RuntimeInstance returns template with incorrect encoding (if not specified) when not initialized before
description: RuntimeInstance has sspublic Template getTemplate(String name)s        throws ResourceNotFoundExceptions ParseErrorExceptions{s        return getTemplate(names getDefaultEncoding());s}ssso if RuntimeInstance was not initialized before this method was called then it provides default encoding (ENCODING_DEFAULT = \ISO-8859-1\") for getDefaultEncoding() instead of those that was set usingss.setProperty(RuntimeConstants.INPUT_ENCODINGs \"UTF-8\")ssand Template contents incorrectly loaded.ssThis is so because initialization is done one step after a call of getDefaultEncoding() inside methodsspublic Template getTemplate(String names String  encoding)s        throws ResourceNotFoundExceptions ParseErrorExceptions{s        requireInitialization();ss        return (Template)s                resourceManager.getResource(namess                    ResourceManager.RESOURCE_TEMPLATEs encoding);s}ssSolution is to add requireInitialization(); before  return getTemplate(names getDefaultEncoding()); line in the first method.sORsaccept encoding == null in the second method:sspublic Template getTemplate(String name)s        throws ResourceNotFoundExceptions ParseErrorExceptions{s        return getTemplate(names null);s}sspublic Template getTemplate(String names String  encoding)s        throws ResourceNotFoundExceptions ParseErrorExceptions{s        requireInitialization();ss        if (encoding == null)s                encoding = getDefaultEncoding();ss        return (Template)s                resourceManager.getResource(namess                    ResourceManager.RESOURCE_TEMPLATEs encoding);s}"

name: CommonsMath
message: Removed dead codes improved test coverage.  Dead code pointed out in JIRA: MATH-306. Thanks to Joerg Huber.ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@830044 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Method 'divide' in class 'Complex' uses a false formula for a special case resulting in erroneous division by zero.
description: The formula that 'divide' wants to implement isss( a + bi )  /  ( c + di )  =  ( ac + bd + ( bc - ad ) i )  /  ( c^2 + d^2 )ssas correctly written in the description.ssWhen c == 0.0 this leads to the special casess( a + bi )  /  di  = ( b / d ) - ( a / d ) issBut the corresponding code is:ssif (c == 0.0) {s    return createComplex(imaginary/ds -real/c);s}ssThe bug is the last division -real/cs which should obviously be -real/d.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2311: assert in setup_randoms(Marshall McMullen via rgs)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1718207 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: assert in setup_random
description: We've started seeing an assert failing inside setup_random at line 537:ss{code}s 528 static void setup_random()s 529 {s 530 #ifndef _WIN32          // TODO: better seeds 531     int seed;s 532     int fd = open(\/dev/urandom\"s O_RDONLY);s 533     if (fd == -1) {s 534         seed = getpid();s 535     } else {s 536         int rc = read(fds &seeds sizeof(seed));s 537         assert(rc == sizeof(seed));s 538         close(fd);s 539     }s 540     srandom(seed);s 541     srand48(seed);s 542 #endifs{code}ssThe core files show:ssProgram terminated with signal 6s Aborted.s#0  0x00007f9ff665a0d5 in raise () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6s#0  0x00007f9ff665a0d5 in raise () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6s#1  0x00007f9ff665d83b in abort () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6s#2  0x00007f9ff6652d9e in ?? () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6s#3  0x00007f9ff6652e42 in __assert_fail () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6s#4  0x00007f9ff8e4070a in setup_random () at src/zookeeper.c:476s#5  0x00007f9ff8e40d76 in resolve_hosts (zh=0x7f9fe14de400s hosts_in=0x7f9fd700f400 \"10.26.200.6:2181s10.26.200.7:2181s10.26.200.8:2181\"s avec=0x7f9fd87fab60) at src/zookeeper.c:730s#6  0x00007f9ff8e40e87 in update_addrs (zh=0x7f9fe14de400) at src/zookeeper.c:801s#7  0x00007f9ff8e44176 in zookeeper_interest (zh=0x7f9fe14de400s fd=0x7f9fd87fac4cs interest=0x7f9fd87fac50s tv=0x7f9fd87fac80) at src/zookeeper.c:1980s#8  0x00007f9ff8e553f5 in do_io (v=0x7f9fe14de400) at src/mt_adaptor.c:379s#9  0x00007f9ff804de9a in start_thread () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread.so.0s#10 0x00007f9ff671738d in clone () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6s#11 0x0000000000000000 in ?? ()ssI'm not sure what the underlying cause of this is... But POSIX always allows for a short read(2)s and any program MUST check for short reads... ssHas anyone else encountered this issue? We are seeing it rather frequently which is concerning."

title: XmlLayout should escape < and > in classnames
description: We've stumbled across a scenario where the location information comes out with sthe method set to java and the classname ending with <init>.  The problem occurssonly after the first few calls to the constructors in question and we've onlysseen it on Aix under IBM's jre 1.4.0 - the suspicion is that their JIT isskicking in and messing the information up.  Obviouslys with this problem insplace the likes of Chainsaw get very confused when trying to process the 'xml'.

name: log4j
message: Bug 39135: Eliminated JDK 1.4 dependency on ISO and DateTimeDateFormat testsssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/log4j/branches/v1_2-branch@391719 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Bad patterns in ISO8601DateFormat and DateTimeDateFormat
description: o.a.l.helpers.ISO8601DateFormat and o.a.l.helpers.DateTimeDateFormat were restored to the trunk in rev s371710 on 2006-01-23 logged against bug 35452 (the catch all log4j 1.3 incompatibility bug).  These simplementations were provided strictly for existing applications and are not used with log4j.  The new simplementations simply delegate to java.util.SimpleDateFormat unlike the log4j 1.2 implementations swhich attempted an independent implementation.ssUnfortunatelys the patterns used were lifted directly from the log4j 1.2 javadoc comments which were swrong.  The use of YYYY instead of yyyy would result in an exception on construction and the use of yyyy-smm-dd instead of yyyy-MM-dd would result in the value of the hour being used as the date.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-320. call auth completion in free_completions(). (chris darroch via mahadev)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.1@748676 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: call auth completion in free_completions()
description: If a client calls zoo_add_auth() with an invalid scheme (e.g.s \foo\") the ZooKeeper server will mark their session expired and close the connection.  Howevers the C client has returned immediately after queuing the new auth data to be sent with a ZOK return code.ssIf the client then waits for their auth completion function to be calleds they can wait forevers as no session event is ever delivered to that completion function.  All other completion functions are notified of session events by free_completions()s which is called by cleanup_bufs() in handle_error() in handle_socket_error_msg().ssIn actual facts what can happen (about 50% of the times for me) is that the next call by the IO thread to flush_send_queue() calls send() from within send_buffer()s and receives a SIGPIPE signal during this send() call.  Because the ZooKeeper C API is a librarys it properly does not catch that signal.  If the user's code is not catching that signal eithers they experience an abort caused by an untrapped signal.  If they are ignoring the signal -- which is common in context I'm working ins the Apache httpd server -- then flush_send_queue()'s error return code is EPIPEs which is logged by handle_socket_error_msg()s and all non-auth completion functions are notified of a session event.  Howevers if the caller is waiting for their auth completion functions they wait forever while the IO thread tries repeatedly to reconnect and is rejected by the server as having an expired session.ssSos first of alls it would be useful to document in the C API portion of the programmer's guide that trapping or ignoring SIGPIPE is importants as this signal may be generated by the C API.ssNexts the two attached patches call the auth completion functions if anys in free_completions()s which fixes this problem for me.  The second attached patch includes auth lock/unlock functions as per ZOOKEEPER-319."

name: velocity
message: VELOCITY-814 support query modification in DataSourceResourceLoader (thx to Darren Cruse)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/velocity/engine/trunk@1231265 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Allow for overriding the query used by DataSourceResourceLoader
description:
In future versions of Velocity 1.7s allow users of DataSourceResourceLoader to customize the database query used by extending the class and overriding the getStatement() method.ssThis would be helpful for users in cases where the table being accessed is pre-existing and has a structure that does not match the default query. e.g. The default query does not work if the table has a compound key rather than a single column key.ssThis feature is also helpful if the template name passed by velocity differs from what is actually stored in their table's keys - by overriding getStatement() they can parse the template name passed prior to the query being run to deal with such differences.ssWithout this change such users will likely copy and modify the entire DataSourceResourceLoader.java files but with this change it's far easier to simply override the getStatement() function alone. ssThe necessary changes are simply to: ssa. make the getStatement() function protected not privates andssb. pass in tableName and keyColumn so the function doesn't need access those as private members.ssi.e. the getStatement() function becomes as follows:ss /**s * Creates the following PreparedStatement query :s *
s * SELECT columnNames FROM tableName WHERE keyColumns * = 'templateName's *
s * where keyColumn is a class member set in init()s *s * @param conn connection to datasources * @param columnNames columns to fetch from datasources * @param tableName table to fetch froms * @param keyColumn column whose value should match templateNames * @param templateName name of template to fetchs * @return PreparedStatements */s protected PreparedStatement getStatement(final Connection connss final String columnNamesss final String tableNamess final String keyColumnss final String templateName) throws SQLExceptions {s PreparedStatement ps = conn.prepareStatement(\SELECT \" + columnNames + \" FROM \"+ tableName + \" WHERE \" + keyColumn + \" = ?\");s ps.setString(1s templateName);s return ps;s }ssAnd then the two calls to getStatement() are changed to pass the tableName and keyColumn name as parameters:ss1. The call to getStatement() at line 232 changes from:s ps = getStatement(conns templateColumns name);sto:s ps = getStatement(conns templateColumns tableNames keyColumns name);ss2. The call to getStatement() at line 308 changes from:s ps = getStatement(conns timestampColumns name);ssto:s ps = getStatement(conns timestampColumns tableNames keyColumns name);ssThe changed and tested Velocity 1.7 DataSourceResourceLoader.java is attached.ssThis JIRA was originally discussed in the Velocity Old Nabble forum message at: ss http://old.nabble.com/Customizing-the-query-used-by-DataSourceResourceLoader-to32957497.htmlsss"

message: FIX: NPE in some casess related to IVY-1083 implementationssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@787597 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: transitive dependencies and conflict management
description: let's say we have the following modules:s{noformat}smod20.4 ->  mod20.3;1.0 mod20.2;1.0smod20.3;1.0 -> mod20.1;1.0smod20.2;1.0 -> mod20.1;1.1 (transitive false)smod20.1;1.0 -> mod1.2;1.0smod20.1;1.1 -> mod1.2;1.0s{noformat}swhen the conflict manager evicts mod20.1;1.0 in favor of mod20.1;1.1s it loses the information that the dependency was transitive from mod20.3s and as such transitively exclude mod1.2.ssNote that if the dependencies in mod20.4 are expressed the other way (mod20.2;1.0 mod20.3;1.0) then transitivity is handled correctly.

name: log4j
message: Bug 28647: Fixed compile error in WriterAppender.shouldFlush()ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/log4j/trunk@824134 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Add \Flush on Level\" capability to FileAppender"
description: New Feature Requested:sI have used logging extensively for many years and tend to have my programs slog alot of information.  When writing to a file this can cause a performance simpact due to very frequent disk I/O.  So my own logging libraries I used (in sCs VBs PL/SQL) always had the ability to configure the level that the log text swas flushed to disk.  ssI have now extended FileAppender to create this feature.  It simply allows you sto set the level that flushing occurs.  Whenever a log event is logged for sthat level or highers a flush occurs.  i.e. if the FlushLevel is INFOs then swhen an INFOs WARNs ERROR or FATAL event is logged the stream will be flushed sto disk. DEBUG messages will accumulate and not flush until the next INFO sevent is logged.ssJustification:  s-The performance improvement allows for more detailed logging levels to be sleft permanently ons or to have less impact when they are on. s- The logging style in most programs (certainly all mine) finish each major sprocessing step logging an event at a level higher than (or at least equal to) sthe previously logged events.  Eg an operation \createOrder\" may have a number sof INFO and DEBUG msgs (and soon TRACE!) but would finish on a INFO msg slike \"Successfully created order for 1000 ORCL...\".  This pattern guarantees sthat flush of all log event has occurred when the operation finishess rather sthan waiting for some arbitrary point like a 8K buffer being filled.s-The one downside is that if a program crashess then any final logged events sbelow the threshold that occurred after the last threhold level will not sappear in the file.  This is normally a small price to pays as you just then slower the flush level and rerun so you get all events flushed.  (This assumes sthe error is repeatables but with no flushing features the lower level events swouldnt have been turned on due to the performance hit so you are no worse off seven if it is not).sNOTE: I have implemented a shutdown hook to address the last issue - i.e. sautomatically flush on VM exits but that is a Java 1.3 method so cannot be sused in Log4j as I understand it.ssCurrent Status:sI have written a new appender \"LevelFlushedFileAppender\" that extends sFileAppender that does this job.  This works fine and I am happy to submit sit.  However I think that it would be better to alter the FileAppender itself sand add the code directly to thiss so it could be inherited in all classes sextending FileAppender.  I am happy to implement it like this also.ssLet me know if the feature is accepted or you want further informations and swhat I should do going forward."

message: MATH-658 Dead code in FastMath.pow(doubles double) and some improvement in test coveragessgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@1166771 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Dead code in FastMath.pow(doubles double) and some improvement in test coverage
description: This issue concerns the FastMath class and its test class.ss(1) In the double pow(doubles double) functions there are 2 identical \if\" blocks. The second one can be suppressed.s                if (y < 0 && y == yi && (yi & 1) == 1) {s                    return Double.NEGATIVE_INFINITY;s                }ss                // this block is never used -> to be suppresseds                if (y < 0 && y == yi && (yi & 1) == 1) {s                    return -0.0;s                }ss                if (y > 0 && y == yi && (yi & 1) == 1) {s                    return -0.0;s                }sss(2) To obtain better code coverages we added some tests case in FastMathTest.java (see attached file)s- Added test for log1ps- Added tests in testPowSpecialCases()s- Added tests for a 100% coverage of acos().s- Added tests for a 100% coverage of asin().s"

name: ant-ivy
message: Fix the encoding used in XML reports s use UTF-8 as initialy requested in IVY-816ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@661318 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Report encoding is incorrect
description: The xsd for ivy specifies xs:string for the values of module and organisations so non 8859 characters are supported.s		            <xs:attribute name=\organisation\" type=\"xs:string\" use=\"required\"/>s		            <xs:attribute name=\"module\" type=\"xs:string\" use=\"required\"/>ssBut currently the ivy report is written with xml encoding 8859.ss        out.println(\"<?xml version=\\\"1.0\\\" encoding=\\\"ISO-8859-1\\\"?>\");s        out.println(\"<?xml-stylesheet type=\\\"text/xsl\\\" href=\\\"ivy-report.xsl\\\"?>\");ssIf the encoding written from XmlReportWriter was changed to UTF-8 then the report could display dbcs characters.ss"

name: log4j
message: Bug 43131: Remove dummy: protocol from XMLDecoderssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/log4j/branches/BRANCH_1_3_ABANDONED@566272 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: XMLDecoder uses dummy: protocol for DTD
description: XMLDecoder calls setSystemID(\dummy://log4j.dtd\") to set an absolute URL so that parser could sabsolutize the relative URL for the log4j.dtd in the DOCTYPE declaration.  Some parsers check that the sprotocol is registered and will complain.  A better solution is to provide an absolute URL for the DOCTYPE sdeclaration that is added to the decoded fragments and avoid the need to absolutize the URL before the sentity resolver handles it.  The problem was reported on log4j-user on 2007-08-15."

name: velocity
message: Prevent string out of bounds exception.  Thanks Klemen Zagar!  VELOCITY-432.ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/velocity/engine/trunk@385939 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: #stop produces unexpected results when used with #parse
description: On 20th of January (2006) I took the latest trunk from SVNs and tried it against some Velocity templates I am just working on. I came across two bugss which I am reporting heres along with patches:ss1. When #stop is issued from within #parses the processing of subsequent #parse directives does not stop. Since expressions are no longer being rendered after a #stops the parameter to #parse can be an empty strings resulting in an unexpected exception that confuses the user. I am attaching an example that reproduces this (stop3.vms stop3-include.vm)s with a patch s(-1.patch).ss2. I came across a string-out-of-bounds exception which happened because string length was not being checked. Patch is attached.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1206. Sequential node creation does not use always use digits in node name given certain Locales. (Mark Miller via phunt)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.4@1177434 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Sequential node creation does not use always use digits in node name given certain Locales.
description: While I always expect to be able to parse a sequential node by looking for digitss under some locals you end up with non digits - for example: n_‡•¶‡•¶‡•¶‡•¶‡•¶‡•¶‡•¶‡•¶‡•¶‡•¶ssIt looks like the problem is around line 236 in PrepRequestProcessor:ss{code}s                if (createMode.isSequential()) {s                    path = path + String.format(\%010d\"s parentCVersion);s                }s{code}ssInstead we should pass Locale.ENGLISH to the format call.ss{code}s                if (createMode.isSequential()) {s                    path = path + String.format(Locale.ENGLISHs \"%010d\"s parentCVersion);s                }s{code}ssLucene/Solr tests with random Localess and some of my tests that try and inspect the node name and order things expect to find digits - currently my leader election recipe randomly fails when the wrong locale pops up."

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1906. zkpython: invalid data in GetData for empty node (Nikita Vetoshkin via michim)sssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1583783 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: zkpython: invalid data in GetData for empty node
description: In python if we ask {{zookeeper.get}} (which translates into {{pyzoo_get}}) for empty node we can get trash in result on Python level. Issue is pretty tricky. It goes like this:s  * python C extension allocates buffer with malloc {{buffer = malloc(sizeof(char)*buffer_len);}} and calls {{zoo_wget}} providing both {{buffer}} and {{buffer_len}}.s  * deserialize_GetDataResponse deserializes empty buffer and sets {{buffer_len}} to -1 and {{zoo_wget}} returns.s  * python C extension calls {{Py_BuildValue( \(s#sN)\"s buffersbuffer_len ...}} with {{buffer_len}} set to -1.s  * {{Py_BuildValue}} calls {{do_mkvalue}} to build python string which falls back to {{strlen(str)}} in case string length ({{buffer_len < 0}}) - that's our case.s  * *usually* strlen returns 0s because e.g. linux uses magic zero filled page as result of mmap (which is being copied upon page faults i.e. when you want to write to it)s  * everything works!ssBut on FreeBSD (not always) we can get random data in {{malloc}} result and this trash will be exposed to the user.ssNot sure about the right way to fix thiss but something likes{noformat}sIndex: src/contrib/zkpython/src/c/zookeeper.cs===================================================================s--- src/contrib/zkpython/src/c/zookeeper.c	(revision 1583238)s+++ src/contrib/zkpython/src/c/zookeeper.c	(working copy)s@@ -1223s7 +1223s7 @@s   }s s   PyObject *stat_dict = build_stat( &stat );s-  PyObject *ret = Py_BuildValue( \"(s#sN)\"s buffersbuffer_lens stat_dict );s+  PyObject *ret = Py_BuildValue( \"(s#sN)\"s buffersbuffer_len < 0 ? 0 : buffer_lens stat_dict );s   free(buffer);s s   return ret;s{noformat}sshould do the trick"

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2240: Make the three-node minimum more explicit in documentationsand on website (Shawn Heisey via rgs)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.5@1713321 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Make the three-node minimum more explicit in documentation and on website
description: One of the most important parts of a production zookeeper deployment is the three-node minimum requirement for fault tolerance ... but when I glance at the website and the documentations this requirement is difficult to actually find.ssIt is buried deep in the admin documentations in a sentence that says \Thuss a deployment that consists of three machines can handle one failures and a deployment of five machines can handle two failures.\"  Other parts of the documentation hint at its but nothing that I've seen comes out and explicitly says it.ssIdeallys documentation about this requirement would be in a location where it can be easily pinpointed with a targeted URLs so I can point to ZK documentation with a link and clearly tell SolrCloud users that this is a real requirement.ssIf someone can point me to version control locations where I can check out or clone the docs and the websites I'm happy to attempt a patch."

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-888: c-client / zkpython: Double free corruption on nodeswatcher (Austin Shoemaker via henryr)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/trunk@1024358 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: c-client / zkpython: Double free corruption on node watcher
description: the c-client / zkpython wrapper invokes already freed watcher callbacksssteps to reproduce:s  0. start a zookeper server on your machines  1. run the attached python scripts  2. suspend the zookeeper server process (e.g. using `pkill -STOP -f org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.QuorumPeerMain` )s  3. wait until the connection and the node observer fired with a session events  4. resume the zookeeper server process  (e.g. using `pkill -CONT -f org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.QuorumPeerMain` )ss-> the client tries to dispatch the node observer function agains but it was already freed -> double free corruption

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-593.  java client api does not allow client to access negotiated session timeout (phunt via mahadev)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/trunk@903050 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: java client api does not allow client to access negotiated session timeout
description: The java client api does not allow the client to access the negotiated session timeout (c does allow this).ssIn some cases the client may not get the requested timeout (server applies a min/max bound) in which casesthe client user code may want to examine the timeout it did receive.

name: ant-ivy
message: FIX: NullPointerException reported instead of error in ivy:cachepath (IVY-690)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@618445 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: NullPointerException reported instead of error in ivy:cachepath
description: Using the erroneous:ss<ivy:cachepath organisation=\apache\" module=\"commons-lang\" revision=\"2.3\"  pathid=\"lib.path.id\" inline=\"true\"/>ssleads to the error message:ssNo ivy:settings found for the default reference 'ivy.instance'.  A default instance will be usedsno settings file founds using default...s[ivy:cachepath] :: Ivy 2.0.0-beta1 - 20071206070608 ::shttp://ant.apache.org/ivy/ ::s:: loading settings :: url = jar:file:/home/users/russel/lib/Java/groovy/lib/ivy-2.0.0-beta1.jar!/org/apache/ivy/core/settings/ivysettings.xmlssBUILD FAILEDs/home/Checkouts/SVK/Gant/local/gant/trunk/examples/ivy/build.xml:36:simpossible to resolve dependencies:s        java.lang.NullPointerExceptionssCorrect the ivy:cachepath to:ss<ivy:cachepath organisation=\"commons-lang\" module=\"commons-lang\" revision=\"2.3\"  pathid=\"lib.path.id\" inline=\"true\"/>ssand everything works as expected.  The error report here is that a message other than NullPointerException should be generated.s"

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1117. zookeeper 3.3.3 fails to build with gcc >= 4.6.1 on Debian/Ubuntu (James Page via mahadev)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1162013 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: zookeeper 3.3.3 fails to build with gcc >= 4.6.1 on Debian/Ubuntu
description: zookeeper 3.3.3 (and 3.3.1) fails to build on Debian and Ubuntu systems with gcc >= 4.6.1:ss/bin/bash ./libtool  --tag=CC   --mode=compile gcc -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -I.  -I./include -I./tests -I./generated  -Wall -Werror  -g -O2 -D_GNU_SOURCE -MT zookeeper.lo -MD -MP -MF .deps/zookeeper.Tpo -c -o zookeeper.lo `test -f 'src/zookeeper.c' || echo './'`src/zookeeper.cslibtool: compile:  gcc -DHAVE_CONFIG_H -I. -I./include -I./tests -I./generated -Wall -Werror -g -O2 -D_GNU_SOURCE -MT zookeeper.lo -MD -MP -MF .deps/zookeeper.Tpo -c src/zookeeper.c  -fPIC -DPIC -o .libs/zookeeper.ossrc/zookeeper.c: In function 'getaddrs':ssrc/zookeeper.c:455:13: error: variable 'port' set but not used [-Werror=unused-but-set-variable]scc1: all warnings being treated as errorsssSee http://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=625441 for more information.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-219. fix events.poll timeout in watcher test to be longer. (pat via mahadev)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/trunk@718445 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: events.poll timeout in watcher test too short
description: in watchertest there are some event.poll calls that have 1milli timeoutsss        e = localWatcher.events.poll(1s TimeUnit.MILLISECONDS);ssthis is showing falure in some cases under hudson (I assume when it's under load from other tests running for other proj)ssWe should review the poll calls and verify adequate timeouts.s

name: log4j
message: - New tests in PatternLayoutTestCasess- The ANT build script was modified to use jar files specified ins  the build.properties file instead of the CLASSPATH environments  variable. The build.properties file depends on local paths and iss  supplied by the user. The build.properties.sample file is includeds  in the distribution. The build.sh and build.bat scripts haves  been removed. This is the way many other jakarta projects build theirs  projects. The jar files in the dist/lib directory were also removeds  since they are no longer used.ss- Notes about the new way for building the project.sssPR:sObtained from:sSubmitted by:sReviewed by:sssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/log4j/trunk@309471 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-184. tests: An explicit include derective is needed for the usage  of memcpy()s memset()s strlen()s strdup() and free() functions --- also addressed some missing jiras from CHANGES.txtssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/trunk@704667 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: tests: An explicit include derective is needed for the usage of memcpy()s memset()s strlen()s strdup() and free() functions.
description: Some compilation environments provide implicit inclusion of certain system headers.sBut any way it's not a reason to exploit it in platform-independent projects.ssTestHashtable.cc and LibCMocks.h from src/c/tests/ use those functions without including corresponding system headers.ssModern versions of GCC are very strict.sYou cannot build the code like this with the help of GCC version 4.3.

name: CommonsMath
message: Should only test against public methods.ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/branches/MATH_2_X@1062302 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s

name: CommonsMath
message: Made getKernel return a constant distribution for zero variance bins.  JIRA: MATH-1203.s
title: getKernel fails for buckets with only multiple instances of the same value in random.EmpiricalDistribution
description: After loading a set of values into an EmpericalDistributions assume that there's a case where a single bin ONLY contains multiple instances of the same value.  In this case the standard deviation will equal zero.  This will fail when getKernel attempts to create a NormalDistribution.  The other case where stddev=0 is when there is only a single value in the bins and this is handled by returning a ConstantRealDistribution rather than a NormalDistrbution.ssSee: https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/MATH-984

name: CommonsMath
message: MATH-865sUpdate \changes\" file.sssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@1388554 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s"
title: Wide bounds to CMAESOptimizer result in NaN parameters passed to fitness function
description: If you give large values as lower/upper bounds (for example -Double.MAX_VALUE as a lower bound)s the optimizer can call the fitness function with parameters set to NaN.  My guess is this is due to FitnessFunction.encode/decode generating NaN when normalizing/denormalizing parameters.  For examples if the difference between the lower and upper bound is greater than Double.MAX_VALUEs encode could divide infinity by infinity.

name: CommonsMath
message: MATH-494 Allow for sufficiently close numbers but still detect +/- 0 differencessgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@1062089 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: FastMath atan2 does not agree with StrictMath for special cases
description: FastMath atan2 does not agree with StrictMath for special cases.ssThere are two sign problems:satan2(double -0.0s double -Infinity) expected -3.141592653589793 actual 3.141592653589793 name: ant-ivy
message: FIX: Ivy descriptors are merged incorrectly when there is an <exclude> element (IVY-1356)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@1376738 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: ivy descriptors are merged incorrectly
description: I'm making use of parent definition in ivy files to define general dependencies and configuration across projects.ssParent file is typically something like:ss{code}ss<ivy-module version=\2.0\" s            xmlns:xsi=\"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance\"s            xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation=\"http://ant.apache.org/ivy/schemas/ivy.xsd\"s            xmlns:m=\"http://ant.apache.org/ivy/maven\">    s    <info organisation=\"com.mycompany\" module=\"parent\" revision=\"1.0\" status=\"release\" publication=\"20120101020304\">s    </info>s    s    <configurations>s        <conf name=\"default\" description=\"Default dependencies\"/>s        <conf name=\"runtime\" description=\"Only runtime\" extends=\"default\" visibility=\"private\"/>s        <conf name=\"test\" description=\"Only for unit testing\" extends=\"compilesruntime\" visibility=\"private\"/>s        <conf name=\"compile\" description=\"Only for compilation\" extends=\"default\" visibility=\"private\"/>s        <conf name=\"sources\" description=\"Sources\"/>s        <conf name=\"javadoc\" description=\"Javadoc\"/>s    </configurations>s    s    <dependencies>s        <dependency org=\"org.testng\" name=\"testng\" rev=\"6.4\" conf=\"test->default\"/>s    </dependencies>ss</ivy-module>s{code}ssIvy file for the project is typically:sss{code}s<ivy-module version=\"2.0\" s            xmlns:xsi=\"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance\"s            xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation=\"http://ant.apache.org/ivy/schemas/ivy.xsd\"s            xmlns:m=\"http://ant.apache.org/ivy/maven\">s    <info organisation=\"com.mycompany.service\" module=\"${project.name}\">s        <extends organisation=\"com.mycompany\" module=\"parent\" revision=\"${ivy.parent.revision}\" location=\"${ivy.parent.location}\"/>s        s    </info>ss    <publications>s        <artifact name=\"${project.name}\" type=\"jar\" ext=\"jar\" conf=\"default\"/>s        <artifact name=\"${project.name}\" type=\"source\" ext=\"jar\" conf=\"sources\" m:classifier=\"sources\"/>s        <artifact name=\"${project.name}\" type=\"javadoc\" ext=\"jar\" conf=\"javadoc\" m:classifier=\"javadoc\"/>s    </publications>s    <dependencies>s        <dependency org=\"org.jackson\" name=\"jackson\" rev=\"1.9.5\" conf=\"default\"/>s        <exclude org=\"javax.servlet\" module=\"servlet-api\"/>s        <exclude org=\"javax.servlet\" module=\"servlet\"/>s    </dependencies>s</ivy-module>ss{code}ssThe result end up being a merge which is incompatible with the schema since dependency and exclude end up being mixed when the file is delivered:ss{code}s<ivy-module version=\"2.0\" xmlns:xsi=\"http://www.w3.org/2001/XMLSchema-instance\" xsi:noNamespaceSchemaLocation=\"http://ant.apache.org/ivy/schemas/ivy.xsd\" xmlns:m=\"http://ant.apache.org/ivy/maven\">s    <info organisation=\"com.mycompany.service\" module=\"myproject\" revision=\"1.2.8.20120604181037\" status=\"development\" publication=\"20120604141056\">s        <!-- <extends organisation=\"com.mycompany\" module=\"parent\" revision=\"1.0.0\" location=\"/somewhere/ivy-parent.xml\"/> -->ss    </info>s    <configurations>s    s        <!-- configurations inherited from com.mycompany#parent;1.0.0 -->s        <conf name=\"default\" visibility=\"public\" description=\"Default dependencies\"/>s        <conf name=\"runtime\" visibility=\"private\" description=\"Only runtime\" extends=\"default\"/>s        <conf name=\"test\" visibility=\"private\" description=\"Only for unit testing\" extends=\"compilesruntime\"/>s        <conf name=\"compile\" visibility=\"private\" description=\"Only for compilation\" extends=\"default\"/>s        <conf name=\"sources\" visibility=\"public\" description=\"Sources\"/>s        <conf name=\"javadoc\" visibility=\"public\" description=\"Javadoc\"/>s    </configurations>s    <publications>s        <artifact name=\"myproject\" type=\"jar\" ext=\"jar\" conf=\"default\"/>s        <artifact name=\"myproject\" type=\"source\" ext=\"jar\" conf=\"sources\" m:classifier=\"sources\"/>s        <artifact name=\"myproject\" type=\"javadoc\" ext=\"jar\" conf=\"javadoc\" m:classifier=\"javadoc\"/>s    </publications>s    <dependencies>s        s        s        <dependency org=\"org.codehaus\" name=\"jackson\" rev=\"1.9.5\" conf=\"default\"/>ss        <exclude org=\"javax.servlet\" module=\"servlet-api\"/>s        <exclude org=\"javax.servlet\" module=\"servlet\"/>s    s        <!-- dependencies inherited from com.mycompany#parent;1.0.0 -->s        <dependency org=\"org.testng\" name=\"testng\" rev=\"6.4\" conf=\"test->default\"/>sconf=\"default->api;newrelic->default\"/>s    </dependencies>s</ivy-module>ss{code}s"

message: FIX: ivy:resolve ignores branch in \dynamic\" resolve mode (IVY-1087) (thanks to Aleksey Zhukov)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@788538 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s"
title: ivy:resolve ignores branch in \dynamic\" resolve mode"
description: When I call ivy:resolve as followings<ivy:resolve file=\${deps.file}\" showProgress=\"false\" conf=\"compile\" resolveMode=\"dynamic\"/>sand having s<ivy pattern=\"${ivy.local.default.root}/[organisation]/[branch]/[module]-ivys/ivy-[revision].xml\"/>s<artifact pattern=\"${ivy.local.default.root}/[organisation]/[branch]/[artifact]-[revision].[ext]\"/> sset in my defaultResolversivy:resolver ignores [branch] and looks for ivy.xml in \"${ivy.local.default.root}/[organisation]//[module]-ivys/ivy-[revision].xml\"sand artifact in  \"${ivy.local.default.root}/[organisation]//[artifact]-[revision].[ext]\".ssHowever if I call <ivy:resolve file=\"${deps.file}\" showProgress=\"false\" conf=\"compile\"/> without resolveMode sets everything is fine and resolve follows [organisation]/[branch] path.ss"

name: ant-ivy
message: FIX: the vfs resolver should not log passwords (IVY-292) (thanks to Antoine Levy-Lambert)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/ivy/trunk@484518 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: the vfs resolver should not log passwords
description: the vfs resolver (or the publish and resolve tasks) output this type of messages :ss[ivy:publish] 	published ivy to webdav://admin:password_in_clear_text@dev-build:85/ivyrep/jayasoft/standalone.1/ivy.xmlssorss[ivy:retrieve] 			vfs-resolver: tried webdav://admin:password_in_clear_text@dev-build:85/ivyrep/jayasoft/standalone.latest.integration/ivy.xmlssssI would suggest using regular expressions to find the passwords to put **** instead of password_in_clear_text.ssThe problem is that the continuous integration tools publish the logs to an Intranet (we are using AnthillPros but I expect the same with CruiseControl)s so the net effect would be that all the developers would know the password that only the build manager is supposed to know. Pluss if you are in a company with IT audits the auditors are going to shred you into pieces when they see that.ssBest regardss Ivy is a great tool !ss

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2716: Flaky Test: org.apache.zookeeper.server.SessionTrackerTest.testAddSessionAfterSessionExpiryssWe can't let the gate open until we increase the closed session count. Otherwise depends on timings the test thread might see old session close count value between gate open and the session count actually gets increased.ssAuthor: Michael Han <hanm@apache.org>ssReviewers: Abraham Fine <afine@apache.org>s Rakesh Radhakrishnan <rakeshr@apache.org>ssCloses #187 from hanm/ZOOKEEPER-2716ss(cherry picked from commit 86438f9c6e65b2a95d709bf575cdcc2abc1c2e8b)sSigned-off-by: Rakesh Radhakrishnan <rakeshr@apache.org>s

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-597. ASyncHammerTest is failing intermittently on hudson trunksssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/trunk@886241 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: ASyncHammerTest is failing intermittently on hudson trunk
description: ASyncHammerTest is failing intermittently on hudson trunk. There is no clear reason why this is happenings butsit seems from the logs that a session connection to a follower is failing during session establishment - thesfailure seems to be a problem either on the follower or leader. The server gets the session create requests butsit stalls in the request processor pipeline. (we see it go ins but we do not see it com eout)ssunfortunately all efforts to reproduce this on non-hudson trunk have failed. Even trying to reproduce bysrunning on hudson host itself (manually) has failed.ssWe need to instrument the client session creation code in the test to dump the thread stack if thessession creation fails.s

description: In order to limit object creations the current implementation of the {{SymmLQ}} solver makes heavy use of references accross nested classes in {{SymmLQ}}. This makes the code difficult to reads and should be modifieds keeping the public API.

name: ant-ivy
message: FIX: build fails without emma code coverage JARs present (IVY-478)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/ivy/core/trunk@536351 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: build fails without emma code coverage JARs present
description: > BUILD FAILEDs> /Users/jtb/src/dependencies/init-ivy.xml:46: The following error occurreds> while executing this line:s> jar:file:/Users/jtb/.ivy/jars/ivy.jar!/fr/jayasoft/ivy/ant/antlib.xml:21:s> taskdef A class needed by class org.apache.ivy.ant.IvyConfigure cannot bes> found: com/vladium/emma/rt/RTsssOKs I think I know where the problem comes from. In our build when we usesemma to instrument classes we instrument classes in place. Usually this issnot a problem because the jar which is published is packaged before thissintrumentation... but if you run a first build with instrumentations andsthen run a second build without cleanings the jar produced by the secondsbuild will contain instrumented classess which of course are not meant to besactually used.ss

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-309. core dump using zoo_get_acl()ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/trunk@752730 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: core dump using zoo_get_acl()
description: The zookeeper_process() function incorrectly calls the c.acl_result member of the completion_list_t structure when handling the completion from a synchronous zoo_get_acl() request.  The c.acl_result member is set to SYNCHRONOUS_MARKERs which is a null pointer.ssThe attached patch removes this call.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-921. zkPython incorrectly checks for existence of requiredsACL elements (Nicholas Knight via henryr)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.3@1053494 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: zkPython incorrectly checks for existence of required ACL elements
description: Calling {{zookeeper.create()}} seemss under certain circumstancess to be corrupting a subsequent call to Python's {{logging}} module.ssSpecificallys if the node does not exist (but its parent does)s I end up with a traceback like this when I try to make the logging call:ss{noformat}sTraceback (most recent call last):s  File \zktest.py\"s line 21s in <module>s    logger.error(\"Boom?\")s  File \"/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.6/lib/python2.6/logging/__init__.py\"s line 1046s in errors    if self.isEnabledFor(ERROR):s  File \"/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.6/lib/python2.6/logging/__init__.py\"s line 1206s in isEnabledFors    return level >= self.getEffectiveLevel()s  File \"/System/Library/Frameworks/Python.framework/Versions/2.6/lib/python2.6/logging/__init__.py\"s line 1194s in getEffectiveLevels    while logger:sTypeError: an integer is requireds{noformat}ssBut if the node already existss or the parent does not exists I get the appropriate NodeExists or NoNode exceptions.ssI'll be attaching a test script that can be used to reproduce this behavior."

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2687: Deadlock while shutting down the Leader serverssLeader server enters into deadlock while shutting down itself. Shutdown of the leader server is called from the synchronized block which must be called from outside the synchronized block. For detail pls refer ZOOKEEPER-2380ssAuthor: Mohammad Arshad <arshad@apache.org>ssReviewers: Abraham Fine <afine@apache.org>s Rakesh Radhakrishnan <rakeshr@apache.org>ssCloses #176 from arshadmohammad/ZOOKEEPER-2687 and squashes the following commits:ss7551f5c [Mohammad Arshad] Fixed Rakesh's commentss1e3ed70 [Mohammad Arshad] ZOOKEEPER-2687:Deadlock while shutting down the Leader server.ss(cherry picked from commit fd211a5275b6231e668268fb9df2820e07f5f33c)sSigned-off-by: Rakesh Radhakrishnan <rakeshr@apache.org>s
title: Deadlock between leader shutdown and forwarding ACK to the leader||Deadlock while shutting down the Leader server.
description: Zookeeper enters into deadlock while shutting down itselfs thus making zookeeper service unavailable as deadlocked server is a leader. Here is the thread dump:s{code}s\QuorumPeer[myid=1](plain=/0:0:0:0:0:0:0:0:2181)(secure=disabled)\" #25 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fbc502a6800 nid=0x834 in Object.wait() [0x00007fbc4d9a8000] ¬†¬†¬†¬† java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (on object monitor) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at java.lang.Thread.join(Thread.java:1245) ¬†¬†¬†¬† - locked <s0x00000000feb78000> (a org.apache.zookeeper.server.SyncRequestProcessor) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at java.lang.Thread.join(Thread.java:1319) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.SyncRequestProcessor.shutdown(SyncRequestProcessor.java:196) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.ProposalRequestProcessor.shutdown(ProposalRequestProcessor.java:90) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.PrepRequestProcessor.shutdown(PrepRequestProcessor.java:1016) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.LeaderRequestProcessor.shutdown(LeaderRequestProcessor.java:78) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.ZooKeeperServer.shutdown(ZooKeeperServer.java:561) ¬†¬†¬†¬† - locked <s0x00000000feb61e20> (a org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.LeaderZooKeeperServer) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.QuorumZooKeeperServer.shutdown(QuorumZooKeeperServer.java:169) ¬†¬†¬†¬† - locked <s0x00000000feb61e20> (a org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.LeaderZooKeeperServer) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.LeaderZooKeeperServer.shutdown(LeaderZooKeeperServer.java:102) ¬†¬†¬†¬† - locked <s0x00000000feb61e20> (a org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.LeaderZooKeeperServer) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.Leader.shutdown(Leader.java:637) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.Leader.lead(Leader.java:590) ¬†¬†¬†¬† - locked <s0x00000000feb781a0> (a org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.Leader) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.QuorumPeer.run(QuorumPeer.java:1108)sss\"SyncThread:1\" #46 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fbc5848f000 nid=0x867 waiting for monitor entry [0x00007fbc4ca90000] ¬†¬†¬†¬† java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED (on object monitor) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.Leader.processAck(Leader.java:784) ¬†¬†¬†¬† - waiting to lock <0x00000000feb781a0> (a org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.Leader) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.AckRequestProcessor.processRequest(AckRequestProcessor.java:46) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.SyncRequestProcessor.flush(SyncRequestProcessor.java:183) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.SyncRequestProcessor.run(SyncRequestProcessor.java:113)s{code}ssLeader.lead() calls shutdown() from the synchronized blocks it acquired lock on Leader.java instances{code}swhile (true) {s                synchronized (this) {s                long start = Time.currentElapsedTime();s				.....s{code}sIn the shutdown flow SyncThread is trying to acquire lock on the same Leader.java instance. ssLeader thread acquired lock and waiting for SyncThread shutdown. SyncThread waiting for the lock to complete its shutdown.  This is how ZooKeeper entered into deadlock||Leader server enters into deadlock while shutting down. This happens some time only.sThe reason and deadlock flow is same as ZOOKEEPER-2380.sshutdown was removed from synchronized block in ZOOKEEPER-2380sNow shutdown is called from synchronized block from another place.s{code}s// check leader running statussif (!this.isRunning()) {s    shutdown(\"Unexpected internal error\");s    return;s}s{code}"

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2726 ZOOKEEPER-2693: Patch for introduces potential race conditionss#196ssAuthor: Kyle Nusbaum <knusbaum@yahoo-inc.com>ssReviewers: Govind Menons Kishor Patil <patik523@yahoo.com>s Michael Han <hanm@apache.org>ssCloses #198 from knusbaum/ZOOKEEPER-2726-3.5s
title: DOS attack on wchp/wchc four letter words (4lw)
description: The wchp/wchc four letter words can be exploited in a DOS attack on the ZK client port - typically 2181. The following POC attack was recently published on the web:sshttps://webcache.googleusercontent.com/search?q=cache:_CNGIz10PRYJ:https://www.exploit-db.com/exploits/41277/+&cd=14&hl=en&ct=clnk&gl=usssThe most straightforward way to block this attack is to not allow access to the client port to non-trusted clients - i.e. firewall the ZooKeeper service and only allow access to trusted applications using it for coordination.

name: log4j
message: Bug 37930: Inadvertently removed required mkdir on jar creationssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/log4j/branches/v1_2-branch@539686 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Use Maven 2.x for site generation and possibly build
description: Maven is a Software Project Management tool (http://maven.apache.org).  One ofsthe primary benefits of supporting and possibly migrating to Maven is generationsof the log4j web site allowing the current unmaintainable site generation codesto slowly fade away.ssTo build log4j with Maven 2.x (as of the initial commit on this bug):ss1. Install Maven 2.0.xs2. Obtain required Sun Jars and installssmvn install:install-file -Dfile=jaf-1.0.2/activation.jar \s    -DgroupId=javax.activation \s    -DartifactId=activation -Dversion=1.0.2 -Dpackaging=jarssmvn install:install-file -Dfile=javamail-1.3.2/mail.jar \s    -DgroupId=javax.mail \s    -DartifactId=mail -Dversion=1.3.3 -Dpackaging=jarsssmvn install:install-file -Dfile=jms1.1/lib/jms.jar \s    -DgroupId=javax.jms \s    -DartifactId=jms -Dversion=1.1 -Dpackaging=jarsssmvn install:install-file -Dfile=jmx-1_2_1-bin/lib/jmxri.jar \s    -DgroupId=com.sun.jmx \s    -DartifactId=jmxri -Dversion=1.2.1 -Dpackaging=jarss3. Build log4j.jar ssmvn jar:jarss4. Build sitessmvn site

name: ant-ivy
message: FIX: setting m2compatible on ibiblio resolver overwrite root and pattern settings (IVY-437) (thanks to Jing Xue)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@644398 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: setting m2compatible on ibiblio resolver overwrite root and pattern settings
description: Setting m2compatible=\true\" on an ibiblio resolver overwrites the root and pattern settingss even if they were set manually. Depending on the order of attributes and the xml parser useds the result is varying (if setM2compatible is called before setRoots the configured root will be useds otherwise it's the default value for m2compatible which will be used!"
