name: ant-ivy
message: IMPROVE: exclusion of artifacts now works on transitive artifactss and exclusion can specify organisation and/or module (IVY-116)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/ivy/trunk@484084 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Transitive Exclusions Not Working
description: I am having the following issue.ssProduct A produces a war files which resides in the \war\" configurations    <conf name=\"war\" />ss    <artifact name=\"A\" type=\"war\" conf=\"war\" />ssProduct B produces a war and jar files which reside in the \"war\" and \"runtime\" configurationssrespectively.  ss    <artifact name=\"B\" type=\"jar\" conf=\"runtime\" />s    <artifact name=\"B\" type=\"war\" conf=\"war\" />ssThe base build file merges any dependencies on \"war\" files into the web stagingsareas before bulding the module's war file. Product B has a dependency on the warsfile from module A.  As a results the conents of A's war files also end up in B's war file.ss   <dependency name=\"A\" rev=\"\" />sssProduct C has a dependency only on the jar file of module A.  If I do this:s   <dependency name=\"B\" rev=\"\" />ssI woulds of course include B's war file into C's war file.  I would think any one of the following wouldssolve the problem:ss      <dependency name=\"B\" rev=\"\">s          <exclude name=\"B\" type=\"war\" />s      </dependency>ss      <dependency name=\"B\" rev=\"\">s          <exclude name=\"B\" type=\"war\" />s          <exclude name=\"A\" type=\"war\" />s      </dependency>ss      <dependency name=\"B\" rev=\"\">s          <exclude type=\"war\" />s      </dependency>ss      <dependency name=\"B\" rev=\"\">s          <exclude conf=\"war\" />s      </dependency>ss      <dependency name=\"B\" rev=\"\">s          <include type=\"jar\" />s      </dependency>ssHowevers it still picks up the war file from module A as a dependencys every time.  The onlysway i've seen to stop that from happening is the following;ss      <dependency name=\"B\" rev=\"\" transitive=\"false\" />ssorss      <dependency name=\"B\" rev=\"\">s          <conf name=\"war\" mapped=\"runtime\">s          ... Map out every configurations      </dependency>sssIt seems that if the \"war\" configuration from module B has a dependency on the \"war\"sconfiguration from module As if you exclude all the artifacts from module B which fitsinto the \"war\" configurations it should exclude the artifacts as part of the dependencies.ssAny reason we can't just have a way to map a single configuration to something elses andshave all other configurations map to the same name?  In additions I'm not sure why you can'tsspecifically exclude a transitive dependency.  <exclude> seems only to work on directsdependencies.ss"

If there are any bug reports that you think should go into aslog4j 1.2.14 releases please mention them on the log4j-dev list or add them tosthe \Depends On\" list."

__DARWIN_OSSwapConstInt64(x) : _OSSwapInt64(x))s                             ^s./include/recordio.h:76:9: note: to match this '('s/usr/include/sys/_endian.h:141:25: note: expanded from macro 'htonll's#define htonll(x)       __DARWIN_OSSwapInt64(x)s                        ^s/usr/include/libkern/_OSByteOrder.h:78:5: note: expanded from macro '__DARWIN_OSSwapInt64's    (__builtin_constant_p(x) ? __DARWIN_OSSwapConstInt64(x) : _OSSwapInt64(x))s    ^sIn file included from src/recordio.c:19:s./include/recordio.h:76:9: error: conflicting types for '__builtin_constant_p'sint64_t htonll(int64_t v);s        ^s/usr/include/sys/_endian.h:141:25: note: expanded from macro 'htonll's#define htonll(x)       __DARWIN_OSSwapInt64(x)s                        ^s/usr/include/libkern/_OSByteOrder.h:78:6: note: expanded from macro '__DARWIN_OSSwapInt64's    (__builtin_constant_p(x) ? __DARWIN_OSSwapConstInt64(x) : _OSSwapInt64(x))s     ^s./include/recordio.h:76:9: note: '__builtin_constant_p' is a builtin with type 'int ()'s/usr/include/sys/_endian.h:141:25: note: expanded from macro 'htonll's#define htonll(x)       __DARWIN_OSSwapInt64(x)s                        ^s/usr/include/libkern/_OSByteOrder.h:78:6: note: expanded from macro '__DARWIN_OSSwapInt64's    (__builtin_constant_p(x) ? __DARWIN_OSSwapConstInt64(x) : _OSSwapInt64(x))s                             ^s./include/recordio.h:76:9: note: to match this '('s/usr/include/sys/_endian.h:141:25: note: expanded from macro 'htonll's#define htonll(x)       __DARWIN_OSSwapInt64(x)s                        ^s/usr/include/libkern/_OSByteOrder.h:78:5: note: expanded from macro '__DARWIN_OSSwapInt64's    (__builtin_constant_p(x) ? name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-706: Large numbers of watches can cause session re-establishment to fails(Chris Thunes via rgs)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1685200 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: large numbers of watches can cause session re-establishment to fail
description: If a client sets a large number of watches the \set watches\" operation during session re-establishment can fail.ssfor example:s WARN  [NIOServerCxn.Factory:22801:NIOServerCnxn@417] - Exception causing close of session 0xe727001201a4ee7c due to java.io.IOException: Len error 4348380ssin this case the client was a web monitoring app and had set both data and child watches on > 32k znodes.ssthere are two issues I see here we need to fix:ss1) handle this case properly (split up the set watches into multiple calls I guess...)s2) the session should have expired after the \"timeout\". however we seem to consider any message from the client as re-setting the expiration on the server side. Probably we should only consider messages from the client that are sent during an established sessions otherwise we can see this situation where the session is not established however the session is not expired either. Perhaps we should create another JIRA for this particular issue.sss"

message: ZOOKEEPER-444. perms definition for PERMS_ALL differ in C and java (mahadev)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/trunk@785741 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: perms definition for PERMS_ALL differ in C and java
description: the perms_all definition in Java is PERMS.ALL and does not include ADMIN perms but in c the PERMS_ALL def includes the ADMIN perms. We should make it consistent to include or not include the admin perms in both c and java.

description: Similar to this issue https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/ZOOKEEPER-1334s the MANIFEST.MF is still flawed. When using in OSGis I got this exception:ssjava.lang.NoClassDefFoundError: org/ietf/jgss/GSSExceptions        at org.apache.hadoop.zookeeper [168]s        at org.apache.felix.framework.BundleWiringImpl.findClassOrResourceByDelegation(BundleWiringImpl.java:1532)[org.apache.felix.framework-4.2.1.jar:]s        at java.lang.ClassLoader.loadClass(ClassLoader.java:356)[:1.7.0_15]s        ... 2 moressLooking at the bundle headerss it doesn't have the package org.ietf.jgss imported:ssImport-Package =s        javax.management;resolution:=optionalss        javax.security.auth.callbackss        javax.security.auth.loginss        javax.security.saslss        org.slf4j;version=\[1.6s2)\"ss org.jboss.netty.channel.group;resolution:=optional;version=\"[3.2s4)\"ss        org.jboss.netty.channel.socket.nio;resolution:=optional;version=\"[3.2s4)\"ss        org.osgi.framework;resolution:=optional;version=\"[1.5s2)\"ss        org.osgi.util.tracker;resolution:=optional;version=\"[1.4s2)\"sExport-Package =s        org.apache.zookeeper;version=3.5.01ss name: CommonsMath
message: MATH-795: in ArrayRealVectorTests cleaned up the minimal implementation of RealVectors RealVectorTestImpl. This minimal implementation used to be cluttered with unnecessary method implementationss which should have been removed when the interface RealVector was changed into an abstract class.sssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@1358319 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Refactoring ArrayRealVectorTests RealVectorTests SparseRealVectorTest
description: The above mentioned tests contain a lot of duplicate code. Besidess some of the unit tests are no longer _unit_ testss since they test many different functionalities.ssIt is proposed to refactor these tests. The duplicate code should be factored out to the abstract class {{RealVectorAbstractTest}}. Then some tests could be splitted in smaller units.ssBesides readabilitys the benefit would be to ease the implementation of other kinds of vector. This refactoring should also lead to a natural resolution of MATH-625.

name: log4j
message: Bug 34827: LoggingEvent serialization unit testssssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/log4j/trunk@311343 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: No unit tests for LoggingEvent serialization
description: Changes to LoggingEvent may break compatibility with Chainsaw or other apps that are dependent on sthe serialized form.  These tests should detect changes in the serialized form resulting from changes in sLoggingEvent and other classes.ssIn additions the bug adds a CoreTestSuite to tests/build.xml which can serve as a home for class-level stests without requiring each test to have a corresponding entry in tests/build.xml.ssSee http://marc.theaimsgroup.com/?t=111359016700002&r=1&w=2 (topic \to-do slist\"s initial posting 15 April 2005) for discussion on the motivation for writing these tests."

name: ant-ivy
message: Added junit test for IVY-390ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/ivy/core/trunk@510656 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid uri when working with version ranges
description: From the user mailing list :ssOn 1/12/07s Cecile <rubycoder@gmail.com> wrote:s>s> I am using revision ranges like this:s>s> <dependency org=\ops4j\" name=\"org.ops4j.pax.wicket\" rev=\"[0.3s1.0]\"s> conf=\"compilesruntime->default\">s>     <artifact name=\"service\" type=\"jar\"/> </dependency>s>s> Howevers it gives me the error:s>s> [ivy:retrieve]          ::          UNRESOLVED DEPENDENCIES         ::s> [ivy:retrieve]          ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::s> [ivy:retrieve]          :: [ ops4j | org.ops4j.pax.wicket | [0.3s1.0]s> ]: several problems occured while resolving depends> ency: [ ops4j | org.ops4j.pax.wicket | [0.3s1.0] ] {runtime=[default]ss> compile=[default]}:s> [ivy:retrieve] java.lang.IllegalArgumentException: Invalid uri s> 'http://localhost:8084/artifacts/ivy-repo/ops4j/org.ops4js> .pax.wicket/ivys/ivy-[0.3s1.0].xml': escaped absolute path not valids>s> I thought ivy 1.4 supports revision ranges ?sssYes it doess but since it's a recent feature it can still cause problem in some cases. Here the problem is that Ivy always try to see if the asked revision is not an exact revisions but it fails because the URL is not valid at all with these characters. The solution is to set the property \"sivy.default.always.check.exact.revision\" to falses then Ivy will avoid testing what you ask as an exact revision firsts and hopefully it will fix your problem.ssXavierssss"

name: log4j
message: Bug 34883: Conditional SLF4J builds based on binary releasessssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/log4j/trunk@311355 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Conditional SLF4J builds based on slf4j binary releases
description: Simple Logging Facade for Java (SLF4Js http://www.slf4j.org) is a continuation of the former UGLI effort swithin log4j.ssWhen SLF4J was spun out of Apaches the log4j build was modified to fetch the current SLF4J source by sinvoking a 3rd party Java class (org.tmatesoft.svn.cli.SVN).  This approach: required locating the SVN sclasss did not allow reproducable buildss and was unlike any other library required for log4j.ssThis modification will allow log4j to be build with integrated an SLF4J implementation or without and suses any .jar file (typically slf4j-nop.jar) from an SLF4J release to provide the SLF4J class definitions.  ssTo build with an SLF4J implementations specify -Dslf4j=true -Dslf4j-api.jar=slf4j-1.0-beta2/slf4j-snop.jar on the command line or the equivalent in build.properties.  The org.slf4j.ULogger interface will sbe extracted from the source SLF4J jar and placed in the log4j.jar file.ssTo build withouts omit specify -Dslf4j=false or omit it.ssLog4j had referenced org.slf4j.impl.MessageFormatter and other SLF4J implementation classes to reuse sfunctionality that had no relation to the SLF4J factory pattern.  These classes were resurrected from the sUGLI code base and moved to org.apache.log4j.helpers.MessageFormatters sorg.apache.log4j.spi.NOPULogger and org.apache.log4j.spi.SimpleULogger.ssThe previous UGLI tests have been resurrected but only test the log4j implementations to run the testssscd testssant -f ugli-test.xml runAllssThe UGLI names were retained to maintain the version historys but may be renamed after the expected smigration to Subversion.ssThe definition of org.apache.log4j.ULogger differs between SLF4J and non-SLF4J builds and the SLF4J sbuild contains an implementation of org.slf4j.LoggerFactory.  The build.core task will either compile the sfiles in the src/slf4j or src/no-slf4j directory depending on the value of the slf4j property.

message: ZOOKEEPER-898. C Client might not cleanup correctly during close (jared cantwell via mahadev)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.3@1028429 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: C Client might not cleanup correctly during close
description: I was looking through the c-client code and noticed a situation where a counter can be incorrectly incremented and a small memory leak can occur.ssIn zookeeper.c : add_completion()s if close_requested is trues then the completion will not be queued.  But at the ends outstanding_sync is still incremented and free() never called on the newly allocated completion_list_t.  ssI will submit for review a diff that I believe corrects this issue.

name: log4j
message: Bug 49003: SocketServerTestCase.test8 fails on Apache Harmonyssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/log4j/trunk@928150 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: SocketServerTestCase.test8 fails on Apache Harmony 6
description: This test sends an event to a SocketNode running in a different process.  The test expects that the hostID MDC value set in the receiver is integrated with the MDC values sent over the wire.  This magic apparently happens in Sun JVM's (though not obvious where it happens) but not on Apache Harmony.  The temporary fix is to explicitly set the hostID MDC value if a Harmony JVM is detected.ssNeeds further investigation to determine if this is an Apache Harmony bugs unreasonable test expectation or an log4j bug.

name: log4j
message: Bug 23021: AsyncAppender blocks on thread deathsssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/log4j/trunk@311433 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Queue reading thread in AsyncAppender blocks if a called appender throws a RuntimeException
description: The inner class Dispatcher in org.apache.log4j.AsyncAppender runs as a thread sand reads the logging event buffer which is filled by users of the sAsyncAppender. The Dispatcher thread reads from this buffer and calls the sappend method of all previously added Appenders (in the run() method).ssIf one of this appenders throws a RuntimeExceptions it is not catched anywheres sand the endless loop in the run() method is exited and the thread dies. The slogging event buffer is filled up until the buffer writer (in the main thread) sblockss which blocks the whole process. sAs Log4J usually is used as a trace modules such an error shall not block the swhole productive process. It would be better if RuntimeExcpetions whould be scatcheds proberly traced and then continued.

One ofsthe primary benefits of supporting and possibly migrating to Maven is generationsof the log4j web site allowing the current unmaintainable site generation codesto slowly fade away.ssTo build log4j with Maven 2.x (as of the initial commit on this bug):ss1. Install Maven 2.0.xs2. Build log4j.jar ssmvn jar:jarss4. Build sitessmvn site

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-485. Need ops documentation that details supervision of ZK server processes. (phunt via mahadev)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/trunk@915956 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: need ops documentation that details supervision of ZK server processes
description: We need ops documentation detailing what to do if the ZK server VM fails - by fail I mean the jvm processsexits/dies/crashes/etc...ssIn general a supervisor process should be used to start/stop/restart/etc... the ZK server vm.ssSomething like daemontools http://cr.yp.to/daemontools.html could be useds or more simply a wrapper scriptsshould monitor the status of the pid and restart if the jvm fails. It's up to the operators if this is not donesautomatically then it will have to be done manuallys by operator restarting the ZK server jvmssThe inherent behavior of ZK wrt to failures - ie that it automatically recovers as long as quorum is maintained - sfits into this nicely.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2201: Network issues can cause cluster to hang due to near-deadlocks(Donny Nadolny via rgs)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1683878 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Network issues can cause cluster to hang due to near-deadlock
description: {{DataTree.serializeNode}} synchronizes on the {{DataNode}} it is about to serialize then writes it out via {{OutputArchive.writeRecord}}s potentially to a network connection. Under default linux TCP settingss a network connection where the other side completely disappears will hang (blocking on the {{java.net.SocketOutputStream.socketWrite0}} call) for over 15 minutes. During this times any attempt to create/delete/modify the {{DataNode}} will cause the leader to hang at the beginning of the request processor chain:ss{noformat}s\ProcessThread(sid:5 cport:-1):\" prio=10 tid=0x00000000026f1800 nid=0x379c waiting for monitor entry [0x00007fe6c2a8c000]s   java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED (on object monitor)s        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.PrepRequestProcessor.getRecordForPath(PrepRequestProcessor.java:163)s        - waiting to lock <0x00000000d4cd9e28> (a org.apache.zookeeper.server.DataNode)s        - locked <0x00000000d2ef81d0> (a java.util.ArrayList)s        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.PrepRequestProcessor.pRequest2Txn(PrepRequestProcessor.java:345)s        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.PrepRequestProcessor.pRequest(PrepRequestProcessor.java:534)s        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.PrepRequestProcessor.run(PrepRequestProcessor.java:131)s{noformat}ssAdditionallys any attempt to send a snapshot to a follower or to disk will hang.ssBecause the ping packets are sent by another thread which is unaffecteds followers never time out and become leaders even though the cluster will make no progress until either the leader is killed or the TCP connection times out. This isn't exactly a deadlock since it will resolve itself eventuallys but as mentioned above this will take > 15 minutes with the default TCP retry settings in linux.ssA simple solution to this is: in {{DataTree.serializeNode}} we can take a copy of the contents of the {{DataNode}} (as is done with its children) in the synchronized blocks then call {{writeRecord}} with the copy of the {{DataNode}} outside of the original {{DataNode}} synchronized block."

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1395. node-watcher double-free redux (Mike Lundy via henryr)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.4@1307645 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: node-watcher double-free redux
description: This is basically the same issue as ZOOKEEPER-888 and ZOOKEEPER-740 (the latter is open as I write thiss but it was superseded by the fix that went in with 888). The problem still exists after the ZOOKEEPER-888 patchs however; it's just more difficult to trigger:ss1) Zookeeper notices connection losss schedules watcher_dispatchs2) Zookeeper notices session losss schedules watcher_dispatchs3) watcher_dispatch runs for connection losss4) pywatcher is freed due to is_unrecoverable being trues5) watcher_dispatch runs for session losss6) PyObject_CallObject attempts to run freed pywatcher with varying bad resultsssThe fix is easys the dispatcher should act on the state it is givens not the state of the world when it runs. (Patch attached). Reliably triggering the crash is tricky due to the races but it's not theoretical.

name: CommonsMath
message: MATH-480 - Fix ulp(Infinity) to return Infinity rather than NaNsMATH-478 - Adds ulp(float)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@1060910 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: FastMath is not an exact replacement for StrictMath||\ulp\" in \"FastMath\""
description: FastMath Javadoc says:ss\Fasters more accurates portable alternative to StrictMath.\"ssHowevers it does not implement the following StrictMath methods:sshypot(doubles double)sIEEEremainder(doubles double)ssNor the followings though it probably should:ssignum(float)sulp(float)ssFastMath implements the following additional methods:ssacosh(double)sasinh(double)satanh(double)snextAfter(doubles double)snextUp(double)ssI think this should be documented.||When the argument is infinites method \"ulp\" in \"FastMath\" produces \"NaN\" (whereas \"Math\" gives \"Infinity\").s"

name: Zookeeper
message: [ZOOKEEPER-110] Removed dependency on svnant; using a shell script to extract the revision number from SVN instead.ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/trunk@686294 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Build script relies on svnants which is not compatible with subversion 1.5 working copies
description: The current build.xml ant script uses svnant to obtain the latest revision number from the repos however svnant is not compatible with subversion 1.5 (http://subversion.tigris.org/svn_1.5_releasenotes.html)s and so the build fails with working copies checked out by this version.  The build fails with \this version of subversion is too olds please get a newer version...\"  This will become more apparent as svn 1.5 trickles out; I'm using a brand new dev environment with both subclipse 1.4 and svn 1.5 clients so I got bit rather quickly.ssThose with svn 1.5 can get the code from the trunks but cannot do an ant build.sssvnant hasn't been updated in more than a year and appears to be deads so it may no longer be a viable tool for the ant build."

title: Deadlock shutting down zookeeper
description: HBase recently upgraded to zookeeper 3.4.7ssIn one of the testss TestSplitLogManagers there is reproducible hang at the end of the test.sBelow is snippet from stack trace related to zookeeper:s{code}s\main-EventThread\" daemon prio=5 tid=0x00007fd27488a800 nid=0x6f1f waiting on condition [0x000000011834b000]s   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)s  at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)s  - parking to wait for  <0x00000007c5b8d3a0> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)s  at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:186)s  at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2043)s  at java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue.take(LinkedBlockingQueue.java:442)s  at org.apache.zookeeper.ClientCnxn$EventThread.run(ClientCnxn.java:501)ss\"main-SendThread(localhost:59510)\" daemon prio=5 tid=0x00007fd274eb4000 nid=0x9513 waiting on condition [0x0000000118042000]s   java.lang.Thread.State: TIMED_WAITING (sleeping)s  at java.lang.Thread.sleep(Native Method)s  at org.apache.zookeeper.client.StaticHostProvider.next(StaticHostProvider.java:101)s  at org.apache.zookeeper.ClientCnxn$SendThread.startConnect(ClientCnxn.java:997)s  at org.apache.zookeeper.ClientCnxn$SendThread.run(ClientCnxn.java:1060)ss\"SyncThread:0\" prio=5 tid=0x00007fd274d02000 nid=0x730f waiting for monitor entry [0x00000001170ac000]s   java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED (on object monitor)s  at org.apache.zookeeper.server.ZooKeeperServer.decInProcess(ZooKeeperServer.java:512)s  - waiting to lock <0x00000007c5b62128> (a org.apache.zookeeper.server.ZooKeeperServer)s  at org.apache.zookeeper.server.FinalRequestProcessor.processRequest(FinalRequestProcessor.java:144)s  at org.apache.zookeeper.server.SyncRequestProcessor.flush(SyncRequestProcessor.java:200)s  at org.apache.zookeeper.server.SyncRequestProcessor.run(SyncRequestProcessor.java:131)ss\"main-EventThread\" daemon prio=5 tid=0x00007fd2753a3800 nid=0x711b waiting on condition [0x0000000117a30000]s   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (parking)s  at sun.misc.Unsafe.park(Native Method)s  - parking to wait for  <0x00000007c9b106b8> (a java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject)s  at java.util.concurrent.locks.LockSupport.park(LockSupport.java:186)s  at java.util.concurrent.locks.AbstractQueuedSynchronizer$ConditionObject.await(AbstractQueuedSynchronizer.java:2043)s  at java.util.concurrent.LinkedBlockingQueue.take(LinkedBlockingQueue.java:442)s  at org.apache.zookeeper.ClientCnxn$EventThread.run(ClientCnxn.java:501)ss\"main\" prio=5 tid=0x00007fd276000000 nid=0x1903 in Object.wait() [0x0000000108aa1000]s   java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (on object monitor)s  at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method)s  - waiting on <0x00000007c5b66400> (a org.apache.zookeeper.server.SyncRequestProcessor)s  at java.lang.Thread.join(Thread.java:1281)s  - locked <0x00000007c5b66400> (a org.apache.zookeeper.server.SyncRequestProcessor)s  at java.lang.Thread.join(Thread.java:1355)s  at org.apache.zookeeper.server.SyncRequestProcessor.shutdown(SyncRequestProcessor.java:213)s  at org.apache.zookeeper.server.PrepRequestProcessor.shutdown(PrepRequestProcessor.java:770)s  at org.apache.zookeeper.server.ZooKeeperServer.shutdown(ZooKeeperServer.java:478)s  - locked <0x00000007c5b62128> (a org.apache.zookeeper.server.ZooKeeperServer)s  at org.apache.zookeeper.server.NIOServerCnxnFactory.shutdown(NIOServerCnxnFactory.java:266)s  at org.apache.hadoop.hbase.zookeeper.MiniZooKeeperCluster.shutdown(MiniZooKeeperCluster.java:301)s{code}sNote the address (0x00000007c5b66400) in the last hunk which seems to indicate some form of deadlock.ssAccording to Camille Fournier:ssWe made shutdown synchronized. But decrementing the requests issalso synchronized and called from a different thread. So yeahs deadlock.sThis came in with ZOOKEEPER-1907"

name: ant-ivy
message: revert part of the patch for IVY-1141s some unit tests are expecting the reverse
title: dependencies failed using branch attribute (and extra attrubutes)
description: *** Investigationsi tried to use the branch attribute inside my projekt DEV like this:ss	<ivy-module version=\1.1\">s		<info ... module=\"DEV\" ....ss		<dependency org=\"testng\" name=\"testng\" s			branch=\"mybranch1\" rev=\"latest.integration\"  s			conf=\"compilestests->default\"/>s		.....ssIf I now try to resolve my dependenciess it failedsbecause ivy 2.1.0 try to resolve the latest version (5.6) of testng/testngswhich has NO branch-keyword inside it's ivy.xml. The ivy.xmlsof version testng/testng/4.6 contains the following:ss<ivy-module version=\"1.1\">s    <infos        organisation=\"testng\" module=\"testng\"s        branch=\"mybranch1\"  revision=\"4.6.1.2\"s        status=\"release\"         s        publication=\"20060227000000\">s      .....ssIt looks like the resolver skip this 4.6.1.2 version (which is the only one containing the sbranch attribute \"mybranch1\") and try to download the 5.6 (containing NO branch attribute !). ssI go the following error message:ss[ivy:configure] :: Ivy 2.1.0 - 20090925235825 :: http://ant.apache.org/ivy/ ::s...s	---------------------------------------------------------------------s[ivy:resolve] :: problems summary ::s[ivy:resolve] :::: WARNINGSs[ivy:resolve] expected='mybranch1 found='null's[ivy:resolve] 		shared-web: bad branch name found in http://ivyrepos.dtnet.de/testng/testng/5.6/ivy.xml: expected='mybranch1 found='null's[ivy:resolve] s[ivy:resolve] :: USE VERBOSE OR DEBUG MESSAGE LEVEL FOR MORE DETAILSss*** Make it reproducablessI create a VERY small sample project (build.xml & ivy.xml)susing a sample ivyrepos on our server.ssCould somebody look closer to the problem by downloading the project froms    http://www.opensource-online.org/fileadmin/swd/ivy/ivy-test.zipssTo runs yust unzip and start \"ant -f build.xml\" and you can see the failure:ss[ivy:resolve]           ::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::::s[ivy:resolve]           ::          UNRESOLVED DEPENDENCIES         ::s[ivy:resolve] 'http:/swww.opensource-online.org/fileadmin/swd/ivy/testng/testng/5.6/ivy.xml': bad branch name: expected='mybranch1' found='';s[ivy:resolve] http://www.opensource-online.org/fileadmin/swd/ivy/testng/testng/5.6/ivy.xml: expected='mybsanch1 found=''s[ivy:resolve]s[ivy:resolve] :: USE VERBOSE OR DEBUG MESSAGE LEVEL FOR MORE DETAILSss*** Same problem using extra attributes instead auf branch attributesif tried a workaround not using the branch-keyword but defining a own extra atrribute like this:ss<ivy-module version=\"2.0\" xmlns:swd=\"http://softwaredemo.de/ivy/extra\">s ...s		<dependency org=\"testng\" name=\"testng\"  swd:suite=\"mybranch-e2\" rev=\"latest.integration\"  s					conf=\"compilestests->default\"/>ssBut name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-555. Add stat information to GetChildrenResponse. (Arni Jonson and phunt via mahadev)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/trunk@831486 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Add stat information to GetChildrenResponse
description: GetChildren() is the only non-create/delete API which does not include the node stat information. I propose that the definition of GetChildren() should be:ss    class GetChildrenResponse {s        vector<ustring> children;s        org.apache.zookeeper.data.Stat stat;s    }ssThere is a trivial fix to the server (FinalRequestProcessor.java): rsp = new GetChildrenResponse(childrens stat);ssAnd something similar to the  client library.s

title: SyslogAppender throws a NullPointerException upon misconfiguration
description: If the syslogappender is configured with a nonexistent syslog hosts it will sthrow a nullpointerexception from the java.net.DatagramSocket.send() method sthrough the SyslogWriter.write method.  This exception is thrown up through sthe application making the log calls which is not an appropriate outcome.

name: ant-ivy
message: FIX: Creation of symlinks problematic in Windows with Cygwin 1.7 (IVY-1165)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@905823 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: During retreieve: Creation of symlinks problematic in Windows with Cygwin 1.7
description: On Windows with the Cygwin 1.7 bin directory on the PATHs Ivy will create a ~1kb \symlink\" file instead of copying the jar to the ivylib directory. This causes the retrieve process to fail.sssAs described in [IVY-353|http://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/IVY-353]s the creation of symlinks with cygwin was problematic  for Windows systems. The fix as I understand it was to attempt to create a symlinks if that failed (the expected file did not exist) then copy the jar. That worked with the default configuration of Cygwin 1.5 which attempted to create Windows link (file.lnk) files. However as of 1.7 cygwin does not default to that behavior anymore and now Ivy fails in this case. ssFor either versions if cygwin's environment option \"winsymlinks\" is turned to off -- which 1.7 defaults to -- then Ivy won't successfully retrieve due to thinking that the creation of a symlink was successful."

name: ant-ivy
message: FIX: Ivy generates wrong revision in URL for Maven snapshots (IVY-1396) (merged from trunk)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/branches/2.3.x@1424748 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Ivy generating wrong revision in URL for sample Maven artifact
description: I'm having some troubles with Ivy resolving the wrong latest.integration for a Maven artifact. It is reading the Maven metadata (apparently)and determining that there is a 0.0.3-SNAPSHOT version. Strangelys it then attempts to retrieve a POM that is using both the 0.0.3-SNAPSHOT version from the metadata and a 0.0.1-SNAPSHOT version that it could have only discovered using the metadata for that particular versions as you will see below. As far as I can tells the Maven metadata is fine.ssI've put together a sample. A simples empty Maven artifacts and an Ivy build that resolves it.ssI deployed three version of Maven artifact at 0.0.1-SNAPSHOT. Each time I asked Ivy to resolves it was successful. When I updated the version to 0.0.2-SNAPSHOTs it began mixing the URLs.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2687: Deadlock while shutting down the Leader serverssLeader server enters into deadlock while shutting down itself. Shutdown of the leader server is called from the synchronized block which must be called from outside the synchronized block. For detail pls refer ZOOKEEPER-2380ssAuthor: Mohammad Arshad <arshad@apache.org>ssReviewers: Abraham Fine <afine@apache.org>s Rakesh Radhakrishnan <rakeshr@apache.org>ssCloses #176 from arshadmohammad/ZOOKEEPER-2687 and squashes the following commits:ss7551f5c [Mohammad Arshad] Fixed Rakesh's commentss1e3ed70 [Mohammad Arshad] ZOOKEEPER-2687:Deadlock while shutting down the Leader server.s
title: Deadlock between leader shutdown and forwarding ACK to the leader||Deadlock while shutting down the Leader server.
description: Zookeeper enters into deadlock while shutting down itselfs thus making zookeeper service unavailable as deadlocked server is a leader. Here is the thread dump:s{code}s\QuorumPeer[myid=1](plain=/0:0:0:0:0:0:0:0:2181)(secure=disabled)\" #25 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fbc502a6800 nid=0x834 in Object.wait() [0x00007fbc4d9a8000] ¬†¬†¬†¬† java.lang.Thread.State: WAITING (on object monitor) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at java.lang.Object.wait(Native Method) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at java.lang.Thread.join(Thread.java:1245) ¬†¬†¬†¬† - locked <s0x00000000feb78000> (a org.apache.zookeeper.server.SyncRequestProcessor) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at java.lang.Thread.join(Thread.java:1319) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.SyncRequestProcessor.shutdown(SyncRequestProcessor.java:196) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.ProposalRequestProcessor.shutdown(ProposalRequestProcessor.java:90) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.PrepRequestProcessor.shutdown(PrepRequestProcessor.java:1016) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.LeaderRequestProcessor.shutdown(LeaderRequestProcessor.java:78) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.ZooKeeperServer.shutdown(ZooKeeperServer.java:561) ¬†¬†¬†¬† - locked <s0x00000000feb61e20> (a org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.LeaderZooKeeperServer) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.QuorumZooKeeperServer.shutdown(QuorumZooKeeperServer.java:169) ¬†¬†¬†¬† - locked <s0x00000000feb61e20> (a org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.LeaderZooKeeperServer) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.LeaderZooKeeperServer.shutdown(LeaderZooKeeperServer.java:102) ¬†¬†¬†¬† - locked <s0x00000000feb61e20> (a org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.LeaderZooKeeperServer) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.Leader.shutdown(Leader.java:637) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.Leader.lead(Leader.java:590) ¬†¬†¬†¬† - locked <s0x00000000feb781a0> (a org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.Leader) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.QuorumPeer.run(QuorumPeer.java:1108)sss\"SyncThread:1\" #46 prio=5 os_prio=0 tid=0x00007fbc5848f000 nid=0x867 waiting for monitor entry [0x00007fbc4ca90000] ¬†¬†¬†¬† java.lang.Thread.State: BLOCKED (on object monitor) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.Leader.processAck(Leader.java:784) ¬†¬†¬†¬† - waiting to lock <0x00000000feb781a0> (a org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.Leader) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.AckRequestProcessor.processRequest(AckRequestProcessor.java:46) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.SyncRequestProcessor.flush(SyncRequestProcessor.java:183) ¬†¬†¬†¬† at org.apache.zookeeper.server.SyncRequestProcessor.run(SyncRequestProcessor.java:113)s{code}ssLeader.lead() calls shutdown() from the synchronized blocks it acquired lock on Leader.java instances{code}swhile (true) {s                synchronized (this) {s                long start = Time.currentElapsedTime();s				.....s{code}sIn the shutdown flow SyncThread is trying to acquire lock on the same Leader.java instance. ssLeader thread acquired lock and waiting for SyncThread shutdown. SyncThread waiting for the lock to complete its shutdown.  This is how ZooKeeper entered into deadlock||Leader server enters into deadlock while shutting down. This happens some time only.sThe reason and deadlock flow is same as ZOOKEEPER-2380.sshutdown was removed from synchronized block in ZOOKEEPER-2380sNow shutdown is called from synchronized block from another place.s{code}s// check leader running statussif (!this.isRunning()) {s    shutdown(\"Unexpected internal error\");s    return;s}s{code}"

message: FIX: Static revision replacement is not working when a dynamic revision is evicted by a transitive dependency (IVY-603) (with contribution from Matthias Kilian)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/incubator/ivy/core/trunk@577708 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Static revision replacement is not working when a dynamic revision is evicted by a transitive dependency.
description: If A depends on Bs rev=\1+\" (which resolves tos says A-1.2) and on Cs rev=\"2.0\"s *and* C-2.0 depends on As rev=\"2.2\"s i.e. if during resolution a dynamic dependency (A-1+ in this case) is evicted via a transitive dependency (A-2.2 via C-2.0)s the delivered Ivy-file still contains the A-1+ dependency.ssThis seems to be similar to IVY-404 and IVY-415s but maybe completely unrelated implementation-wise.ssI'll append testcases for both 1.4.x and trunk."

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-706: Large numbers of watches can cause session re-establishment to fails(Chris Thunes via rgs)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.5@1685203 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: large numbers of watches can cause session re-establishment to fail
description: If a client sets a large number of watches the \set watches\" operation during session re-establishment can fail.ssfor example:s WARN  [NIOServerCxn.Factory:22801:NIOServerCnxn@417] - Exception causing close of session 0xe727001201a4ee7c due to java.io.IOException: Len error 4348380ssin this case the client was a web monitoring app and had set both data and child watches on > 32k znodes.ssthere are two issues I see here we need to fix:ss1) handle this case properly (split up the set watches into multiple calls I guess...)s2) the session should have expired after the \"timeout\". however we seem to consider any message from the client as re-setting the expiration on the server side. Probably we should only consider messages from the client that are sent during an established sessions otherwise we can see this situation where the session is not established however the session is not expired either. Perhaps we should create another JIRA for this particular issue.sss"

title: 1.3 alpha 7 not compatible with older versions of log4j i.e 1.2.8
description: While trying to upgrade to 1.3alpha I get exceptions generated due to the sPriority class not having a DEBUG field when called from the commons-logging sjar file.ssI notice on decompilation that the Priority class now extends the Level class. sThis means that when I try to call a DEBUG level (or any other probably) I get sthe following error generated in my tomcat loggs (this is from an axis service)ss2005-06-21 19:46:21 StandardWrapperValve[AxisServlet]: Servlet.service() for sservlet AxisServlet threw exceptionsjavax.servlet.ServletException: Servlet execution threw an exceptions	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.internalDoFilters(ApplicationFilterChain.java:269)s	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.access$000s(ApplicationFilterChain.java:98)s	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain$1.runs(ApplicationFilterChain.java:176)s	at java.security.AccessController.doPrivileged(Native Method)s	at org.apache.catalina.core.ApplicationFilterChain.doFilters(ApplicationFilterChain.java:172)s	at name: ant-ivy
message: FIX: NPE in namespace transformation during the ivy:findrevision and ivy:resolve task execution (IVY-659) (thanks to Andrea Bernardo Ciddio)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@602022 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: NPE in namespace transformation during the ivy:findrevision and ivy:resolve task execution
description: While executing this ant codess{code:xml} s[...]s	<target name=\build\">s		<ivy:findrevision organisation=\"apache\" module=\"ant\" revision=\"latest.integration\" property=\"test\"/>s		<echo message=\"Latest revision: ${test}\" />s	</target>s[...]s{code}ssusing this ivy settings file:ss{code:xml}s<ivysettings>s	<settings defaultResolver=\"m2\" defaultConflictManager=\"all\" />s	<resolvers>s		<ibiblio name=\"m2\" m2compatible=\"true\"s				namespace=\"test-ns\" root=\"${public.root}\" pattern=\"${public.pattern}\" />s	</resolvers>s	<namespaces>s		<namespace name=\"test-ns\">s				<rule>s					<fromsystem>s						<src org=\".*\" module=\"([^-]+)[-]*.*\"/>s						<dest org=\"org.$o0.$m1\" module=\"$m0\" />s					</fromsystem>s					<tosystem>s						<src org=\"org\\.([^.]+)\\..*\" module=\".+\" />s						<dest org=\"$o1\" module=\"$m0\" />s					</tosystem>s				</rule>s			</namespace>s	</namespaces>s</ivysettings>s{code}ssa NullPointerException is raised:s{code}sjava.lang.NullPointerExceptions        at org.apache.ivy.plugins.namespace.MRIDTransformationRule$MridRuleMatcher.match(MRIDTransformationRule.java:38)s        at org.apache.ivy.plugins.namespace.MRIDTransformationRule.transform(MRIDTransformationRule.java:133)s        at org.apache.ivy.plugins.namespace.Namespace$2.transform(Namespace.java:65)s        at org.apache.ivy.core.module.descriptor.DefaultDependencyDescriptor.transformInstance(DefaultDependencyDescriptor.java:82)s        at org.apache.ivy.plugins.namespace.NameSpaceHelper.transform(NameSpaceHelper.java:42)s        at org.apache.ivy.plugins.resolver.AbstractResolver.toSystem(AbstractResolver.java:266)s        at org.apache.ivy.plugins.resolver.BasicResolver.parse(BasicResolver.java:426)s        at org.apache.ivy.plugins.resolver.BasicResolver.getDependency(BasicResolver.java:265)s        at org.apache.ivy.plugins.resolver.IBiblioResolver.getDependency(IBiblioResolver.java:206)s        at org.apache.ivy.core.resolve.ResolveEngine.findModule(ResolveEngine.java:945)s        at org.apache.ivy.Ivy.findModule(Ivy.java:642)s        at org.apache.ivy.ant.IvyFindRevision.doExecute(IvyFindRevision.java:98)s        at org.apache.ivy.ant.IvyTask.execute(IvyTask.java:275)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.UnknownElement.execute(UnknownElement.java:288)s        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor4.invoke(Unknown Source)s        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)s        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.dispatch.DispatchUtils.execute(DispatchUtils.java:105)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.Task.perform(Task.java:348)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.Target.execute(Target.java:357)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.Target.performTasks(Target.java:385)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeSortedTargets(Project.java:1329)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.helper.SingleCheckExecutor.executeTargets(SingleCheckExecutor.java:38)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeTargets(Project.java:1181)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.Ant.execute(Ant.java:416)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.taskdefs.CallTarget.execute(CallTarget.java:105)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.UnknownElement.execute(UnknownElement.java:288)s        at sun.reflect.GeneratedMethodAccessor4.invoke(Unknown Source)s        at sun.reflect.DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(DelegatingMethodAccessorImpl.java:25)s        at java.lang.reflect.Method.invoke(Method.java:597)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.dispatch.DispatchUtils.execute(DispatchUtils.java:105)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.Task.perform(Task.java:348)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.Target.execute(Target.java:357)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.Target.performTasks(Target.java:385)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeSortedTargets(Project.java:1329)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeTarget(Project.java:1298)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.helper.DefaultExecutor.executeTargets(DefaultExecutor.java:41)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.Project.executeTargets(Project.java:1181)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.Main.runBuild(Main.java:698)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.Main.startAnt(Main.java:199)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.launch.Launcher.run(Launcher.java:257)s        at org.apache.tools.ant.launch.Launcher.main(Launcher.java:104)s{code}ssThe same thing happens when calling ivy:resolve.sIt has something to do with the way the ResolveEngine creates the DependencyDescriptor:ss{code}s[...]stry {s   return r.getDependency(new DefaultDependencyDescriptor(ids true)s new ResolveData(thisss                    optionss new ConfigurationResolveReport(thiss mds \"default\"s nulls options)));s} catch (ParseException e) {s            throw new RuntimeException(\"problem while parsing repository module descriptor for \"s                    + id + \": \" + es e);s}s[...]s{code}ssthat does not set the parent revision id of the descriptor (leaving it null). After some digging into the code I wrote a simple patch that fixes this issue:ss{code}sIndex: org/apache/ivy/plugins/namespace/Namespace.javas===================================================================s--- org/apache/ivy/plugins/namespace/Namespace.java     (revision 601926)s+++ org/apache/ivy/plugins/namespace/Namespace.java     (working copy)s@@ -37s6 +37s8 @@s s     private NamespaceTransformer fromSystemTransformer = new NamespaceTransformer() {s         public ModuleRevisionId transform(ModuleRevisionId mrid) {s+               if (mrid == null)s+                       return null;s             for (Iterator iter = rules.iterator(); iter.hasNext();) {s                 NamespaceRule rule = (NamespaceRule) iter.next();s                 ModuleRevisionId nmrid = rule.getFromSystem().transform(mrid);s@@ -56s6 +58s8 @@s s     private NamespaceTransformer toSystemTransformer = new NamespaceTransformer() {s         public ModuleRevisionId transform(ModuleRevisionId mrid) {s+               if (mrid == null)s+                       return null;s             for (Iterator iter = rules.iterator(); iter.hasNext();) {s                 NamespaceRule rule = (NamespaceRule) iter.next();s                 ModuleRevisionId nmrid = rule.getToSystem().transform(mrid);ss{code}ssHope that's useful."

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1351. invalid test verification in MultiTransactionTest (phunt via camille)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1231809 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: invalid test verification in MultiTransactionTest
description: tests such as org.apache.zookeeper.test.MultiTransactionTest.testWatchesTriggered() are incorrect. Two issues I seess1) zk.sync is asyncs there is no guarantee that the watcher will be called subsequent to sync returningss{noformat}s        zk.sync(\/\"s nulls null);s        assertTrue(watcher.triggered); /// incorrect assumptions{noformat}ssThe callback needs to be implementeds only once the callback is called can we verify the trigger.ss2) trigger is not declared as volatiles even though it will be set in the context of a different thread (eventthread)ssSee https://builds.apache.org/view/S-Z/view/ZooKeeper/job/ZooKeeper-trunk-solaris/91/testReport/junit/org.apache.zookeeper.test/MultiTransactionTest/testWatchesTriggered/sfor an example of a false positive failuress{noformat}sjunit.framework.AssertionFailedErrors	at org.apache.zookeeper.test.MultiTransactionTest.testWatchesTriggered(MultiTransactionTest.java:236)s	at org.apache.zookeeper.JUnit4ZKTestRunner$LoggedInvokeMethod.evaluate(JUnit4ZKTestRunner.java:52)s{noformat}s"

INFO  [main:Leader@427] - Shutdown calledsjava.lang.Exception: shutdown Leader! reason: end of tests        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.Leader.shutdown(Leader.java:427)s        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.Zab1_0Test.testLastAcceptedEpoch(Zab1_0Test.java:211)s        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)s        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke(NativeMethodAccessorImpl.java:48)sss2012-07-11 23:17:15s584 [myid:] - ERROR [main:Leader@139] - Couldn't bind to port 33556sjava.net.BindException: Address already in uses        at java.net.PlainSocketImpl.bind(PlainSocketImpl.java:402)s        at java.net.ServerSocket.bind(ServerSocket.java:328)s        at java.net.ServerSocket.bind(ServerSocket.java:286)s        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.Leader.<init>(Leader.java:137)s        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.Zab1_0Test.createLeader(Zab1_0Test.java:810)s        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.Zab1_0Test.testLeaderInElectingFollowers(Zab1_0Test.java:224)s        at sun.reflect.NativeMethodAccessorImpl.invoke0(Native Method)ss2012-07-11 23:17:20s202 [myid:] - ERROR [LearnerHandler-bdvm039.svl.ibm.com/9.30.122.48:40153:LearnerHandler@559] - Unexspected exception causing shutdown while sock still opensjava.net.SocketTimeoutException: Read timed outs        at java.net.SocketInputStream.read(SocketInputStream.java:129)s        at java.io.BufferedInputStream.fill(BufferedInputStream.java:218)s        at java.io.BufferedInputStream.read(BufferedInputStream.java:237)s        at java.io.DataInputStream.readInt(DataInputStream.java:370)s        at org.apache.jute.BinaryInputArchive.readInt(BinaryInputArchive.java:63)s        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.QuorumPacket.deserialize(QuorumPacket.java:83)s        at org.apache.jute.BinaryInputArchive.readRecord(BinaryInputArchive.java:108)s        at org.apache.zookeeper.server.quorum.LearnerHandler.run(LearnerHandler.java:291)s2012-07-11 23:17:20s203 [myid:] - WARN  [LearnerHandler-bdvm039.svl.ibm.com/9.30.122.48:40153:LearnerHandler@569] - ****s*** GOODBYE bdvm039.svl.ibm.com/9.30.122.48:40153 ********s2012-07-11 23:17:20s204 [myid:] - INFO  [Thread-20:Leader@421] - Shutting downs2012-07-11 23:17:20s204 [myid:] - INFO  [Thread-20:Leader@427] - Shutdown calledsjava.lang.Exception: shutdown Leader! reason: lead endedssthis failure seems 33556 port is already useds but it is not in use with command check in fact. There is a hard code in unit tests we can improve it with code patch.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1340. multi problem - typical user operations are generating ERROR level messages in the server (phunt via mahadev)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1240949 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: multi problem - typical user operations are generating ERROR level messages in the server
description: Multi operations run by users are generating ERROR level messages in the server log even though they are typical user level operations that are not in any way impacting the servers example:ss{noformat}s2011-12-22 09:55:06s538 [myid:] - ERROR [ProcessThread(sid:0 cport:-1)::PrepRequestProcessor@545] - >>>> Got user-level KeeperException when processing sessionid:0x13466e9828c0000 type:multi cxid:0x3 zxid:0x2 txntype:2 reqpath:n/a Error Path:/nonexisting Error:KeeperErrorCode = NoNode for /nonexistings2011-12-22 09:55:06s538 [myid:] - ERROR [ProcessThread(sid:0 cport:-1)::PrepRequestProcessor@549] - >>>> ABORTING remaing MultiOp opss{noformat}ssThis is misleading. We should demote these messages to INFO level at the highest. (this is what we do for other such user operationss e.g. nonode)s

name: CommonsMath
message: Fixed error in factorial accuracy.  JIRA: MATH-240.ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@735781 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: MathUtils.factorial(n) fails for n >= 17
description: The result of MathUtils.factorial( n ) for n = 17s 18s 19 is wrongs probably because of rounding errors in the double calculations.ssReplace the first line of MathUtilsTest.testFactorial() byss        for (int i = 1; i <= 20; i++) {ssto check all valid arguments for the long result and see the failure.ssI suggest implementing a simple loop to multiply the long result - or even using a precomputed long[] - instead of adding logarithms.

name: velocity
message: RuntimeInstance.getProperty now returns value set with RuntimeInstance.setPropertys even before initialization.  Thanks to Claude Brisson for the patch.  VELOCITY-493.ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/velocity/engine/trunk@473760 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: RuntimeInstance.getProperty() should check overridingProperties  when not yet initialized
description: For consistencys RuntimeInstance.getProperty() should return the values previously set with setProperty() event when it hasn't already been initialized.ssruntimeInstance.setProperty(\foo\"s\"bar\");sSystem.out.println(runtimeInstance.getProperty(\"foo\")); // output \"null\"sruntimeInstance.init();sSystem.out.println(runtimeInstance.getProperty(\"foo\")); // output \"bar\"ss"

name: log4j
message: Bug 22894: Accept single backslashes in filenames in XML configssssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/log4j/trunk@311276 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Single backslash not accepted in File param value
description: If you enter a filepath with single backslashess the backslashes will be signored ( or converted to special characters such as newline or tabs depending son the character after the backslash ).  Sos for examples a filepath of:ssC:\MyDirectory\MyLog.txtsswill end up as the file:ssMyDirectoryMyLog.txtssin the current folder.  I looked at the log4j code and discovered that *all* sparameter values are processed via the method sorg.apache.log4j.helpers.OptionConverter.convertSpecialChars().  This method streats backslashes as an escape characters to support such things as \t for tab sand \n for newline.  A single backslash without an appropriate following scharacter is quietly consumed.ssSince tabss newliness and other special characters are not valid in filepathss sit would be nice if parameter values of type \File\" were not processed via the sconvertSpecialChars() method.  Since double backslashes should be supporteds stoos for backward compatibilitys I would suggest replacing the invocation of sconvertSpecialChars() with an invocation of a new method that simply replaces sdouble backslashes with single backslashess in the case where the param is of stype \"File\".  In this ways both double backslashes and single backslashes would sbe supported in filenames.ssThanksssTom CaulkinssSr. Systems DevelopersSAS Institute Inc.sCarys NC 27513"

title: C client builds with incorrect error codes in VisualStudio 2010+
description: It reports:swarning C4005: 'EWOULDBLOCK' : macro redefinitionswarning C4005: 'EINPROGRESS' : macro redefinitionssIn MSVS 2010+s these constants are now in <errno.h>.sWhat's worses they have different numeric values.ssPossible fix:sIn \src/c/include/winconfig.h\" :s#if _MSC_VER < 1600s#define EWOULDBLOCK WSAEWOULDBLOCKs#define EINPROGRESS WSAEINPROGRESSs#endifs"

name: CommonsMath
message: [MATH-718] fixed integer overflow problem identified as part of numerical stability problems with distributions.ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@1336915 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: inverseCumulativeProbability of BinomialDistribution returns wrong value for large trials.
description: The inverseCumulativeProbability method of the BinomialDistributionImpl class returns wrong value for large trials.  Following code will be reproduce the problem.ss{{System.out.println(new BinomialDistributionImpl(1000000s 0.5).inverseCumulativeProbability(0.5));}}ssThis returns 499525s though it should be 499999.ssI'm not sure how it should be fixeds but the cause is that the cumulativeProbability method returns Infinitys not NaN.  As the result the checkedCumulativeProbability method doesn't work as expected.

name: CommonsMath
message: added Eugene Kirpichov's patch to ignore zero weights in Loess interpolationsJIRA: MATH-296ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@903440 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: LoessInterpolator.smooth() not working correctly
description: I have been comparing LoessInterpolator.smooth output with the loessFit output from R (R-project.orgs probably the most widely used loess implementation) and have had strangely different numbers. I have created a small set to test the difference and something seems to be wrong with the smooth method but I do no know what and I do not understand the code.s*Example 1*s|x-input: |1.5| 3.0| 6| 8| 12|13| 22| 24|28|31|s|y-input: |3.1|6.1|3.1|2.1|1.4|5.1|5.1|6.1|7.1|7.2|s|Output LoessInterpolator.smooth():|NaN|NaN|NaN|NaN|NaN|NaN|NaN|NaN|NaN|NaN|s|Output from loessFit() from R: |3.191178027520974|3.0407201231474037|2.7089538903778636|2.7450823274490297|4.388011000549519|4.60078952381848|5.2988217587114805|5.867536388457898|6.7797794777879705|7.444888598397342|ss*Example 2 (same x-valuess y-values just floored)*s|x-input: |1.5| 3.0| 6| 8| 12|13| 22| 24|28|31|s|y-input: |3|6|3|2|1|5|5|6|7|7|s|Output LoessInterpolator.smooth(): |3|6|3|2|0.9999999999999005|5.0000000000001705|5|5.999999999999972|7|6.999999999999967|s|Output from loessFit() from R: |3.091423927353068|2.9411521572524237|2.60967950675505|2.7421759322272248|4.382996912300442|4.646774316632562|5.225153658563424|5.768301917477015|6.637079139313073|7.270482144410326|ssAs you see the output is practically the replicated y-input.sAt this point this funtionality is critical for us but I could not find any other suitable java-implementation. Help. Maybe this strange behaviour gives someone a clue?ss

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2311: assert in setup_randoms(Marshall McMullen via rgs)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.4@1718209 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: assert in setup_random
description: We've started seeing an assert failing inside setup_random at line 537:ss{code}s 528 static void setup_random()s 529 {s 530 #ifndef _WIN32          // TODO: better seeds 531     int seed;s 532     int fd = open(\/dev/urandom\"s O_RDONLY);s 533     if (fd == -1) {s 534         seed = getpid();s 535     } else {s 536         int rc = read(fds &seeds sizeof(seed));s 537         assert(rc == sizeof(seed));s 538         close(fd);s 539     }s 540     srandom(seed);s 541     srand48(seed);s 542 #endifs{code}ssThe core files show:ssProgram terminated with signal 6s Aborted.s#0  0x00007f9ff665a0d5 in raise () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6s#0  0x00007f9ff665a0d5 in raise () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6s#1  0x00007f9ff665d83b in abort () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6s#2  0x00007f9ff6652d9e in ?? () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6s#3  0x00007f9ff6652e42 in __assert_fail () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6s#4  0x00007f9ff8e4070a in setup_random () at src/zookeeper.c:476s#5  0x00007f9ff8e40d76 in resolve_hosts (zh=0x7f9fe14de400s hosts_in=0x7f9fd700f400 \"10.26.200.6:2181s10.26.200.7:2181s10.26.200.8:2181\"s avec=0x7f9fd87fab60) at src/zookeeper.c:730s#6  0x00007f9ff8e40e87 in update_addrs (zh=0x7f9fe14de400) at src/zookeeper.c:801s#7  0x00007f9ff8e44176 in zookeeper_interest (zh=0x7f9fe14de400s fd=0x7f9fd87fac4cs interest=0x7f9fd87fac50s tv=0x7f9fd87fac80) at src/zookeeper.c:1980s#8  0x00007f9ff8e553f5 in do_io (v=0x7f9fe14de400) at src/mt_adaptor.c:379s#9  0x00007f9ff804de9a in start_thread () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libpthread.so.0s#10 0x00007f9ff671738d in clone () from /lib/x86_64-linux-gnu/libc.so.6s#11 0x0000000000000000 in ?? ()ssI'm not sure what the underlying cause of this is... But POSIX always allows for a short read(2)s and any program MUST check for short reads... ssHas anyone else encountered this issue? We are seeing it rather frequently which is concerning."

name: CommonsMath
message: MATH-560sConstructors are not going to be removed in the 3.0 release.sssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/branches/MATH_2_X@1157395 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Incorrect @Deprecated tags added to no-args Solver constructors in org.apache.commons.math.analysis.solvers
description: During refactoring of the solverss an @Deprecated javadoc comment was added to the no argument constructor for a number of Solverss saying they would be removed for 3.0. ssThis is incorrect - there is no plan to remove those constructors. See the discussion on the user list on 2011-04-20. The @deprecated tag should be removed.ssThis causes deprecation warnings in previously compliant codes and should not.ssThis affects at least the following Solvers: MullerSolvers SecantSolvers NewtonSolver.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-783. committedLog in ZKDatabase is not properly synchronized (henry via mahadev)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.3@979474 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: committedLog in ZKDatabase is not properly synchronized
description: ZKDatabase.getCommittedLog() returns a reference to the LinkedList<Proposal> committedLog in ZKDatabase. This is then iterated over by at least one caller. ssI have seen a bug that causes a NPE in LinkedList.clear on committedLogs which I am pretty sure is due to the lack of synchronization. This bug has not been apparent in normal ZK operations but in code that I have that starts and stops a ZK server in process repeatedly (clear() is called from ZooKeeperServerMain.shutdown()). ssIt's better style to defensively copy the list in getCommittedLogs and to synchronize on the list in ZKDatabase.clear.ss

name: log4j
message: Bug 37930: JDK 1.4.2 fixesssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/logging/log4j/branches/v1_2-branch@538434 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Use Maven 2.x for site generation and possibly build
description: Maven is a Software Project Management tool (http://maven.apache.org).  One ofsthe primary benefits of supporting and possibly migrating to Maven is generationsof the log4j web site allowing the current unmaintainable site generation codesto slowly fade away.ssTo build log4j with Maven 2.x (as of the initial commit on this bug):ss1. Install Maven 2.0.xs2. Obtain required Sun Jars and installssmvn install:install-file -Dfile=jaf-1.0.2/activation.jar \s    -DgroupId=javax.activation \s    -DartifactId=activation -Dversion=1.0.2 -Dpackaging=jarssmvn install:install-file -Dfile=javamail-1.3.2/mail.jar \s    -DgroupId=javax.mail \s    -DartifactId=mail -Dversion=1.3.3 -Dpackaging=jarsssmvn install:install-file -Dfile=jms1.1/lib/jms.jar \s    -DgroupId=javax.jms \s    -DartifactId=jms -Dversion=1.1 -Dpackaging=jarsssmvn install:install-file -Dfile=jmx-1_2_1-bin/lib/jmxri.jar \s    -DgroupId=com.sun.jmx \s    -DartifactId=jmxri -Dversion=1.2.1 -Dpackaging=jarss3. Build log4j.jar ssmvn jar:jarss4. Build sitessmvn site

name: velocity
message: VELOCITY-753 make Object always less specific when comparing method parameter typesssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/velocity/engine/trunk@928988 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: IntrospectionUtils.isMethodInvocationConvertible() returns true for NumberFormat.format(double) method with a Float.class argument
description: NumberFormat has both a format(double) and format(Object) method. When evaluated against a Floats IntrospectionUtils is returning true. This causes Method.getBestMatch() to throw an AmbigouusException.ssI have included a failing test case below to show this issue.ssThanksssTimssimport java.io.StringReader;simport java.io.StringWriter;simport java.text.NumberFormat;ssimport junit.framework.TestCase;ssimport org.apache.velocity.VelocityContext;simport org.apache.velocity.app.Velocity;sspublic class VelocityFormatTest extends TestCase {ss	public void test_format_of_float() throws Exception {s		// verify format() outside of Velocitys		NumberFormat numberFormat = NumberFormat.getInstance();s		Float aFloat = new Float(5.23);s		assertEquals(\5.23\"s numberFormat.format(aFloat));ss		Velocity.init();s		VelocityContext context = new VelocityContext();s		context.put(\"numberFormatter\"s numberFormat);s		context.put(\"aFloat\"s aFloat);ss		StringWriter sw = new StringWriter();s		StringReader sr = new StringReader(s				\"float value is ${numberFormatter.format($aFloat)}\");s		Velocity.evaluate(contexts sws \"name\"s sr);ss		String expectedValue = \"float value is 5.23\";s		assertEquals(expectedValues sw.toString());s	}ss}s"

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1029: C client bug in zookeeper_init (if bad hostname is given) (fpj via cnauroth)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.4@1711566 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: C client bug in zookeeper_init (if bad hostname is given)
description: If you give invalid hostname to zookeeper_init methods it's not able to resolve its and it tries to do the cleanup (free buffer/completion lists/etc) . The adaptor_init() is not called for this code paths so the lockscond variables (for adaptors completion lists) are not initialized.ssAs part of the cleanup it's trying to clean up some buffers and acquires locks and unlocks (where the locks have not yet been initializeds so unlocking fails) s    lock_completion_list(&zh->sent_requests); -ÔÉ† pthread_mutex/cond not initializeds    tmp_list = zh->sent_requests;s    zh->sent_requests.head = 0;s    zh->sent_requests.last = 0;s    unlock_completion_list(&zh->sent_requests);  ÔÉ† trying to broadcast here on uninitialized condssIt should do error checking to see if locking succeeds before unlocking it. If Locking failss then appropriate error handling has to be done.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-600. TODO pondering about allocation behavior in zkpython may be removed (gustavo via mahadev)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/trunk@892001 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: TODO pondering about allocation behavior in zkpython may be removed
description: I suppose the TODO below is referring to the \path\" variable which is passed in as an output variable to PyArg_ParseTuple right below.  The TODO may be removeds since the code is right.  Code using PyArg_ParseTuple will borrow the reference from the calling codes since there's a stack behind the call to the enclosing function (pyzoo_get_children in this case) which won't go away until the function returns.sssIndex: src/contrib/zkpython/src/c/zookeeper.cs===================================================================s--- src/contrib/zkpython/src/c/zookeeper.c	(revision 885582)s+++ src/contrib/zkpython/src/c/zookeeper.c	(working copy)s@@ -774s8 +774s6 @@s s static PyObject *pyzoo_get_children(PyObject *selfs PyObject *args)s {s-  // TO DO: Does Python copy the string or the reference? If it's the formers-  // we should free the String_vectors   int zkhid;s   char *path;s   PyObject *watcherfn = Py_None;s"

name: ant-ivy
message: FIX: Memory leak in ModuleRevisionId.java (IVY-791)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/ant/ivy/core/trunk@644911 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Memory leak in ModuleRevisionId.java
description: In ModuleRevisionId.java an attempt is made to create a \canconical instance\" cache like {{String.intern()}} using this static field:ss{noformat}sprivate static final Map/*<ModuleRevisionIds ModuleRevisionId>*/ CACHE = new WeakHashMap();s{noformat}sThis doesn't work: each entry is both a key and a values so the strong reference to the key will never allow the weak reference to the value to be the only remaining references and so entries will never be dropped.ssYou have to wrap the keys in a WeakReference.ssSee [Classpath's implementation of String.intern()|http://cvs.savannah.gnu.org/viewvc/classpath/vm/reference/java/lang/VMString.java?root=classpath&view=markup] for an example.ss"

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-269. connectionloss- add more documentation to detail. (phunt and flavio via mahadev)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/trunk@739082 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: connectionloss - add more documentation to detail
description: discussion with users this should be better documented:s--------------sThere are basically 2 cases where you can see connectionloss:ss1) you call an operation on a session that is no longer alivess2) you are disconnected from a server when there are pending async operations to that server (you made an async request which has not yet completed)ssPatrickssKevin Burton wrote:s> Can this be thrown when using multiple servers as long as > 1 of them iss> online?s> Trying to figure out of I should try some type of reconnect if a singles> machine fails instead of failing altogether.s>s> Kevins>s

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-844. handle auth failure in java clientssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/hadoop/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.3@1005103 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: handle auth failure in java client
description: ClientCnxn.java currently has the following code:s  if (replyHdr.getXid() == -4) {s                // -2 is the xid for AuthPackets                // TODO: process AuthPacket heres                if (LOG.isDebugEnabled()) {s                    LOG.debug(\Got auth sessionid:0x\"s                            + Long.toHexString(sessionId));s                }s                return;s            }ssAuth failures appear to cause the server to disconnect but the client never gets a proper state change or notification that auth has faileds which makes handling this scenario very difficult as it causes the client to go into a loop of sending bad auths getting disconnecteds trying to reconnects sending bad auth agains over and over. s"

name: velocity
message: merge VELOCITY-658 fix from trunkssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/velocity/engine/branches/1.6.x@729717 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: $velocityHasNext does not work in nested loops
description: With this test case:ssassertEvalEquals(\test1 (a1;a2;a3)-test2 (a1;a2;a3)-test3 (a1;a2;a3)-test4 (a1;a2;a3)\"s s    \"#foreach ($value in $list)$value (#foreach ($val in $list2)$val#if( $velocityHasNext );#end#end)#if( $velocityHasNext )-#end#end\");             ssVelocity 1.6.1 (or current head) fails because the \"hasNext\" flag status of the outer foreach loop gets overwritten by the nested foreach loop. To fix this we need to save the status of the hasNext flag in Foreach directive just like we save the value of the counter.ssThis bug is related to VELOCITY-657 but is a separate bug."

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1851. Follower and Observer Request Processors Do Not Forward create2 Requests (Chris Chen via rakeshr)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1611732 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Follower and Observer Request Processors Do Not Forward create2 Requests
description: Recent changes to the Observer and Follower Request Processors switch on the request opcodes but create2 is left out. This leads to a condition where the create2 request is passed to the CommitProcessors but the leader never gets the requests the CommitProcessor can't find a matching requests so the client gets disconnected.ssAdded tests as well.

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-2470: ServerConfig#parse(String[]) ignores tickTimessAuthor: Edward Ribeiro <edward.ribeiro@gmail.com>ssReviewers: Michael Han <hanm@apache.org>s Rakesh Radhakrishnan <rakeshr@apache.org>ssCloses #125 from eribeiro/ZOOKEEPER-2470s
title: ServerConfig#parse(String[])  ignores tickTime
description: Based on bug report from ykgarfield:ssServerConfig#parse(String[]) method has the following code:ss    public void parse(String[] args) {s        ...s        if (args.length == 3) {s                tickTime = Integer.parseInt(args[2]);s        }s        if (args.length == 4) {s                maxClientCnxns = Integer.parseInt(args[3]);s        }s    }s    ```ssSo if args.length == 4 tickTime isn't parsed.

name: CommonsMath
message: Fixed faulty test for zero in TridiagonalTransformerssJIRA: MATH-652sReported and patched by Greg Sterijevskissgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/commons/proper/math/trunk@1234486 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: Tridiagonal QR decomposition has a faulty test for zero...
description: In the method getQT() of TriDiagonalTransformer we have:ss    public RealMatrix getQT() {s        if (cachedQt == null) {s            final int m = householderVectors.length;s            cachedQt = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(ms m);ss            // build up first part of the matrix by applying Householder transformss            for (int k = m - 1; k >= 1; --k) {s                final double[] hK = householderVectors[k - 1];s                cachedQt.setEntry(ks ks 1);s                final double inv = 1.0 / (secondary[k - 1] * hK[k]);s                if (hK[k] != 0.0) {s                    double beta = 1.0 / secondary[k - 1];ssThe faulty line is : final double inv = 1.0 / (secondary[k - 1] * hK[k]);sIt should be put after the test for the zeros eg:ss    public RealMatrix getQT() {s        if (cachedQt == null) {s            final int m = householderVectors.length;s            cachedQt = MatrixUtils.createRealMatrix(ms m);ss            // build up first part of the matrix by applying Householder transformss            for (int k = m - 1; k >= 1; --k) {s                final double[] hK = householderVectors[k - 1];s                cachedQt.setEntry(ks ks 1);s                if (hK[k] != 0.0) {s                    final double inv = 1.0 / (secondary[k - 1] * hK[k]);s                    double beta = 1.0 / secondary[k - 1];sss

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1174. FD leak when network unreachable (Ted Dunning via camille)ssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/trunk@1177042 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: FD leak when network unreachable
description: In the socket connection logic there are several errors that result in bad behavior.  The basic problem is that a socket is registered with a selector unconditionally when there are nuances that should be dealt with.  Firsts the socket may connect immediately.  Secondlys the connect may throw an exception.  In either of these two casess I don't think that the socket should be registered.ssI will attach a test case that demonstrates the problem.  I have been unable to create a unit test that exhibits the problem because I would have to mock the low level socket libraries to do so.  It would still be good to do so if somebody can figure out a good way.

name: CommonsMath
message: Modified getSumSquaredErrors method in SimpleRegression to always sreturn a non-negative result.sJIRA: MATH-85sReported by Mark OsbornsPatched by Luc Maisonobesssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/jakarta/commons/proper/math/trunk@419439 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: [math]  SimpleRegression getSumSquaredErrors
description: getSumSquaredErrors returns -ve value. See test below:sspublic void testSimpleRegression() {s		double[] y = {  8915.102s 8919.302s 8923.502};s		double[] x = { 1.107178495s 1.107264895s 1.107351295};s		double[] x2 = { 1.107178495E2s 1.107264895E2s 1.107351295E2};s		SimpleRegression reg = new SimpleRegression();s		for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {s			reg.addData(x[i]sy[i]);s		}s		assertTrue(reg.getSumSquaredErrors() >= 0.0); // OKs		reg.clear();s		for (int i = 0; i < x.length; i++) {s			reg.addData(x2[i]sy[i]);s		}s		assertTrue(reg.getSumSquaredErrors() >= 0.0); // FAILs		s	}

name: Zookeeper
message: ZOOKEEPER-1670: zookeeper should set a default value for SERVER_JVMFLAGS and CLIENT_JVMFLAGS so that memory usage is controlled (Arpit Gupta via fpj)ssssgit-svn-id: https://svn.apache.org/repos/asf/zookeeper/branches/branch-3.4@1519650 13f79535-47bb-0310-9956-ffa450edef68s
title: zookeeper should set a default value for SERVER_JVMFLAGS and CLIENT_JVMFLAGS so that memory usage is controlled
description: We noticed this with jdk 1.6 where if no heap size is set the process takes up to 1/4 of mem available on the machine.ssMore info http://stackoverflow.com/questions/3428251/is-there-a-default-xmx-setting-for-java-1-5ssYou can run the following command to see what are the defaults for your machiness{code}sjava -XX:+PrintFlagsFinal -version 2>&1 | grep -i -E 'heapsize|permsize|version's{code}ssAnd we noticed on two different class of machines that this was 1/4th of total memory on the machine.
